original: Śāṅkhāyanāraṇyakam
analyzed: śāṅkhāyana āraṇyakam
translated: The Aranyaka of Śāṅkhāyana

original: prajāpatir vai saṃvatsaraḥ /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: Prajāpati is indeed the year.

original: tasyaiṣa ātmā yan mahāvratam /
analyzed: tasya eṣaḥ ātmā yat mahāvratam
translated: His self is the Great Vow.

original: tasmād enat parasmai na śaṃsen net sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām ātmānaṃ parasmin dadhānīti //
analyzed: tasmāt enat parasmai na śaṃset na id sarveṣām bhūtānām ātmānam parasmin dadhāni iti
translated: Therefore one should not recite it to another, lest one place the self of all beings in another.

original: atho indrasyaiṣa ātmā yan mahāvratam /
analyzed: atha u indrasya eṣaḥ ātmā yat mahāvratam
translated: Moreover, this is the self of Indra, the Great Vow.

original: tasmād enat parasmai na śaṃsen ned indrasyātmānaṃ parasmin dadhānīti //
analyzed: tasmāt enat parasmai na śaṃset na id indrasya ātmānam parasmin dadhāni iti
translated: Therefore one should not recite it to another, lest one place Indra's self in another.

original: atho yam evaitam ṛṅmayaṃ yajurmayaṃ sāmamayaṃ puruṣaṃ saṃskurvanti tasyaiṣa ātmā yan mahāvratam /
analyzed: atha u yam eva etam ṛk mayam yajuḥ mayam sāma mayam puruṣam saṃskurvanti tasya eṣaḥ ātmā yat mahāvratam
translated: Moreover, this is the self of that person made of Ṛg, Yajuṣ and Sāman verses, the Great Vow.

original: tasmād enat parasmai na śaṃsen net sarveṣāṃ chandasām ātmanaṃ parasmin dadhānīti //
analyzed: tasmāt enat parasmai na śaṃset na id sarveṣām chandasām ātmanam parasmin dadhāni iti
translated: Therefore one should not recite it to another, lest one place the self of all the meters in another.

original: kāmaṃ tu sattriṇāṃ hotā śaṃset /
analyzed: kāmam tu sattriṇām hotā śaṃset
translated: But the Hotṛ may recite it to the Sattrins,

original: pitre vācāryāya vātmane haivāsya tacchandastaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: pitre vā ācāryāya vā ātmane ha eva asya tat chandastam bhavati
translated: to the father, to the teacher, or to himself. Then it becomes his own meter.

original: ātmanaiva tad yajñaṃ samardhayati /
analyzed: ātmanā eva tat yajñam samardhayati
translated: By means of his own self he completes the sacrifice.

original: tasya pañcaviśaḥ stomaḥ /
analyzed: tasya pañcaviśaḥ stomaḥ
translated: Its Stoma is Pañcaviṃśa.

original: caturviṃśatir vai saṃvatsarasyārdhamāsāḥ /
analyzed: caturviṃśatiḥ vai saṃvatsarasya ardha māsāḥ
translated: There are twenty-four half-months in the year.

original: saṃvatsarasyaivāptyai /
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya eva āptyai
translated: For the attainment of the year itself.

original: atho prajāpatir vai saṃvatsaraḥ pañcaviṃśaḥ /
analyzed: atha u prajāpatiḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ pañcaviṃśaḥ
translated: Now, the year is Prajapati, consisting of twenty-five parts.

original: atho caturviṃśo vai purastāt kṛto bhavati tasyaiṣa gatir yat pañcaviṃśaḥ /
analyzed: atha u caturviṃśaḥ vai purastāt kṛtaḥ bhavati tasya eṣa gatiḥ yat pañcaviṃśaḥ
translated: And before it has been made consisting of twenty-four parts. Its course is that it consists of twenty-five parts.

original: aindraśca ṛṣabhaḥ prājāpatyaścāja upālabhyau /
analyzed: aindraḥ ca ṛṣabhaḥ prājāpatyaḥ ca ajaḥ upālabhyau
translated: The bull is connected with Indra, the sheep with Prajapati.

original: aindraṃ vā etad ahaḥ /
analyzed: aindram vai etat ahar
translated: This day is indeed connected with Indra.

original: indra u vai prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ u vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: Indra is indeed Prajapati.

original: tat prājāpatyaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: tat prājāpatyam rūpam
translated: That is the form of Prajapati.

original: atho etad eva paśuṣvaindraṃ rūpaṃ yad ṛṣabhaḥ //
analyzed: atha u etat eva paśuṣu aindram rūpam yat ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: And moreover, this is indeed the form of the bull connected with Indra among the animals.

original: tasya viśoviśo vo atithim iti dvādaśarcam ājyam /
analyzed: tasya viśaḥ viśaḥ vaḥ atithim iti dvādaśa ṛcam ājyam
translated: For it, there is an Ajya (hymn) of twelve verses, We call upon the guest in every house.

original: dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsarasyaivāptyai /
analyzed: dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsarasya eva āptyai
translated: There are twelve months in the year, for the attainment of the year itself.

original: tasmin vai dve chandasī bhavato gāyatryaścānuṣṭubhaśca /
analyzed: tasmin vai dve chandasī bhavataḥ gāyatryaḥ ca anuṣṭubhaḥ ca
translated: In it, there are two meters, the Gayatri and the Anustubh.

original: agniṃ naro dīdhitibhiraraṇyor ityetat pañcaviṃśatyṛcam upasaṃśaṃsati /
analyzed: agnim naraḥ dīdhitibhiḥ araṇyoḥ iti etat pañcaviṃśati ṛcam upasaṃśaṃsati
translated: He recites the twenty-five-verse hymn beginning with The men with thoughts in the kindling wood for Agni.

original: pañcaviṃśo hi stomaḥ /
analyzed: pañcaviṃśaḥ hi stomaḥ
translated: For the Stoma is twenty-five.

original: tad vai śastraṃ samṛddhaṃ yat stomena saṃpadyate /
analyzed: tat vai śastram samṛddham yat stomena saṃpadyate
translated: That hymn is accomplished when it is completed with the Stoma.

original: tasmin vai dve chandasī bhavato virājaśca triṣṭubhaśca /
analyzed: tasmin vai dve chandasī bhavataḥ virājaḥ ca triṣṭubhaḥ ca
translated: In it, there are two meters, the Viraj and the Tristubh.

original: tāni catvāri saṃpadyante /
analyzed: tāni catvāri saṃpadyante
translated: Those make up four.

original: catuṣṭayaṃ vā idaṃ sarvam asyaiva sarvasyāptyai /
analyzed: catuṣṭayam vai idam sarvam asya eva sarvasya āptyai
translated: This is the whole (set of) four, for the obtainment of this whole (universe).

original: traiṣṭubhaḥ pragaḥ /
analyzed: traiṣṭubhaḥ pragaḥ
translated: The Prauga is in the Tristubh metre.

original: indrasyaivaitacchando yat triṣṭup /
analyzed: indrasya eva etat chandaḥ yat triṣṭubh
translated: The Tristubh is Indra's metre.

original: yad enaṃ svena chandasā samardhayati /
analyzed: yat enam svena chandasā samardhayati
translated: In that he completes it with its own metre,

original: kuvid aṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsa ity vāyavyaṃ mahadvad vṛdhavat /
analyzed: kuvid aṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ iti vāyavyam mahadvat vṛdhavat
translated: 'Who, indeed, by worship, by the growing ones' (is) the Vayu hymn, with the word 'great' and 'growing'.

original: mahadvat mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: With the word 'great', for this day is great.

original: ata evottaraṃ tṛcam aindravāyavaṃ yāvattarastanvo yāvadoja iti yāvannaraścakṣasā dīdhyānā ityetena rūpeṇa /
analyzed: atas eva uttaram tṛcam aindra vāyavam yāvattaraḥ tanvaḥ yāvat ojaḥ iti yāvat naraḥ cakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ iti etena rūpeṇa
translated: For this very reason, the next verse is the Indra-Vayu hymn, 'As far as the bodies, as far as the strength' (is) with the form 'As far as men with sight are shining'.

original: ud vāṃ cakṣurvaruṇa supratīkam iti maitrāvaruṇaṃ devayoreti sūryastatanvān ityetena rūpeṇa /
analyzed: ud vām cakṣuḥ varuṇa su pratīkam iti maitrāvaruṇam devayoḥ ā iti sūryaḥ tatanvān iti etena rūpeṇa
translated: 'Your eye, O Varuna, of fair appearance' (is) the Mitra-Varuna hymn, with the form 'The sun, the god, is spreading out his rays'.

original: ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānām ityāśvinaṃ yaṃ Suryasya duhitāvṛṇītetyetena rūpeṇa /
analyzed: kaḥ u śravat katamaḥ yajñiyānām iti āśvinam yam suryasya duhitā avṛṇīta iti etena rūpeṇa
translated: 'Who is the most famous of the sacrificers?' (is) the Asvins hymn, with the form 'Whom the daughter of Surya chooses'.

original: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur ityaindraṃ mahadvad vṛdhavat
analyzed: kathā mahān avṛdhat kasya hotuḥ iti aindram mahadvat vṛdhavat
translated: 'How did he grow great? Of what Hotri?' (is) the Indra hymn, with the word 'great' and 'growing'.

original: mahadvad mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: With the word 'great', for this day is great.

original: ko vastrāta vasavaḥ kau varūteti vaiśvadevaṃ sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martād ityetena rūpeṇa /
analyzed: kaḥ vastrāta vasavaḥ kau varūtā iti vaiśvadevam sahīyasaḥ varuṇa mitra martāt iti etena rūpeṇa
translated: Who are the Vasus in the cloth? Who are the two in the skin? - this is the Vaiśvadeva. The stronger Varuṇa and Mitra from the mortal - in this form.

original: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇeti sarasvataṃ dvārāvṛtasya subhago vyāvar ityetena rūpeṇa /
analyzed: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇā iti sarasvatam dvārāvṛtasya subhagaḥ vyāvaḥ iti etena rūpeṇa
translated: And May Sarasvatī favor us - this is the Sarasvatī. The fortunate one turns away from the guarded door - in this form.

original: eṣa vā u kadvāṃstraiṣṭubhas tṛcaklpto vāmadevyaḥ pragaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai u kadvān traiṣṭubhaḥ tṛca klptaḥ vāmadevyaḥ pragaḥ
translated: This is the one with the Kṛti meter, the one with the Triṣṭubh meter, the one with the three-verse section, the one with the Vāmadevya Prauga.

original: prajāpatir vai vāmadevaḥ prajāpatāveva tat sarvān kāman ṛdhnuvanti /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai vāmadevaḥ prajāpatau eva tat sarvān kāman ṛdhnuvanti
translated: Vāmadevya is Prajāpati. In Prajāpati they accomplish all their desires.

original: tad āhur na traiṣṭubhaṃ prātaḥsavanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tat āhuḥ na traiṣṭubham prātaḥsavanam syāt
translated: Regarding this they say: Let there not be a Triṣṭubh morning pressing.

original: mohayati klptachandaso yajñamukham /🔽aikāhikam eva syāt /
analyzed: mohayati klpta chandasaḥ yajña mukham  aikāhikam eva syāt
translated: It confuses the beginning of the sacrifice with the fixed meter.🔽Let it be only a one-day sacrifice.

original: brahma vā ekāhaḥ /
analyzed: brahma vai ekāhaḥ
translated: The one-day sacrifice is Brahman.

original: brahmaitad ahaḥ /
analyzed: brahma etat ahar
translated: This day is Brahman.

original: brahmaṇaiva tad brahma samardhayati //
analyzed: brahmaṇā eva tat brahma samardhayati
translated: By Brahman alone he prospers in Brahman.

original: ā tvā rathaṃ yathotaya iti marutvatīyasya pratipat /
analyzed: ā tvā ratham yathā ūtaye iti marutvatīyasya pratipad
translated: The opening verse of the Marutvatīya hymn is O Vasu, as if urged by the chariot.

original: idaṃ vaso sutam andha ityanucaraḥ /
analyzed: idam vaso sutam andhaḥ iti anucaraḥ
translated: The anucara verse is This Soma, O Vasu, has been pressed for you.

original: eṣa eva nitya ekāhātānaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva nityaḥ ekāha ātānaḥ
translated: This is the one with the fixed one-day ritual.

original: tasyoktaṃ brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: tasya uktam brāhmaṇam
translated: Its Brāhmaṇa has been explained.

original: asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivega iti vāsukraṃ pūrvaṃ śastvā mahā indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā ityetasmiṃstraiṣṭubhe nividaṃ dadhāti /
analyzed: asat su me jaritar sa abhivegaḥ iti vāsukram pūrvam śastvā mahāḥ indraḥ nṛ vat ā carṣaṇi prāḥ iti etasmin traiṣṭubhe nividam dadhāti
translated: 'The false one is my helper, O worshipper', having first recited the Vasat-verse, he places the Tristubh verse 'Great Indra, like a man, the leader of men' in the middle.

original: tad yad vāsukraṃ pūrvaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: tat yat vāsukram pūrvam śaṃsati
translated: Now, as to why he recites the Vasat-verse first.

original: indra u vai vasukraḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ u vai vasukraḥ
translated: Indra is indeed the Vasat-utterer.

original: atha yad mahā indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā iti mahadvat /
analyzed: atha yat mahāḥ indraḥ nṛvat ā carṣaṇi prāḥ iti mahadvat
translated: And as to why (he recites) 'Great Indra, like a man, the leader of men', it contains the word 'great',

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ //🔽athaitā ājyāhutīr juhoti /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar  atha etāḥ ājya āhutīḥ juhoti
translated: for this day is indeed great.🔽Then he offers these ghee oblations.

original: svastyayanam eva tat kurute /
analyzed: svastyayanam eva tat kurute
translated: He thereby makes a happy journey,

original: yajñasyaiva śāntyai yajamānānāṃ ca bhiṣajyāyai /
analyzed: yajñasya eva śāntyai yajamānānām ca bhiṣajyāyai
translated: for the peace of the sacrifice and for the healing of the sacrificers.

original: tā vā aṣṭau bhavanti /
analyzed: tāḥ vai aṣṭau bhavanti
translated: They are eight in number.

original: etābhir vai devāḥ sarvā aṣṭīr āśnuvata /
analyzed: etābhiḥ vai devāḥ sarvāḥ aṣṭīḥ āśnuvata
translated: By means of these the gods attained all the eightfold prosperity.

original: tatho evaitad yajamānā etābhir eva sarvā aṣṭīr aśnuvate /
analyzed: tathā u eva etat yajamānāḥ etābhiḥ eva sarvāḥ aṣṭīḥ aśnuvate
translated: In the same way the sacrificers by means of these attain all the eightfold prosperity.

original: athaitān parisādāñ japāñ japati /
analyzed: atha etān parisādām japām japati
translated: Then he murmurs these parisaṃsthā mantras.

original: parimādaḥ āpo vai parimādaḥ /
analyzed: parimādaḥ āpaḥ vai parimādaḥ
translated: The parisaṃsthā is indeed the waters,

original: adbhir hīdaṃ sarvaṃ parimattam /
analyzed: adbhiḥ hi idam sarvam parimattam
translated: for by the waters everything here is surrounded.

original: atha vai parimādaḥ /
analyzed: atha vai parimādaḥ
translated: Now the parisaṃsthā is indeed food.

original: annam etad uktham /🔽āpo vā annasyāyataḥ pūrvā āyanti /
analyzed: annam etat uktham  āpaḥ vai annasya ayataḥ pūrvāḥ āyanti
translated: This Uktha is food.🔽The waters go first.

original: āpaḥ parimādaḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ parimādaḥ
translated: The waters are the parisaṃsthā.

original: atha vai parimādo yan nakhāni dantās tanūr lomānīti /
analyzed: atha vai parimādaḥ yat nakhāni dantāḥ tanūḥ lomāni iti
translated: Now, indeed, there is confusion, for the nails, teeth, body, and hair.

original: tasmāt kṛtyāḥ saṃpadvatyo hi bhavanti /
analyzed: tasmāt kṛtyāḥ saṃpadvatyaḥ hi bhavanti
translated: Therefore, the rites are successful, for they are indeed prosperous.

original: pañcaviṃśatir nidhanam /
analyzed: pañcaviṃśatiḥ nidhanam
translated: The twenty-five is the Nidhana.

original: āṅgirasaṃ pratiṣṭhāyaiḥ tadrūpam /
analyzed: āṅgirasam pratiṣṭhāyaiḥ tad rūpam
translated: The Angirasa is based on the Prishthas, that is its form.

original: bhūtacchandāṃ sāma priyam indrasya dhāmopajagāmeti /
analyzed: bhūtacchandām sāma priyam indrasya dhāma upajagāma iti
translated: The Saman of the Priyam Indra's abode has come.

original: krośānukrośe /
analyzed: krośa anukrośe
translated: In the Krocha and Anukrocha.

original: arātsuḥ / apyeṣāṃ payaḥ /
analyzed: arātsuḥ api eṣām payaḥ
translated: Their milk has become.

original: arātsuḥ / arkaṃ cārkapuṣpaṃ ca /
analyzed: arātsuḥ arkam ca arkapuṣpam ca
translated: It has become. The Arka and the Arka flower.

original: ayaṃ vā agnirarkaḥ /
analyzed: ayam vai agniḥ arkaḥ
translated: This Agni is the Arka.

original: asāvādityo 'rkapuṣpam /
analyzed: asau ādityaḥ rka puṣpam
translated: This sun is the Arka flower.

original: teṣu yadā paryāyaṃ sāmagāḥ stuvate /
analyzed: teṣu yadā paryāyam sāmagāḥ stuvate
translated: When the Saman-singers chant in turn among them,

original: atha hotāram āhur anujapeti /🔽te yadi stuvīran athānujapet / yadi
analyzed: atha hotāram āhuḥ anujapa iti  te yadi stuvīran atha anujapet yadi
translated: then they say to the Hotar, Recite after (us).🔽If they were to chant, then he should recite after (them). If

original: caivaṃ stuvīran yadi ca stuvīran anveva japet //
analyzed: ca evam stuvīran yadi ca stuvīran anu eva japet
translated: they were to chant, or if they were not to chant, he should recite after (them).

original: tāni vā etani sapta devacchandāṃsi bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni vai sapta deva chandāṃsi bhavanti
translated: Those are the seven divine meters.

original: tasmād enān anujapet /
analyzed: tasmāt enān anujapet
translated: Therefore, he should recite after them.

original: atho aindraṃ vā etad ahaḥ /
analyzed: atha u aindram vai etat ahar
translated: Moreover, this day is connected with Indra.

original: aindrā japāḥ /
analyzed: aindrāḥ japāḥ
translated: The recitations are connected with Indra.

original: tasmād enān anujapet /
analyzed: tasmāt enān anujapet
translated: Therefore, he should recite after them.

original: athātraiva tiṣṭhann agniṃ yathāṅgam upatiṣṭhate namo nama iti /
analyzed: atha atra eva tiṣṭhan agnim yathāṅgam upatiṣṭhate namaḥ namaḥ iti
translated: Then, standing right there, he worships Agni according to the limbs, with Namah, nama!

original: nahi namaskāram ati devāḥ /
analyzed: nahi namaskāram ati devāḥ
translated: For the gods do not go beyond the salutation.

original: samiddhasyaivaitān bhāgān upatiṣṭheta yadyuttaravedau bhavati /
analyzed: samiddhasya eva etān bhāgān upatiṣṭheta yadi uttaravedau bhavati
translated: He should worship these parts of the kindled (fire). If it is in the northern altar,

original: athātraiva tiṣṭhann ādityam upatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: atha atra eva tiṣṭhan ādityam upatiṣṭhate
translated: then standing right there he worships the sun.

original: ākāśaṃ śālāyai kuryur iti haika āhuḥ /
analyzed: ākāśam śālāyai kuryuḥ iti ha eke āhuḥ
translated: They should make the sky the hall, so say some.

original: deśena tvevopatiṣṭheta tirohito ha vā eṣa etasmin parama ukthe parama āśiṣo vadati saṃ mahān mahatyādadhād iti /
analyzed: deśena tu eva upatiṣṭheta tirohitaḥ ha vai eṣaḥ etasmin parame ukthe parame āśiṣaḥ vadati sam mahān mahati ādadhāt iti
translated: But he should worship it by its place, for hidden in that highest hymn it speaks the highest blessings, The great one has joined with the great one.

original: agnir vai mahan iyaṃ pṛthivī mahatī /
analyzed: agniḥ vai mahan iyam pṛthivī mahatī
translated: The great one is Agni, the great one is this earth.

original: etau hi samadhattām /
analyzed: etau hi samadhattām
translated: For these two have joined together.

original: saṃ devo devyādadhād iti /
analyzed: sam devaḥ devyā adadhāt iti
translated: The god has joined with the goddess,

original: vāyur vai devo 'ntarikṣaṃ devī /
analyzed: vāyuḥ vai devaḥ ntarikṣam devī
translated: the god is Vayu, the goddess is the atmosphere.

original: etau hi samadhattām /🔽saṃ brahma brāhmaṇyādadhād iti /
analyzed: etau hi samadhattām  sam brahma brāhmaṇyā adadhāt iti
translated: For these two have joined together.🔽The Brahman has joined with the Brahmani,

original: asāv ādityo brahmāsau dyaur brāhmaṇī /
analyzed: asau ādityaḥ brahma asau dyauḥ brāhmaṇī
translated: the Brahman is yonder sun, the Brahmani is yonder sky.

original: etau hi samadhattām /
analyzed: etau hi samadhattām
translated: For these two have joined together.

original: tad imāl lokānt saṃdadhāti
analyzed: tat imān lokān saṃdadhāti
translated: He thus joins together these worlds

original: etad uktha śaṃsiṣyate //
analyzed: etat uktha śaṃsiṣyate
translated: when this hymn is being chanted.

original: viśvāmitro ha vā indrasya priyaṃ dhāmopajagāma śastreṇa ca vratacaryayā /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ ha vai indrasya priyam dhāma upajagāma śastreṇa ca vrata caryayā
translated: Visvamitra, indeed, approached Indra's beloved abode by means of his sacrificial rite and observance of vows.

original: taṃ hendra uvāca viśvāmitra varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti /
analyzed: tam ha indraḥ uvāca viśvāmitra varam vṛṇīṣva iti
translated: Indra said to him, Visvamitra, choose a boon.

original: sa hovāca viśvāmitras tvām eva vijānīyām iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca viśvāmitraḥ tvām eva vijānīyām iti
translated: Visvamitra said, May I know you.

original: dvitīyam iti /
analyzed: dvitīyam iti
translated: The second one.

original: tvām eveti /
analyzed: tvām eva iti
translated: You alone.

original: tṛtīyam iti /
analyzed: tṛtīyam iti
translated: The third one.

original: tvām eveti /
analyzed: tvām eva iti
translated: You alone.

original: taṃ hendra uvāca mahāṃśca mahatī cāsmi /
analyzed: tam ha indraḥ uvāca mahān ca mahatī ca asmi
translated: Then Indra said to him, I am the Great One and the Great One,

original: devaśca devī cāsmi /
analyzed: devaḥ ca devī ca asmi
translated: I am the god and the goddess,

original: brahma ca brāhmaṇī cāsmīti /
analyzed: brahma ca brāhmaṇī ca asmi iti
translated: I am the Brahman and the Brahmani.

original: tata u ha viśvāmitro vijijñāsām eva cakre /
analyzed: tatas u ha viśvāmitraḥ vijijñāsām eva cakre
translated: Then Vishvamitra himself became desirous of knowing.

original: taṃ hendra uvācaitad vā aham asmi yad etad avocaṃ yad vā ṛṣe 'to bhūyo 'tapās tadeva tat syād yad aham iti /
analyzed: tam ha indraḥ uvāca etat vai aham asmi yat etat avocam yat vai ṛṣe tat eva tat syāt yat aham iti
translated: Then Indra said to him, This is what I am, what I have said. O Rishi, if you have more austerities than this, that will be the same as if I were you.

original: tad vā indro vyāhṛtīr ūce tā upāptā āsann iti /
analyzed: tat vai indraḥ vyāhṛtīḥ ūce tāḥ upāptāḥ āsan iti
translated: Or Indra spoke the Vyahrtis, they became obtained.

original: athopanidhāya preṅkhaphalakaṃ trir abhyanya trir abhyavān iti //
analyzed: atha upanidhāya preṅkha phalakam tris abhyanya tris abhyavān iti
translated: Then placing the wooden sword, he recited three times, he praised three times.

original: tad vā audumbaraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat vai audumbaram bhavati
translated: That is made of Udumbara wood.

original: ūrg vā annādyam udumbara ūrjo 'nnādyasyopāptyai /
analyzed: ūrj vai annādyam udumbaraḥ ūrjaḥ annādyasya upāptyai
translated: The Udumbara is food and nourishment, for the obtaining of food and nourishment.

original: athainad urasā saṃspṛśya dakṣiṇaṃ bhāgam ātmano 'tiharañ japati arko 'si vasavastvā gāyatreṇa cchandasārohantu te ta āroḷhāra ityeva tad🔽tān aham anvārohāmi rājyāyeti /
analyzed: atha enat urasā saṃspṛśya dakṣiṇam bhāgam japati arkaḥ si vasavaḥ tvā gāyatreṇa chandasā ārohantu te te āroḷhāraḥ iti eva tat  tān aham anvārohāmi rājyāya iti
translated: Then touching it with his chest, moving it over the right part of his body, he murmurs, You are the Arka, may the Vasus ascend you with the Gayatri meter. May they ascend you, this is your ascending.🔽I ascend them for kingship.

original: rājyaṃ ha vā idam u haiva cakṣate /
analyzed: rājyam ha vai idam u ha eva cakṣate
translated: Kingship, indeed, they consider to be this very (world).

original: athottaraṃ bhāgam ātmano 'tiharañ japati rudrāstvā traiṣṭubhena chandasārohantu te ta āroḷhāra ityeva tad āha /
analyzed: atha uttaram bhāgam japati  rudrāḥ tvā traiṣṭubhena chandasā ārohantu te te āroḍhāraḥ iti eva tat āha
translated: Then, passing over the northern part of himself, he murmurs, 'May the Rudras mount thee with the Tristubh metre. They are thy mount. That is thy mount,' he says.

original: tān aham anvārohāmi svārājyāyeti /
analyzed: tān aham anvārohāmi svārājyāya iti
translated: 'I mount them for self-sovereignty,' (he says).

original: svārājyaṃ ha vai rājyād adhitarām iva /
analyzed: svārājyam ha vai rājyāt adhitarām iva
translated: Self-sovereignty, indeed, is higher than sovereignty, as it were.

original: atha dakṣiṇaṃ bhāgam ātmano 'tiharañ japati ādityāstvā jagatena cchandasārohantu te ta āroḷhāra ityeva tad āha /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇam bhāgam japati ādityāḥ tvā jagatena chandasā ārohantu te te āroḷhāraḥ iti eva tat āha
translated: Then, passing over the southern part of himself, he murmurs, 'May the Adityas mount thee with the Jagati metre. They are thy mount. That is thy mount,' he says.

original: tān aham anvārohāmi sāmrājyāyeti /
analyzed: tān aham anvārohāmi sāmrājyāya iti
translated: 'I mount them for universal sovereignty,' (he says).

original: sāmrājyaṃ ha vai svārājyād adhitarām iva /
analyzed: sāmrājyam ha vai svārājyāt adhitarām iva
translated: Universal sovereignty, indeed, is higher than self-sovereignty, as it were.

original: athottaraṃ bhāgam ātmano 'tiharañ japati viśve tvā devā ānuṣṭubhena chandasārohantu te ta āroḷhāra ityeva tad āha /
analyzed: atha uttaram bhāgam japati  / viśve tvā devāḥ ānuṣṭubhena chandasā ārohantu te te āroḷhāraḥ iti eva tat āha
translated: Then, passing over the northern part of himself, he murmurs, 'May the All-gods mount thee with the Anustubh metre. They are thy mount. That is thy mount,' he says.

original: tān aham anvārohāmi kāmaprāyeti /
analyzed: tān aham anvārohāmi kāmaprāya iti
translated: 'I mount them for the attainment of desire,' (he says).

original: kāmapraṃ ha vai sarveṣāṃ parārdhyam /
analyzed: kāmapram ha vai sarveṣām parārdhyam
translated: The attainment of desire, indeed, is the highest of all.

original: atha samadhisṛpya prāñcau pādā upāvahṛtya bhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: atha samadhisṛpya prāñcau pādau upāvahṛtya bhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Then, having crawled up (to the chariot), and having drawn the two front wheels down, he sets them on the ground.

original: udyatataro ha vā eṣo 'smāl lokād bhavati /
analyzed: udyatataraḥ ha vai eṣaḥ u smāt lokāt bhavati
translated: For he is higher above this world, as it were.

original: tad yat pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: tat yat pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Now, as to why he sets (the wheels) down.

original: tad asmil loke pratitiṣṭhati pratiṣṭhāyām
analyzed: tat asmin loke pratitiṣṭhati pratiṣṭhāyām
translated: That rests in this world, in the foundation,

original: apracyutyām /
analyzed: apracyutyām
translated: in the unfalling.

original: atha trit abhanya trir abhyavān iti /
analyzed: atha tris abhanya tris abhyavān iti
translated: Then he moves three times and fans three times.

original: athopari preṅkhaphalake dakṣiṇottariṇam upasthaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇena prādeśena paścāt prāṅ preṅkhaphalakam upaspṛśati /
analyzed: atha upari preṅkha phalake dakṣiṇa uttariṇam upastham kṛtvā dakṣiṇena prādeśena paścāt prāṅ preṅkha phalakam upaspṛśati
translated: Then, having placed the support on the upper cross-bar, south and north, he touches the cross-bar behind with his right thumb,

original: prajāpatiṣ ṭvā rohatu vāyuḥ preṅkhayatv iti /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ tvā rohatu vāyuḥ preṅkhayatu iti
translated: saying, May Prajapati ascend you, may Vayu shake you.

original: prajāpatir vā etad ārohati vāyuḥ preṅkhayati yaj jīvam /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai etat ārohati vāyuḥ preṅkhayati yat jīvam
translated: For Prajapati indeed ascends this, and Vayu shakes it, when it is living.

original: atha trir abhanya trir abhavān iti /
analyzed: atha tris abhanya tris abhavān iti
translated: Then he moves three times and fans three times.

original: atha prāñcau pāṇī parigṛhya japati //
analyzed: atha prāñcau pāṇī parigṛhya japati
translated: Then, having grasped his hands towards the east, he murmurs:

original: saṃ vāk prāṇena /
analyzed: sam vāc prāṇena
translated: Speech is united with breath,

original: sam ahaṃ prāṇena /
analyzed: sam aham prāṇena
translated: I am united with breath.

original: saṃ cakṣur manasā sam ahaṃ manasā /
analyzed: sam cakṣuḥ manasā sam aham manasā
translated: Eye is united with mind, I am united with mind.

original: saṃ prajāpatiḥ paśubhiḥ sam ahaṃ paśubhir ityāśiṣam eva tad vadate /
analyzed: sam prajāpatiḥ paśubhiḥ sam aham paśubhiḥ iti āśiṣam eva tat vadate
translated: Prajapati is united with cattle, I am united with cattle. He utters this blessing.

original: suparṇo 'si garutmān iti /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ si garutmān iti
translated: You are the eagle, Garuda.

original: prāṇo vai suparṇaḥ /🔽premāṃ vācaṃ vadiṣyāmīti pravadiṣyan hyeṣa etāṃ vācaṃ vadati bahu kariṣyantīṃ bahu kariṣyann iti /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai suparṇaḥ  pra imām vācam vadiṣyāmi iti pravadiṣyan hi eṣaḥ etām vācam vadati bahu kariṣyantīm bahu kariṣyan iti
translated: The eagle is indeed the breath.🔽I will speak this speech with love, for he is about to speak this speech with love. I will do much, for he is about to do much.

original: bahu hyeṣā vāk kariṣyantī bhavati /
analyzed: bahu hi eṣā vāc kariṣyantī bhavati
translated: For this speech is about to do much.

original: bahvayaṃ ya etasyāhnaḥ śastraṃ prāpnoti /🔽bahor bhūyaḥ kariṣyantīṃ bahor bhūyaḥ kariṣyann iti bahor bhūyo hyeṣā vāk kariṣyantī bhavati bahor bhūyo 'yaṃ ya etasyāhnaḥ śastraṃ prāpnoti
analyzed: bahu ayam yaḥ etasya ahnaḥ śastram prāpnoti  bahoḥ bhūyaḥ kariṣyantīm bahoḥ bhūyaḥ kariṣyan iti bahoḥ bhūyaḥ hi eṣā vāc kariṣyantī bhavati bahoḥ bhūyaḥ yam yaḥ etasya ahnaḥ śastram prāpnoti
translated: This is much, that one obtains the hymn of this day.🔽He says, Much more will she do, much more will he do, for this speech is about to do much more, and much more does he do who obtains the hymn of this day.

original: svar gamiṣyantīṃ svar gamiṣyann iti svar hyeṣā vāg gamiṣyantī bhavati svar ayaṃ ya etasyāhnaḥ śastraṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: svar gamiṣyantīm svar gamiṣyan iti svar hi eṣā vāc gamiṣyantī bhavati svar ayam yaḥ etasya ahnaḥ śastram prāpnoti
translated: He says, She is about to go to heaven, he is about to go to heaven, for this speech is about to go to heaven, and he who obtains the hymn of this day is about to go to heaven.

original: svar imān yajamānān vakṣyan ity eva brūyāt /
analyzed: svar imān yajamānān vakṣyan iti eva brūyāt
translated: He should say, He will carry these sacrificers to heaven.

original: yaṃ dviṣyāt taṃ brūyān nā nāmuṃ nāmum iti /
analyzed: yam dviṣyāt tam brūyāt na ā na amum na amum iti
translated: He should say, Not him, not him, of whom he is jealous.

original: sa yāvato ha vā eṣa etasmād devasthāt pratisaṃkhyāya nirdhūnute niṣ ṭad dhūnute /
analyzed: sa yāvataḥ ha vai eṣaḥ etasmāt deva sthāt pratisaṃkhyāya nirdhūnute niḥ tat dhūnute
translated: As many times as he shakes himself away from that divine place, so many times he shakes him away.

original: tau ha na bhogyāyaiva bhavataḥ /🔽tam evaitat pradharṣayati /
analyzed: tau ha na bhogyāya eva bhavataḥ  tam eva etat pradharṣayati
translated: They become fit only for enjoyment.🔽He overpowers him.

original: tam evaitat pradharṣyātman dhatte /
analyzed: tam eva etat pradharṣya ātman dhatte
translated: Having overpowered him, he takes him into himself.

original: vāyur vā eṣa prāṇo bhūtvaitad ukthaṃ śaṃsati /🔽tam evaitat pradharṣayati /🔽tam evaitat
analyzed: vāyuḥ vai eṣa prāṇaḥ bhūtvā etat uktham śaṃsati  tam eva etat pradharṣayati  tam eva etat
translated: This is Vayu, becoming Prana, he sings this hymn.🔽He overpowers him.🔽Having overpowered him,

original: pradharṣyātman dhatte /
analyzed: pradharṣya ātman dhatte
translated: he takes him into himself.

original: gurau vā eṣa yukto bhavati ya etasyāhnaḥ śatraṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: gurau vai eṣa yuktaḥ bhavati yaḥ etasya ahnaḥ śatram prāpnoti
translated: For one who attains the end of this day becomes united with the teacher.

original: tasya gurau yuktasyeśvaraḥ prāṇo yadi nāpaparājetoḥ /🔽tam evaitat pradharsayati /
analyzed: tasya gurau yuktasya īśvaraḥ prāṇaḥ yadi na apaparājetoḥ  tam eva etat pradharsayati
translated: If the teacher, united with the lord, does not conquer the vital breath,🔽he overpowers him.

original: tam evaitat pradharṣyātman dhatte /
analyzed: tam eva etat pradharṣya ātman dhatte
translated: Having overpowered him, he takes him into himself.

original: na ha vā etasyai devatāyai digdhena nāsinā na paraśunā na kenacanāvatardo 'sti /
analyzed: na ha vai etasyai devatāyai digdhena na asinā na paraśunā na kenacana avatardaḥ sti
translated: For this deity there is no injury by poisoned food, by a weapon, by an axe, or by anything at all.

original: tad ya evaṃ vidvāṃsam apavadati sa eva pāpīyān bhavati /
analyzed: tat yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam apavadati saḥ eva pāpīyān bhavati
translated: He who reviles one who knows this thus becomes worse.

original: na sa ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: na sa yaḥ evam veda
translated: Not he who knows thus.

original: naivaṃ viduṣo 'vatardo naivaṃ viduṣo 'vatardaḥ ////
analyzed: na evam viduṣaḥ vatardaḥ na evam viduṣaḥ vatardaḥ
translated: There is no injury to one who knows thus, there is no injury to one who knows thus.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake prathamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: hiṃkāreṇa pratipadyata etad uktham /🔽prāṇo vai hiṃkāraḥ prāṇenaivaitad ukthaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: hiṃkāreṇa pratipadyate etat uktham  prāṇaḥ vai hiṃkāraḥ prāṇena eva etat uktham pratipadyate
translated: He begins the hymn with the syllable 'him'.🔽The syllable 'him' is the vital breath; he begins the hymn with the vital breath itself.

original: atho ūrg vai raso hiṃkāra ūrjam eva tad rasam etasmin ukthe dadhāti /
analyzed: atha u ūrj vai rasaḥ hiṃkāraḥ ūrjam eva tat rasam etasmin ukthe dadhāti
translated: Moreover, the syllable 'him' is strength and essence; he places strength and essence in this hymn.

original: atho amṛtatvaṃ vai hiṃkāro 'mṛtatvam eva tad ātman dhatte /
analyzed: atha u amṛta tvam vai hiṃkāraḥ mṛta tvam eva tat ātman dhatte
translated: Moreover, the syllable 'him' is immortality; he places immortality in himself.

original: rājanaṃ pṛṣṭhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: rājanam pṛṣṭham bhavati
translated: The Rājan Sāman is the Pṛṣṭha (hymn).

original: etad vai pratyakṣaṃ sāma yad rājanam /
analyzed: etat vai pratyakṣam sāma yat rājanam
translated: This indeed is the direct Sāman, namely the Rājan.

original: tad enat svena sāmnā samardhayati /
analyzed: tat enat svena sāmnā samardhayati
translated: He thus makes it complete with its own Sāman.

original: tad aniruktāsu bhavati /
analyzed: tat aniruktāsu bhavati
translated: It is in the anirukta (formulas).

original: anirukta u vai prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: aniruktaḥ u vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: Prajāpati is indeed anirukta.

original: tat prājāpatyaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: tat prājāpatyam rūpam
translated: That is a form belonging to Prajāpati.

original: kavatīṣu syād iti haika āhuḥ /
analyzed: kavatīṣu syāt iti ha eke āhuḥ
translated: One should recite it in the kavatī verses, so say some.

original: ko vai prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: Who is Prajāpati?

original: tat prājāpatyaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: tat prājāpatyam rūpam
translated: That is a form belonging to Prajāpati.

original: athaitaṃ tūṣṇīṃśaṃsam upāṃśu śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etam tūṣṇīṃśaṃsam upāṃśu śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Tūṣṇīṃśaṃsa silently.

original: vāg vā etad ahar manas tūṣṇīṃśaṃsaḥ /
analyzed: vāc vai etat ahar manaḥ tūṣṇīṃśaṃsaḥ
translated: This day is speech, the Tūṣṇīṃśaṃsa is the mind.

original: manasaiva tad vācaṃ samardhayati /
analyzed: manasā eva tat vācam samardhayati
translated: By the mind he thus makes speech complete.

original: tad id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham iti stotriyastṛcaḥ /
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham iti stotriyaḥ tṛcaḥ
translated: That was the highest in the worlds - a Stotriya with three verses.

original: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojā iti vṛdhavan mahadvat /
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ iti vṛdhavat mahadvat
translated: Growing in strength, born with abundant power - with growth, with greatness.

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: For this day is indeed great.

original: sa eṣa ātmā pañcaviṃśaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ ātmā pañcaviṃśaḥ
translated: This is the twenty-fivefold self.

original: tan nadenupasṛṣṭaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: tat nadena upasṛṣṭam śaṃsati
translated: He recites it connected with the Nāda.

original: ātmā vai pañcaviṃśaḥ prajā paśava upasargaḥ /
analyzed: ātmā vai pañcaviṃśaḥ prajā paśavaḥ upasargaḥ
translated: The twenty-fivefold is the self, the Upasargas are offspring and cattle.

original: prajayaiva tat paśubhiḥ preṣyair annādyenetyātmānam upasṛjate /
analyzed: prajayā eva tat paśubhiḥ preṣyaiḥ annādyena iti ātmānam upasṛjate
translated: By means of offspring, by means of servants, by means of food, he thus connects the self.

original: nadaṃ va odatīnām iti traiṣṭubhāni pūrvāṇi padāni karoti nadasyottarāṇi /
analyzed: nadam vaḥ odatīnām iti traiṣṭubhāni pūrvāṇi padāni karoti nadasya uttarāṇi
translated: He makes the first words in the Triṣṭubh meter, The roaring of the flowing ones, and the Nāda the last.

original: prathamena traiṣṭubhena padena prathamaṃ nadasya padam uṣasamādhāyāvasyati /
analyzed: prathamena traiṣṭubhena padena prathamam nadasya padam uṣasam ādhāya avasyati
translated: With the first Tristubh verse he joins the first step of the river with the dawn and waits.

original: dvitīyena traiṣṭubhena dvitīyaṃ saṃdhāya praṇauti /
analyzed: dvitīyena traiṣṭubhena dvitīyam saṃdhāya praṇauti
translated: With the second Tristubh he joins the second [step] and breathes.

original: tṛtīyena traiṣṭubhena tṛtīyaṃ saṃdhāyāvasyati /
analyzed: tṛtīyena traiṣṭubhena tṛtīyam saṃdhāya avasyati
translated: With the third Tristubh he joins the third [step] and waits.

original: caturthena traiṣṭubhena caturthaṃ saṃdhāya praṇauti /
analyzed: caturthena traiṣṭubhena caturtham saṃdhāya praṇauti
translated: With the fourth Tristubh he joins the fourth [step] and breathes.

original: evaṃ vihṛtāṃ prathamāṃ triḥ śaṃsati /
analyzed: evam vihṛtām prathamām tris śaṃsati
translated: Thus he recites the first [verse] three times, divided in this way.

original: parācīr uttarā evaṃ vihṛtā eva /
analyzed: parācīḥ uttarāḥ evam vihṛtāḥ eva
translated: The other [verses] are recited in the same way, divided in this way.

original: yā tṛtīyā sūktasya tasyā uttaram ardharcam utsṛjati nadasya cottaram /
analyzed: yā tṛtīyā sūktasya tasyāḥ uttaram ardharcam utsṛjati nadasya ca uttaram
translated: He omits the second half of the third [verse] of the hymn and the second [half] of the river [verse].

original: so 'yaṃ mukhasya vivaras tena vācaṃ vadati mukhena vai vācaṃ vadati /
analyzed: saḥ yam mukhasya vivaraḥ tena vācam vadati mukhena vai vācam vadati
translated: This is the opening of the mouth, through which he speaks with the voice. One speaks with the voice through the mouth.

original: tau purastād dvipadānāṃ śaṃsati tathā hāsya stotriyānantarhitā bhavatyātmānaṃ śastvā /🔽atha sūdadohasaṃ parvāṇi saṃhitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tau purastāt dvipadānām śaṃsati tathā ha asya stotriyā an antarhitā bhavati ātmānam śastvā  atha sūdadohasam parvāṇi saṃhitāni bhavanti
translated: He recites these two [verses] before the two-footed [verses], so that the Stotriya is not interrupted. Having praised himself,🔽then the Soodak-Doha. The joints become connected.

original: atho āpo vai sūdadohā adbhir vā imāni parvāṇi saṃhitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: atha u āpaḥ vai sūdadohāḥ adbhiḥ vai imāni parvāṇi saṃhitāni bhavanti
translated: Then the Soodak-Doha is indeed the waters. Through the waters these joints become connected.

original: atho amṛtatvaṃ vai sūdadohā amṛtatvaṃ eva tad ātman dhatte /
analyzed: atha u amṛta tvam vai sūdadohāḥ amṛta tvam eva tat ātman dhatte
translated: Then the Soodak-Doha is indeed immortality. He places immortality in himself.

original: atha vai sūdadohāsyaitad rūpam /
analyzed: atha vai sūdadohāḥ asya etat rūpam
translated: Now, this is the form of the Sûdadohas.

original: tad yathā ha vai dāruṇaḥ śleṣma saṃśleṣaṇaṃ syāt paricarmaṇyaṃ vaivam tṛcāśītir evasūdadohāḥ sarveṣāṃ vedānāṃ śaṃśleṣiṇī //
analyzed: tat yathā ha vai dāruṇaḥ śleṣma saṃśleṣaṇam syāt paricarmaṇyam vā evam tṛca aśītiḥ eva sūdadohāḥ sarveṣām vedānām śaṃśleṣiṇī
translated: Just as a wooden splint is a bandage, so the Sûdadohas, consisting of eighty-four Rikverses, is a bandage for all the Vedas.

original: athetāni śīrṣṇyāni śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha itāni śīrṣṇyāni śaṃsati
translated: Now he recites those (verses) relating to the head.

original: tāni vai trīṇi tṛcāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni vai trīṇi tṛcāni bhavanti
translated: They are three Rik-verses.

original: trīṇi vā asya śīrṣṇaḥ kapālāni bhavanti /
analyzed: trīṇi vai asya śīrṣṇaḥ kapālāni bhavanti
translated: There are three skull-bones of his head.

original: tānyevaitaiḥ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: tāni eva etaiḥ saṃdadhāti
translated: He joins them together by means of these (verses).

original: tāni trīṇi punarevaikaṃ tredhā tredhā tā nava ṛco bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni trīṇi punar eva ekam tredhā tredhā tāḥ nava ṛcaḥ bhavanti
translated: Those three (bones) again are one, divided into three parts, and thus they are nine Rik-verses.

original: nava vai śirasi prāṇāḥ /
analyzed: nava vai śirasi prāṇāḥ
translated: There are nine vital airs in the head.

original: tānyarkavanti bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni arkavanti bhavanti
translated: They contain the syllable 'ark.'

original: tad etasyāhno rūpam //
analyzed: tat etasya ahnaḥ rūpam
translated: That is the form of this day.

original: athaitaṃ graivaṃ śaṃsati /🔽tā vai tisra ṛco bhavanti /
analyzed: atha etam graivam śaṃsati  tāḥ vai tisraḥ ṛcaḥ bhavanti
translated: Now he recites that (verse) relating to the neck.🔽It is three Rik-verses.

original: trīṇi vā āsāṃ grīvāṇāṃ parvāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: trīṇi vai āsām grīvāṇām parvāṇi bhavanti
translated: There are three joints of its neck.

original: tānyevaitābhiḥ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: tāni eva etābhiḥ saṃdadhāti
translated: He joins them together by means of these (verses).

original: uṣṇig uttamā /
analyzed: uṣṇih uttamā
translated: The last one is an Uṣṇih.

original: so 'yaṃ skandho vidalo 'vyūḷhaḥ laḥ //
analyzed: saḥ yam skandhaḥ vidalaḥ vyūḍhaḥ laḥ
translated: This is the shoulder, the rib, the loose (part), the L.

original: athaitāṃ akṣāṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etām akṣām śaṃsati
translated: Now he recites that (verse) relating to the eye.

original: sā vai triṣṭub bhavati /
analyzed: sā vai triṣṭubh bhavati
translated: It is a Trishtubh verse.

original: tasmād akṣaḥ sthaviṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt akṣaḥ sthaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Therefore the eye is the largest.

original: ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū iti bāhvor abhirūpā /
analyzed: ṛṣvā te indra sthavirasya bāhū iti bāhvoḥ abhirūpā
translated: Your arms, O Indra, are mighty, O thou of great strength, are the appropriate arms.

original: atha rathantarasya stotriyānurūpau śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha rathantarasya stotriya anurūpau śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Stotriya and Anuvakya of the Rathantara.

original: tayor uktaṃ brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: tayoḥ uktam brāhmaṇam
translated: The Brâhmana of them has been explained.

original: atha dhāyyāṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha dhāyyām śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Dhâyya.

original: iyaṃ vai dhāyyā /
analyzed: iyam vai dhāyyā
translated: The Dhâyya is this (earth);

original: iyaṃ hi sarveṣu bhūteṣu hitā /
analyzed: iyam hi sarveṣu bhūteṣu hitā
translated: for this (earth) is beneficial to all beings.

original: sā vai dakṣiṇe bhāge dhīyate /
analyzed: sā vai dakṣiṇe bhāge dhīyate
translated: It is placed on the right side (of the altar);

original: tasmād dakṣiṇaṃ bhāgaṃ puṃsaḥ stryadhiśete /
analyzed: tasmāt dakṣiṇam bhāgam puṃsaḥ strī adhiśete
translated: therefore a woman lies on the right side of a man.

original: atha rāthantaraṃ pragāthaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha rāthantaram pragātham śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Rathantera Pragâtha.

original: tasyoktaṃ brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: tasya uktam brāhmaṇam
translated: The Brâhmana of it has been explained.

original: sa eka id dhavyaś carṣaṇīnām iti sūktaṃ tat pacchaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ekaḥ id havyaḥ carṣaṇīnām iti sūktam tat pacchas
translated: The hymn 'He alone is to be worshipped by the men' (Rig-Veda, VI, 47, 1) is that (verse).

original: tasya dvitīyām uddhṛtya viśvo hyanyo arirājagāmeti /
analyzed: tasya dvitīyām uddhṛtya viśvaḥ hi anyaḥ arirājagāma iti
translated: Having taken out the second (verse) of it, (he recites) 'For all others, indeed, the king of enemies has come' (Rig-Veda, VI, 47, 2).

original: yaitasya dvitīyā tām iha dvitīyāṃ karoti /🔽tad imau pakṣau vyatiṣajatyavivarhāya //
analyzed: yā etasya dvitīyā tām iha dvitīyām karoti  tat imau pakṣau vyatiṣajati a vivarhāya
translated: The second (verse) of this (hymn) he makes the second here.🔽He thus interlinks these two wings, to prevent their being separated.

original: athaitaṃ prahastakaṃ śaṃsati /🔽tā vai tisra ṛco bhavanti /
analyzed: atha etam prahastakam śaṃsati  tāḥ vai tisraḥ ṛcaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then he recites this Prahasthâka.🔽It consists of three verses;

original: trīṇi vā asya pāṇeḥ parvāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: trīṇi vai asya pāṇeḥ parvāṇi bhavanti
translated: for there are three joints in his (Agni's) hand.

original: tānyevaitābhiḥ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: tāni eva etābhiḥ saṃdadhāti
translated: He thus unites them by means of these (verses).

original: aticchandāḥ prathamā so 'yam aṅguṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: aticchandāḥ prathamā saḥ yam aṅguṣṭhaḥ
translated: The first (verse) is an Atichhandas; this is the thumb.

original: tasmād ayam aṅguṣṭhaḥ sarvā aṅgulīḥ pratyeti /
analyzed: tasmāt ayam aṅguṣṭhaḥ sarvāḥ aṅgulīḥ pratyeti
translated: Therefore this thumb is related to all the fingers.

original: dakṣiṇaḥ pakṣo rāthantaraḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇaḥ pakṣaḥ rāthantaraḥ
translated: The right wing is the Rathantara.

original: atha vā uttaraḥ pakṣo bārhataḥ /
analyzed: atha vai uttaraḥ pakṣaḥ bārhataḥ
translated: Or the left wing is the Brhat.

original: etenaivokto brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: etena eva uktaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The Brahman is stated by this very (text).

original: tau vā etau pakṣau bārhatarāthantarau caturviṃśau /
analyzed: tau vai etau pakṣau bārhata rāthantarau caturviṃśau
translated: Those two wings are the Brhat and Rathantara, consisting of twenty-four (verses).

original: caturviṃśatir vai saṃvatsarasyārdhamāsāḥ saṃvatsarasyāptyai //
analyzed: caturviṃśatiḥ vai saṃvatsarasya ardha māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya āptyai
translated: There are twenty-four half-months in a year, for the attainment of the year.

original: athaitāni caturuttarāṇi śaṃsati tad anūkam /🔽tā ekaviṃśatir ṛco bhavanti /
analyzed: atha etāni caturuttarāṇi śaṃsati tat anūkam  tāḥ ekaviṃśatiḥ ṛcaḥ bhavanti
translated: Then he recites these (verses) increasing by four. That is the spine.🔽They are twenty-one verses.

original: ekaviṃśatir vā asyānūkasya parvāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: ekaviṃśatiḥ vai asya anūkasya parvāṇi bhavanti
translated: There are twenty-one joints in this spine.

original: tānyevaitābhiḥ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: tāni eva etābhiḥ saṃdadhāti
translated: He joins them with these (verses).

original: tāni vai sapta tṛcāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni vai sapta tṛcāni bhavanti
translated: They are seven Ṛc verses.

original: sapta vai chandāṃsi sarveṣām eva chandasām āptyai /
analyzed: sapta vai chandāṃsi sarveṣām eva chandasām āptyai
translated: There are seven metres, for the attainment of all the metres.

original: tānyarkavanti bhavanti /
analyzed: tāni arkavanti bhavanti
translated: They have the Arka (metre).

original: tad etasyāhno rūpam //
analyzed: tat etasya ahnaḥ rūpam
translated: That is the form of this day.

original: athaitā aśītīḥ śaṃsati /🔽stotriyān evaitābhir anuśaṃsati gāyatryā gāyatram auṣṇihyā ca bārhatyā ca bṛhadrathantare /
analyzed: atha etāḥ aśītīḥ śaṃsati  stotriyān eva etābhiḥ anuśaṃsati gāyatryā gāyatram auṣṇihyā ca bārhatyā ca bṛhat rathantare
translated: Then he recites these eighty (verses).🔽With these he recites the Stotriya verses: the Gāyatrī (verses) the Gāyatrī, the Aupacchandasī and the Bṛhatī the Bṛhat and Rathantara.

original: iyam eva dakṣiṇaṃ pārśvaṃ gāyatrī savyam auṣṇihī madhyaṃ bārhatī /
analyzed: iyam eva dakṣiṇam pārśvam gāyatrī savyam auṣṇihī madhyam bārhatī
translated: The Gāyatrī is the right side of this (altar), the Aupacchandasī the left, the Bṛhatī the middle.

original: madhye vā idam ātmano 'nnaṃ dhīyate /
analyzed: madhye vai idam ātmanaḥ nnam dhīyate
translated: In the middle, indeed, food is placed in the middle of the body.

original: triṣṭubhāvantareṇa triṣṭum naividī /
analyzed: triṣṭubhau antareṇa triṣṭubh naividī
translated: With a Tristubh-ending, a Tristubh Nividhi.

original: vaiśvāmitryāvarkavatyāvabhirūpe /
analyzed: vaiśvāmitryau arkavatyau abhirūpe
translated: The two Vaishvadevya verses with the Arka verse are beautiful.

original: viśvāmitro hyenad apaśyat /🔽mahadvatyo vṛdhavatyaḥ pratipado bhavanti /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ hi enat apaśyat  mahadvatyaḥ vṛdhavatyaḥ pratipadaḥ bhavanti
translated: For Vishvamitra saw it.🔽The Prastāvas are with the word 'great' and with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvad vṛdhavat /
analyzed: mahadvat vṛdhavat
translated: With the word 'great' and with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvat mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ //
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: For this day is great with the word 'great'.

original: mahā indro ya ojasetyetayā gāyatrīm aśītiṃ pratipadyate stomair vatsasya vāvṛdha iti mahadvatyā vṛdhavatyā /
analyzed: mahāḥ indraḥ yaḥ ojasā iti etayā gāyatrīm aśītim pratipadyate stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe iti mahadvatyā vṛdhavatyā
translated: With the verse 'The great Indra for strength' he begins the Gayatri with eighty. 'I increase with the Vatsa Stoma' with the one with the word 'great' and with the one with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvad vṛdhavat /
analyzed: mahadvat vṛdhavat
translated: With the word 'great' and with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvat mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ //
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: For this day is great with the word 'great'.

original: yā indra bhuja ābhara ityetayā bārhatīm aśītiṃ pratipadyate stotāram in maghavann asya vardhayeti mahadvatyā vṛdhavatyā /
analyzed: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ iti etayā bārhatīm aśītim pratipadyate stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya iti mahadvatyā vṛdhavatyā
translated: With the verse 'O Indra, whatever you bring in your arms' he begins the Brihatī with eighty. 'O Maghavan, increase the praiser of this' with the one with the word 'great' and with the one with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvad vṛdhavat /
analyzed: mahadvat vṛdhavat
translated: With the word 'great' and with the word 'increase'.

original: mahadvat mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: For this day is great with the word 'great'.

original: ayaṃ te astu haryata ā mandrair indra haribhiḥ sūkte /
analyzed: ayam te astu haryataḥ ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ sūkte
translated: 'Let this be dear to thee, O Indra, with the pleasant, O thou of bays, with the sweet, O thou of bays, with the hymns.'

original: tad yad ete antataḥ śaṃsati saṃsiddhābhir bṛhatībhir auṣṇihīm aśītiṃ samārohāṇīti //
analyzed: tat yat ete antatas śaṃsati saṃsiddhābhiḥ bṛhatībhiḥ auṣṇihīm aśītim samārohāṇi iti
translated: The reason why he recites these at the end is that he should ascend the Ashtavati with the Brihatīs that have been accomplished.

original: indraḥ suteṣu someṣv ityetayauṣṇihīm aśītiṃ pratipadyate vide vṛdhasya dakṣaso mahān hi ṣa iti vṛdhavatyā mahadvatyā /
analyzed: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu iti etayā auṣṇihīm aśītim pratipadyate vide vṛdhasya dakṣasaḥ mahān hi sa iti vṛdhavatyā mahadvatyā
translated: With Indra among the pressed Soma juices he begins the Ushnih verses. With For he is great to us, the increaser, the mighty one he begins the verses containing the word increase and the word great.

original: vṛdhavan mahadvat /
analyzed: vṛdhavat mahadvat
translated: With increase and greatness.

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /🔽tā vā etā aśītayaḥ saṃśastāḥ saptaviṃśatiśatānyṛcāṃ saṃpadyante /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar  tāḥ vai etāḥ aśītayaḥ saṃśastāḥ saptaviṃśati śatāni ṛcām saṃpadyante
translated: For this day is great.🔽 Those eighty verses are arranged. They make up twenty-seven hundred Richi.

original: sapta vai viṃśati śatāni saṃvatsarasyāhorātrāṇāṃ tad aśītibhiḥ saṃvatsarasyāhorātrāṇyāpnoti /
analyzed: sapta vai viṃśati śatāni saṃvatsarasya ahar rātrāṇām tat aśītibhiḥ saṃvatsarasya ahar rātrāṇi āpnoti
translated: There are twenty-seven hundred days and nights in the year. With the eighty he obtains the days and nights of the year.

original: sāmanidhanair haike gāyatrīr uṣṇihaḥ saṃpādayanti /
analyzed: sāma nidhanaiḥ ha eke gāyatrīḥ uṣṇihaḥ saṃpādayanti
translated: Some complete the Gayatri and Ushnih verses with the Saman endings.

original: caturakṣarāṇyu haike punar ādadate /🔽bārhatyā aśītyā aśītiṃ caturakṣarāṇyuddharati kākubhebhyaḥ pragāthebhyaś caturviṃśatiṃ caturakṣarāṇi tāni catuḥśataṃ caturakṣarāṇi catuḥśate
analyzed: catur akṣarāṇi u ha eke punar ādadate  bārhatyāḥ aśītyāḥ aśītim catur akṣarāṇi uddharati kākubhebhyaḥ pragāthebhyaḥ caturviṃśatim catur akṣarāṇi tāni catuḥśatam catur akṣarāṇi catuḥśate
translated: Some take back the four-syllable ones again.🔽He takes out eighty from the eighty of the Brihat, twenty-four four-syllable ones from the Kakup and Pragatha verses. Those make four hundred four-syllable ones.

original: gāyatrīṣūpadadhāti /
analyzed: gāyatrīṣu upadadhāti
translated: He inserts the four hundred four-syllable ones in the four hundred Gayatri verses.

original: tathā tā gāyatrīr uṣṇihaḥ saṃpadyante /
analyzed: tathā tāḥ gāyatrīḥ uṣṇihaḥ saṃpadyante
translated: Thus those Gayatri verses become Ushnih verses.

original: nādriyeta /
analyzed: na ādriyeta
translated: One should not pay attention to that.

original: atraiva saṃpannam /
analyzed: atra eva saṃpannam
translated: It is complete right there.

original: indrāya sāma gāyateti /
analyzed: indrāya sāma gāyata iti
translated: One should sing the Saman to Indra.

original: tad yad etad antataḥ śaṃsati saṃsiddhābhir uṣṇigbhir vaśaṃ samārohāṇīti //
analyzed: tat yat etat antatas śaṃsati saṃsiddhābhiḥ uṣṇigbhiḥ vaśam samārohāṇi iti
translated: In that he recites that at the end, with the accomplished Usnih verses, he mounts the Vasat cry.

original: atha vaśaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha vaśam śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Vasat cry.

original: udaraṃ vai vaśaḥ /
analyzed: udaram vai vaśaḥ
translated: The Vasat cry is the belly.

original: tena saṃsiddhenānantaryaṃ jigamiṣet /
analyzed: tena saṃsiddhena ānantaryam jigamiṣet
translated: With that he should wish to go to the next world.

original: yad ataḥ kiṃca bahirdhā tata eva tac chrapayati yad antar udare /
analyzed: yat atas kiṃca bahirdhā tatas eva tat śrapayati yat antar udare
translated: Whatever is outside of that, he burns it from that very place, what is inside the belly.

original: tasmād bahvyo devatā bahūni cchandāṃsi vaśe śasyante /
analyzed: tasmāt bahvyaḥ devatāḥ bahūni chandāṃsi vaśe śasyante
translated: Therefore many deities and many metres are recited in the Vasat cry.

original: tasmād idaṃ bahu viśvarūpam udare 'nnam avadhīyate /
analyzed: tasmāt idam bahu viśva rūpam udare nnam avadhīyate
translated: Therefore this much food of various forms is eaten in the belly.

original: athaitau vihṛtāvardharcau /
analyzed: atha etau vihṛtau ardharcau
translated: Then these two divided Ardhas.

original: atha sūdadohasam /
analyzed: atha sūdadohasam
translated: Then the Sûdadohas.

original: sā tata evotsṛjyate /
analyzed: sā tatas eva utsṛjyate
translated: That is released from there.

original: atra caturviṃśatikṛtvaḥ śastā bhavati //
analyzed: atra caturviṃśati kṛtvas śastā bhavati
translated: And here it is recited twenty-four times.

original: athaitā dvipadāḥ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etāḥ dvipadāḥ śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites these two-footed verses.

original: pratiṣṭhānīyaṃ vai chando dvipadāḥ pratiṣṭhityā eva //
analyzed: pratiṣṭhānīyam vai chandaḥ dvipadāḥ pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: The two-footed verses are the metre to be established; for the sake of establishment.

original: athaitad aindrāgnaṃ sūktaṃ gāyatrīśaṃsaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etat aindrāgnam sūktam gāyatrī śaṃsam śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Gâyatrî-verses of the hymn to Indra and Agni.

original: pratiṣṭhe vā indrāgnī pratiṣṭhityā eva //
analyzed: pratiṣṭhe vai indra agnī pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: Indra and Agni are the support; for the sake of support.

original: athaitad āvapanaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etat āvapanam śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites the Âvâpaṇa.

original: pratiṣṭhā vā āvapanaṃ pratiṣṭhityā eva /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā vai āvapanam pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: The Âvâpaṇa is the support; for the sake of support.

original: athau etānyeva punararvācīni bhavanti //
analyzed: etāni eva punar arvācīni bhavanti
translated: Then they go back again to these (verses).

original: athaitam ānuṣṭubhaṃ samāmnāyaṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etam ānuṣṭubham samāmnāyam śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites this Anustubh collection.

original: vāg vā etad ahar vāg anuṣṭub vācyeva tad vācaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: vāc vai etat ahar vāc anuṣṭubh vāci eva tat vācam pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: This day is speech, the Anustubh is speech; verily he establishes speech in speech.

original: divaṃ yayeti devān evaitena sūktenaiti /
analyzed: divam yayā iti devān eva etena sūktena eti
translated: 'To the heaven go', with this verse he goes to the gods.

original: sa pratnathā kavivṛdha iti tṛcam arkavat tena samṛddham /
analyzed: sa pratnathā kavi vṛdhaḥ iti tṛcam arkavat tena samṛddham
translated: The three verses beginning with 'As of old, O you who delight the sage' are connected with the Arka;

original: gāyatryuttamā tayā samṛddham /🔽śāsa itthā mahā asīti mahadvat /
analyzed: gāyatrī uttamā tayā samṛddham  śāsaḥ itthā mahāḥ asi iti mahadvat
translated: the last is a Gayatri; it is connected with that.🔽'The great one is here, the mighty one', (is a verse) containing the word 'great';

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ //
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: for this day is great.

original: athaitaṃ triṣṭupchataṃ śaṃsati /
analyzed: atha etam triṣṭubh śatam śaṃsati
translated: Then he recites this hundred Tristubhs.

original: indrasyaivaitac chando yat triṣṭup tad enaṃ svena chandasā samardhayati /
analyzed: indrasya eva etat chandaḥ yat triṣṭubh tat enam svena chandasā samardhayati
translated: The Tristubh is Indra's metre; verily he prospers him with his own metre.

original: hairaṇyastūpīyaṃ ca yātaūtīyaṃ ca bārhatarāthantare bṛhadrathantare hi purastāt kṛte bhavataḥ /
analyzed: hairaṇyastūpīyam ca yātaūtīyam ca bārhata rāthantare bṛhat rathantare hi purastāt kṛte bhavataḥ
translated: The Hairaṇyastupiya, the Yātaūīya, the Bārhata, the Rāthantara, the Bṛhat and the Rathantara are (recited); for the Bṛhat and the Rathantara are performed before.

original: sajanīyaṃ cādhvaryavo bharatendrāya somam iti ca tāḥ saptaviṃśatir ṛco bhavanti /
analyzed: sajanīyam ca adhvaryavaḥ bharata indrāya somam iti ca tāḥ saptaviṃśatiḥ ṛcaḥ bhavanti
translated: The Adhvaryu recites the Sajaniya and 'Indra, to thee the Soma is pressed' (verse); these are twenty-seven verses.

original: saptaviṃśatir vai nakṣatrāṇi /
analyzed: saptaviṃśatiḥ vai nakṣatrāṇi
translated: There are twenty-seven lunar mansions.

original: tan nakṣatriyāṃ virājaṃ āpnoti /
analyzed: tat nakṣatriyām virājam āpnoti
translated: Verily he attains the Viraj of the lunar mansions.

original: viśvāmitrasya śaṃset /
analyzed: viśvāmitrasya śaṃset
translated: He should recite the verses of Viśvāmitra.

original: viśvāmitro hyenad apaśyat /🔽vāmadevasya śaṃsed vāmaṃ hyetad devānām /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ hi enat apaśyat  vāmadevasya śaṃset vāmam hi etat devānām
translated: For Vishvamitra saw it.🔽One should recite the Vamadeva hymn, for this is the delight of the gods.

original: vasiṣṭhasya śaṃsed vasiṣṭhaṃ hyetad devānām /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhasya śaṃset vasiṣṭham hi etat devānām
translated: One should recite the Vashishtha hymn, for this is the most excellent of the gods.

original: tatra purastād udbrahmīyasya padānuṣaṅgāñ chaṃsati /
analyzed: tatra purastāt udbrahmīyasya pada anuṣaṅgām chaṃsati
translated: There, before the Udbrahmiya, he recites the pada-anushtubh verses.

original: sarve vai kāmā etasmin antarukthe /
analyzed: sarve vai kāmāḥ etasmin antar ukthe
translated: All desires are contained in this Uktha.

original: tad yathā vraje paśūn avasṛjyārgaleṣīke parivyayet /
analyzed: tat yathā vraje paśūn avasṛjya argala iṣīke parivyayet
translated: Just as one would release cattle into a pen and surround them with a fence,

original: evam evaitaiḥ padānuṣaṅgaiḥ sarvān kāmān ubhayataḥ parigṛhyātman dhatte /
analyzed: evam eva etaiḥ pada anuṣaṅgaiḥ sarvān kāmān ubhayatas parigṛhya ātman dhatte
translated: in the same way, with these pada-anushtubh verses, he encloses all desires on both sides and places them within himself.

original: atho udbrahmīyasyārkavatyuttamā /
analyzed: atha u udbrahmīyasya arkavatī uttamā
translated: Then, the Udbrahmiya has the Arkavat hymn as the last.

original: tad etasyāhno rūpam /🔽triḥ śastayā paridadhāti /
analyzed: tat etasya ahnaḥ rūpam  tris śastayā paridadhāti
translated: That is the form of this day.🔽He concludes with the Trishtup.

original: paridhāyokthavīryaṃ japati /
analyzed: paridhāya ukthavīryam japati
translated: Having concluded, he murmurs the Uktha-virya.

original: aikāhikaṃ pūrvaṃ /
analyzed: aikāhikam pūrvam
translated: The first is the one-day rite.

original: pratiṣṭhā vā evāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityā eva /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā vai eva ahar pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: The day is a foundation; (it serves) for a foundation.

original: māhāvratikam uttaram /🔽mahad asīti mahadvat /
analyzed: māhāvratikam uttaram  mahat asi iti mahadvat
translated: The second is the Mahavrata rite.🔽(It is called) 'maha' (great) because it contains the word 'maha'.

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ //
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: For this day contains the word 'maha'.

original: tad etat sakṛcchastāyāṃ sūdadohasi /
analyzed: tat etat sakṛt śastāyām sūdadohasi
translated: This is the Sooda-doha, recited once.

original: yāvacchastraṃ upasarjanyāṃ saṃkhyāyamānāyām ṛte tūṣṇīṃśaṃsaṃ bṛhatīsahasraṃ saṃpadyate /
analyzed: yāvacchastram upasarjanyām saṃkhyāyamānāyām ṛte tūṣṇīṃśaṃsam bṛhatī sahasram saṃpadyate
translated: When the Sastra is being counted as an accessory to the Sastra, it amounts to a thousand Brihatis, except for the silent recitation.

original: tasya vā etasya bṛhatīsahasrasya ṣaṭtriṃśad akṣarāṇāṃ sahasrāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya vai etasya bṛhatī sahasrasya ṣaṭtriṃśat akṣarāṇām sahasrāṇi bhavanti
translated: Of this Brihatî of a thousand (verses), there are thirty-six thousand syllables,

original: tāvanti śatasaṃvatsarasyāhāni bhavanti /🔽tac chatasaṃvatsarasyāhānyāpnoti /
analyzed: tāvanti śata saṃvatsarasya ahāni bhavanti  tat śata saṃvatsarasya ahāni āpnoti
translated: and so many are the days of the hundred years;🔽he thus obtains the days of the hundred years.

original: anuṣṭupsaṃpannam u haike /
analyzed: anuṣṭubh saṃpannam u ha eke
translated: Some, however, make it complete with the Anushtubh (metre),

original: vāg vā etad ahaḥ /
analyzed: vāc vai etat ahar
translated: for this day is speech,

original: vāg anuṣṭup /
analyzed: vāc anuṣṭubh
translated: and the Anushtubh is speech,

original: vāg gha sarvāṇi bhūtāni /
analyzed: vāc gha sarvāṇi bhūtāni
translated: and speech is all beings,

original: atho vāg idaṃ sarvam iti /
analyzed: atha u vāc idam sarvam iti
translated: and moreover speech is all this (universe).

original: bṛhatīsaṃpannam iti tveva sthitam /
analyzed: bṛhatī saṃpannam iti tu eva sthitam
translated: But it is indeed established that it is complete with the Brihatî (metre).

original: bārhato vā eṣa ya eṣa tapati /
analyzed: bārhataḥ vai eṣa yaḥ eṣa tapati
translated: For he who shines yonder is connected with the Brihatî,

original: tad enaṃ svena chandasā samardhayati /🔽trir evāhvayate /
analyzed: tat enam svena chandasā samardhayati  tris eva āhvayate
translated: and he thus supplies it with its own metre.🔽He invokes (the gods) thrice,

original: trayo vā ime lokāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ vai ime lokāḥ
translated: for there are these three worlds;

original: imān eva tal lokān āpnoti /
analyzed: imān eva tat lokān āpnoti
translated: he thus obtains these worlds.

original: ekāhikī yājyā pratiṣṭhā vā ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityā eva /
analyzed: ekāhikī yājyā pratiṣṭhā vai ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: The invitatory and offering prayers belong to the one-day's (sacrifice), for the one-day's (sacrifice) is a foundation: (he does so) for the sake of a foundation.

original: ananuvaṣaṭkṛta eva preṅkhaṃ śrathnanti /
analyzed: an anuvaṣaṭkṛte eva preṅkham śrathnanti
translated: They stretch the plank (on which the Soma is to be pressed) without (the Adhvaryu) uttering the Vashat.

original: sagraham evāyaṃ taṃ prāṅ upāvarohati pratyaṅ preṅkhaphalakam apohati /
analyzed: sa graham eva ayam tam prāṅ upāvarohati pratyaṅ preṅkha phalakam apohati
translated: He (the Hotri) descends from it (the Dronakalasa) towards the east, and pushes away the plank with the end (towards the west).

original: parāmṛśan grahaṃ japati yam imaṃ prajayaṃ prājaiṣaṃ tam anvasānīti ned asmāt prajayād ātmānam apādadhānīti /
analyzed: parāmṛśan graham japati  yam imam prajayam prājaiṣam tam anvasāni iti na id asmāt prajayāt ātmānam apādadhāni iti
translated: Touching the graha (with his hand), he murmurs, 'The offspring which I have begotten, I follow it,' lest he should cut himself off from offspring.

original: vaiśvakarmaṇo 'tigrāhyaḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ tigrāhyaḥ
translated: The Vaisva-karmaṇa Atigrahya.

original: prājāpatyaṃ vā etad ahaḥ /
analyzed: prājāpatyam vai etat ahar
translated: This day belongs to Prajāpati.

original: prajāpatir viśvakarmā tad enaṃ svena rūpeṇa samardhayati /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ viśva karmā tat enam svena rūpeṇa samardhayati
translated: Viśvakarman is Prajāpati. He thus prospers him with his own form.

original: tad dhaitad ahar indro 'girase
analyzed: tat ha etat ahar indraḥ girase
translated: Now this day Indra revealed to Aṅgiras,

original: provācāṅgirā dīrghatamase /🔽tata u ha dīrghatamā daśa puruṣāyuṣāṇi jijīva /
analyzed: provāca aṅgirāḥ dīrghatamase  tatas u ha dīrghatamāḥ daśa puruṣa āyuṣāṇi jijīva
translated: Aṅgiras to Dirghatamas.🔽Then Dirghatamas lived for ten human lives.

original: tad apyetad ṛṣir āha dīrghatamā māmateyo jujurvān daśame yuga iti /
analyzed: tat api etat ṛṣiḥ āha dīrghatamāḥ māmateyaḥ jujurvān daśame yuge iti
translated: The seer Dirghatamas, the son of Māmateya, who was a Jajur-vid, lived for ten human lives.

original: tad etay āyuṣkāmasya śastram iti ha smāha kauṣītakiḥ /
analyzed: tat etay āyuṣkāmasya śastram iti ha sma āha kauṣītakiḥ
translated: This is the hymn for one who desires life, said Kaushītaki.

original: tad ya evaṃ vidvān etad ahaḥ śaṃsati sarvam āyur asmiṃl loka eti /
analyzed: tat yaḥ evam vidvān etat ahar śaṃsati sarvam āyuḥ asmin loke eti
translated: He who, knowing thus, chants this day, goes to the full life in this world.

original: āpnotyamṛtatvam akṣitiṃ svarge loke //
analyzed: āpnoti amṛta tvam akṣitim svarge loke
translated: He attains immortality and imperishable heaven.

original: tat savitur vṛṇīmaha iti vaiśvadevasya pratipat /🔽vṛṇīmaha iti mahadvatī /
analyzed: tat savituḥ vṛṇīmahe iti vaiśvadevasya pratipad  vṛṇīmahe iti mahadvatī
translated: The beginning of the Vaisvadeva is We choose Savita.🔽We choose contains the word 'great.'

original: mahadvat mahadvat dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat dhi etat ahar
translated: This day is great.

original: adyā no deva savitar ityanucaraḥ /🔽viśvā vāmāni dhīmahīti mahadvat /
analyzed: adya naḥ deva savitar iti anucaraḥ  viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi iti mahadvat
translated: The Anucara is Today, O god Savita.

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: We think of all your favors contains the word 'great.'🔽This day is great.

original: tad devasya savitur vāryaṃ mahad iti sāvitraṃ mahadvat/
analyzed: tat devasya savituḥ vāryam mahat iti sāvitram mahadvat
translated: The Savitr is That great favor of god Savita.

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: for this day is great.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśaṃbhuva iti dyāvāpṛthivīyam uruvyacaso mahinī asaścateti mahadvat /
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśva śaṃbhuvaḥ iti dyāvāpṛthivīyam uru vyacasaḥ mahinī asaścatā iti mahadvat
translated: The Dya-Pṛthivī (hymn) is: O heaven and earth, all-beneficent, O you of wide expanse, great, imperishable. It is great,

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /🔽kim u śreṣṭhaḥ kiṃ yaviṣṭho na ājagann ityārbhavam /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar  kim u śreṣṭhaḥ kim yaviṣṭhaḥ naḥ ājagan iti ārbhavam
translated: for this day is great.

original: na nindima camasaṃ yo mahākula iti mahadvat /
analyzed: na nindima camasam yaḥ mahā kulaḥ iti mahadvat
translated: The Ārbhava (hymn) is: What is the best, what is the youngest that has come? We do not blame the bowl that is of great lineage. It is great,

original: mahadvad dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat hi etat ahar
translated: for this day is great.

original: asya vāmasya palitasya hotur iti salilaṃ vaiśvadevam /
analyzed: asya vāmasya palitasya hotuḥ iti salilam vaiśvadevam
translated: The Sālīki (hymn) is: Of this pleasant, gray-haired Hotṛ Of the waters, of the all-gods. It is Sālīki,

original: salilaṃ hyetad devānām /
analyzed: salilam hi etat devānām
translated: for the waters are indeed of all the gods.

original: aikāhike nividaṃ dadhāti /
analyzed: aikāhike nividam dadhāti
translated: He places the Nivīta in the one-day (rite).

original: pratiṣṭhā vā ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityā eva /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā vai ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityai eva
translated: The one-day (rite) is a foundation; (he does so) for support.

original: aikāhikaṃ vaiśvānarīyam /
analyzed: aikāhikam vaiśvānarīyam
translated: The one-day (rite) is connected with Vaiśvānara.

original: pratiṣṭhā vā ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityā eva /🔽prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭaya iti mārutam /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā vai ekāhaḥ pratiṣṭhityai eva  prayajyavaḥ marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ iti mārutam
translated: The one-day (rite) is a foundation; (he does so) for support.

original: bṛhan mahānta urviyā vi rājatheti bṛhadvat /
analyzed: bṛhat mahāntaḥ urviyā vi rājatha iti bṛhadvat
translated: The Mārut (hymn) is: The Maruts who are to be worshipped, of shining appearance, You shine with your greatness through your extent. It is great,

original: mahadvat mahadvat dhyetad ahaḥ /
analyzed: mahadvat mahadvat dhi etat ahar
translated: for this day is great.

original: baḷa ityā tad vapeṣu dhāyi darśitam iti jātavedasīyaṃ tasya astāvyagniḥ śimīvadbhir arkair ity arkavatyuttamā /
analyzed: baḷa iti ā tat vapeṣu dhāyi darśitam iti jātavedasīyam tasya astāvi agniḥ śimīvadbhiḥ arkaiḥ iti arkavatī uttamā
translated: The Jātavedas (hymn) is: The Bṛhat (hymn) has been placed in the oblations, shown, Agni with his flaming rays. The last one is rich in Arka (hymns).

original: tad etasyāhno rūpam ityagnimārutasūktānīti /
analyzed: tat etasya ahnaḥ rūpam iti agni māruta sūktāni iti
translated: This is the form of that day, the Agni and Marut hymns.

original: etasyāhnaḥ sūktāni /
analyzed: etasya ahnaḥ sūktāni
translated: These are the hymns of this day.

original: tad agniṣṭomaḥ saṃtiṣṭhate /
analyzed: tat agniṣṭomaḥ saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: That Agniṣṭoma comes to an end.

original: brahma vā agniṣṭomaḥ /
analyzed: brahma vai agniṣṭomaḥ
translated: The Agniṣṭoma is indeed Brahman.

original: brahmaitad ahaḥ /
analyzed: brahma etat ahar
translated: This day is Brahman.

original: brahmanyeva tad brahma pratiṣṭhāpyanti /
analyzed: brahmani eva tat brahma pratiṣṭhāpyanti
translated: In Brahman alone they establish Brahman.

original: te 'mṛtatvam āpnuvanti ya etad ahar upayanti ya etad ahar upayanti //
analyzed: te mṛta tvam āpnuvanti ye etat ahar upayanti ye etat ahar upayanti
translated: They attain immortality, those who perform this day, those who perform this day.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake dvitīyo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake dvitīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: citro ha vai gāṅgyāyanir yakṣyamāṇa āruṇiṃ vavre /
analyzed: citraḥ ha vai gāṅgyāyaniḥ yakṣyamāṇaḥ āruṇim vavre
translated: Citrāṅga, the son of Gāṅgī, chose Āruṇi for a sacrifice.

original: sa ha putraṃ śvetaketuṃ prajighāya yājayeti /
analyzed: sa ha putram śvetaketum prajighāya yājaya iti
translated: He sent his son Śvetaketu to perform the sacrifice.

original: taṃ hābhyāgataṃ papraccha gotamasya putra /
analyzed: tam ha abhyāgatam papraccha gotamasya putra
translated: When he arrived, he asked him: Son of Gautama,

original: asti saṃvṛtaṃ loke yasmin mā dhāsyasi /
analyzed: asti saṃvṛtam loke yasmin mā dhāsyasi
translated: there is a hidden world in which you will place me.

original: anyatamo vādhvā /
analyzed: anyatamaḥ vā adhvā
translated: Or on some path.

original: tasya mā loke dhāsyasīti /
analyzed: tasya mā loke dhāsyasi iti
translated: Place me in that world.

original: sa hovāca nāham etad veda hantācāryaṃ pṛcchānīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca na aham etat veda hanta ācāryam pṛcchāni iti
translated: He said, I do not know that. I will ask the teacher.

original: sa ha pitaram āsādya papraccha itīti māprākṣīt kathaṃ pratibravāṇīti /
analyzed: sa ha pitaram āsādya papraccha iti iti mā aprākṣīt katham pratibravāṇi iti
translated: Having approached his father, he asked him: He asked me this. How should I reply?

original: sa hovāca aham apyetan na veda /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca aham api etat na veda
translated: He said, I also do not know that.

original: sadasyeva vayaṃ svādhyāyam adhītya harāmahe yan naḥ pare dadati /
analyzed: sadasyā iva vayam svādhyāyam adhītya harāmahe yat naḥ pare dadati
translated: Just as a student, having studied the Veda, takes it away, whatever others give to him.

original: ehyubhau gamiṣyāva iti /
analyzed: ehi ubhau gamiṣyāvaḥ iti
translated: Come, let us both go.

original: sa hi samitpāṇiś citraṃ gāṅgyāyaniṃ praticakrama upāyānīti /
analyzed: sa hi samidh pāṇiḥ citram gāṅgyāyanim praticakrame upāyāni iti
translated: For he came to Chitrā Gāṅgāyanī with a bundle of sacrificial fuel in his hand, saying, I will follow you.

original: taṃ hovāca brahmārho 'si gotama yo na mānam upāgāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca brahma arhaḥ si gotama yaḥ na mānam upāgāḥ
translated: He said to him, You are worthy of the Brahman, O Gautama, that you have come to me with honor.

original: ehi vyeva tvā jñapayiṣyāmīti //
analyzed: ehi vi eva tvā jñapayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Come, I will make you understand.

original: sa hovāca ye vai ke cāsmāl lokāt prayanti candramasam eva te sarvaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca ye vai ke ca asmāt lokāt prayanti candramasam eva te sarvam gacchanti
translated: He said, Those who depart from this world all go to the moon.

original: teṣāṃ prāṇaiḥ pūrvapakṣa āpyāyate /
analyzed: teṣām prāṇaiḥ pūrvapakṣaḥ āpyāyate
translated: By their vital breaths the first half of the month is nourished.

original: tān aparapakṣeṇa prajanayati /
analyzed: tān aparapakṣeṇa prajanayati
translated: He generates them again in the second half of the month.

original: etad vai svargasya lokasya dvāraṃ yac candramāḥ /
analyzed: etat vai svargasya lokasya dvāram yat candramāḥ
translated: This is the door to the heavenly world, namely the moon.

original: taṃ yaḥ pratyāha tam atiṣrjate /
analyzed: tam yaḥ pratyāha tam atiṣrjate
translated: He who answers him back, he is let go.

original: atha yo na pratyāha tam iha vṛṣṭir bhūtvā varṣati /
analyzed: atha yaḥ na pratyāha tam iha vṛṣṭiḥ bhūtvā varṣati
translated: But he who does not answer him back, he becomes rain here and rains down.

original: sa iha kīṭo vā pataṅgo vā matsyo vā śakunir vā siṃho vā varāho vā paraśvā vā śārdūlo vā puruṣo vānyo vā teṣu teṣu sthaneṣu pratyājāyate yathākarma
analyzed: saḥ iha kīṭaḥ vā pataṅgaḥ vā matsyaḥ vā śakuniḥ vā siṃhaḥ vā varāhaḥ vā paraśvā vā śārdūlaḥ vā puruṣaḥ vā anyaḥ vā teṣu teṣu sthaneṣu pratyājāyate yathākarma
translated: He is reborn here as a worm, a bird, a fish, a bird, a lion, a boar, a dog, a tiger, a man, or another in those various places, according to his action

original: yathāvidyam /
analyzed: yathāvidyam

original: tam āgataṃ pṛcchati / ko 'sīti /
analyzed: tam āgatam pṛcchati kaḥ si iti

analyzed: tam pratibrūyāt vicakṣaṇāt ṛtavaḥ retaḥ ābhṛtam pañcadaśāt prasūtāt pitryāvataḥ
translated: He should reply to him, The semen brought from the wise, born from the fifteen, from the fatherly.

original: tan mā puṃsi kartaryerayadhvaṃ puṃsā kartrā mātari māsiṣiñca //
analyzed: tat mā puṃsi kartari erayadhvam puṃsā kartrā mātari mā asiṣiñca
translated: Impel that into me, the male agent. Pour it into me, the female agent, in the month.

original: sa jāyamāna upajāyamāno dvādaśotrayodaśopamāsaḥ /
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ upajāyamānaḥ dvādaśa u trayodaśa upamāsaḥ
translated: He, being born, being generated, twelve or thirteen months old,

original: dvādaśatrayodaśena pitrā saṃ tad vide 'haṃ prati tad vide 'haṃ tan ma ṛtavo 'mṛtyava ārambhadhvam //
analyzed: dvādaśa trayodaśena pitrā sam tat vide ham prati tat vide ham tat me ṛtavaḥ mṛtyave ārambhadhvam
translated: with the father twelve or thirteen years old, he knows that. I know that. I. You, the seasons, immortal ones, take hold of that.

original: tena satyena tena tapasā ṛtur asmi ārtavo 'smi /
analyzed: tena satyena tena tapasā ṛtuḥ asmi ārtavaḥ smi
translated: By that truth, by that austerity, I am the season, I am the seasonal one.

original: ko 'si tvam asmīti tam atisṛjate //
analyzed: kaḥ si tvam asmi iti tam atisṛjate
translated: Who are you? I am. He lets him go.

original: sa etaṃ devayānaṃ panthānam āpadyāgnilokam āgacchati /🔽sa vāyulokam /
analyzed: saḥ etam deva yānam panthānam āpadya agni lokam āgacchati  sa vāyu lokam
translated: Having gone along this path to the gods, he comes to the world of Agni.🔽He to the world of Vayu.

original: sa varuṇalokam /
analyzed: sa varuṇa lokam
translated: He to the world of Varuna.

original: sa indralokam /
analyzed: saḥ indra lokam
translated: He to the world of Indra.

original: sa prajāpatilokam /🔽sa brahmalokam /
analyzed: sa prajāpati lokam  sa brahma lokam
translated: He to the world of Prajapati.🔽He to the world of Brahman.

original: tasya vā etasya brahmalokasyārohadaḥ /
analyzed: tasya vai etasya brahma lokasya āroha daḥ
translated: The ascent of that world of Brahman is

original: muhūrtā yaṣṭihāḥ /🔽vijarā nadī /
analyzed: muhūrtāḥ yaṣṭi hāḥ  vijarā nadī
translated: the Muhurta, the Yastiha,🔽the Vijara river,

original: ilyo vṛkṣaḥ /
analyzed: ilyaḥ vṛkṣaḥ
translated: the Ilyu tree,

original: sālajyaṃ saṃsthanam /
analyzed: sālajyam saṃsthanam
translated: the Sālajya resting place,

original: aparājitam āyatanam /
analyzed: aparājitam āyatanam
translated: the Aparajita abode,

original: indraprajāpatī dvāragopau /
analyzed: indra prajāpatī dvāra gopau
translated: Indra and Prajapati the gatekeepers.

original: vibhu pramitam /🔽vicakṣaṇāsandī /
analyzed: vibhu pramitam  vicakṣaṇā āsandī

original: amitaujāḥ paryaṅkaḥ /
analyzed: amitaujāḥ paryaṅkaḥ
translated: The immeasurable is the bed.

original: priyā ca mānasī /
analyzed: priyā ca mānasī
translated: And the beloved is the mental.

original: pratirūpā ca cākṣuṣī /
analyzed: pratirūpā ca cākṣuṣī
translated: And the suitable is the visual.

original: puṣpāṇyādāyāvayato vai ca jagāni /🔽ambāś cāmbāyavīś cāpsarasaḥ /
analyzed: puṣpāṇi ādāya āvayataḥ vai ca jagāni  ambāḥ ca ambāyavīḥ ca apsarasaḥ
translated: Having taken the flowers, he goes to the world of heaven.🔽And the mothers and motherly ones are the celestial nymphs.

original: ambayā nadyaḥ /
analyzed: ambayā nadyaḥ
translated: The mothers are the rivers.

original: tam itthaṃvid āgacchati /
analyzed: tam itthaṃvid āgacchati
translated: He who knows thus comes.

original: taṃ brahmāha abhidhāva ta mama yaśasā /
analyzed: tam brahmā āha abhidhāva ta mama yaśasā
translated: Brahmā said to him: Run to me with my glory.

original: vijarāṃ vā ayaṃ nadīṃ prāpat /
analyzed: vijarām vai ayam nadīm prāpat
translated: Has he reached the river Vijarā,

original: na vā ayaṃ jarayiṣyatīti //
analyzed: na vai ayam jarayiṣyati iti
translated: or will he not grow old?

original: taṃ pañca śatānyapsarasāṃ pratiyanti śataṃ phalahastāḥ /🔽śatam āñjanahastāḥ /
analyzed: tam pañca śatāni apsarasām pratiyanti śatam phala hastāḥ  śatam āñjana hastāḥ

analyzed: śatam mālya hastāḥ  śatam vāsaḥ hastāḥ
translated: a hundred with garlands in their hands,🔽a hundred with garments in their hands,
