analyzed: sa yaḥ ha vai etasya prāṇasya brahmaṇaḥ manaḥ dūtam veda dūtavān bhavati
translated: He who knows the mind to be the messenger of that Brahman, breath, becomes one who has a messenger.

original: yaś cakṣur goptṛ goptṛmān bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ cakṣuḥ goptṛ goptṛmān bhavati
translated: He who knows the eye to be the protector becomes one who has a protector.

original: yaḥ śrotraṃ śrāvayitṛ saṃśrāvayitṛmān bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotram śrāvayitṛ saṃśrāvayitṛmān bhavati
translated: He who knows the ear to be the announcer becomes one who has an announcer.

original: yo vācaṃ pariveṣṭrīṃ pariveṣṭrīmān bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ vācam pariveṣṭrīm pariveṣṭrīmān bhavati
translated: He who knows speech to be the surrounding becomes one who has a surrounding.

original: tasmai vā etasmai brahmaṇa etā devatā ayācamānāya baliṃ haranti /
analyzed: tasmai vai etasmai brahmaṇe etāḥ devatāḥ a yācamānāya balim haranti
translated: To that Brahman, breath, these deities carry oblations, not being asked.

original: evaṃ haivāsmai sarvāṇi bhūtānyayācamānāyaiva baliṃ haranti ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: evam ha eva asmai sarvāṇi bhūtāni a yācamānāya eva balim haranti yaḥ evam veda
translated: Thus indeed all beings carry oblations to him, not being asked, who knows this, who knows this.

original: tasyopaniṣan na yāced iti /
analyzed: tasya upaniṣad na yācet iti
translated: One should not beg for the Upanishad of that.

original: tad yathā grāmaṃ bhikṣitvālabdhvupaviśen nāham ato dattam aśnīyām iti /
analyzed: tat yathā grāmam bhikṣitvā a labdhvā upaviśet na aham atas dattam aśnīyām iti
translated: Just as if one were to go begging from a village, and having not obtained anything, one would sit down thinking, 'I will not eat what is given here.'

original: ta evainam upamantrayante ye purastāt pratyācakṣīran /
analyzed: te eva enam upamantrayante ye purastāt pratyācakṣīran
translated: Those who had previously rejected him would then approach him.

original: eṣa dharmo 'yācato bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa dharmaḥ yācataḥ bhavati
translated: This is the rule for one who does not beg.

original: annadās tvevainam upamantrayante dadāma ta iti //
analyzed: anna dāḥ tu eva enam upamantrayante dadāma te iti
translated: But only those who give food would approach him, saying, 'We will give to you.'

original: prāṇo brahmeti ha smāha paiṅgyaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ brahma iti ha sma āha paiṅgyaḥ
translated: Pāingya said, 'Breath is Brahman.'

original: tasya vā etasya prāṇasya brahmaṇo vāk parastāc cakṣur ārundhate /
analyzed: tasya vai etasya prāṇasya brahmaṇaḥ vāc parastāt cakṣuḥ ārundhate
translated: Of this breath, of this Brahman, speech is higher than that, and the eye is higher than that.

original: cakṣuḥ parastātc chrotraṃ ārundhate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ parastāt śrotram ārundhate
translated: The eye is higher than that, and the ear is higher than that.

original: śrotraṃ parastān mana ārundhathe /
analyzed: śrotram parastāt manaḥ ārundhathe
translated: The ear is higher than that, and the mind is higher than that.

original: manaḥ parastāt prāṇa ārundhate /
analyzed: manaḥ parastāt prāṇe ārundhate
translated: The mind is higher than that, and breath is higher than that.

original: tasmai vā etasmai prāṇāya brahmaṇa etā devatā ayācamānāya baliṃ haranti /
analyzed: tasmai vai etasmai prāṇāya brahmaṇe etāḥ devatāḥ a yācamānāya balim haranti
translated: To this breath, to this Brahman, these deities carry the sacrificial offering, even though it does not beg.

original: evaṃ haivāsmai sarvāṇi bhūtānyayācamānāyaiva baliṃ haranti /
analyzed: evam ha eva asmai sarvāṇi bhūtāni a yācamānāya eva balim haranti
translated: In the same way, all beings carry the sacrificial offering to it, even though it does not beg.

original: ya evaṃ veda tasyopaniṣan na yāced iti /
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda tasya upaniṣad na yācet iti
translated: One who knows thus should not beg. This is its essence.

original: tad yathā grāmaṃ bhikṣitvālabdhvupaviśen nāham ato dattam aśnīyām iti /
analyzed: tat yathā grāmam bhikṣitvā a labdhvā upaviśet na aham atas dattam aśnīyām iti
translated: Just as if one were to go begging from a village, and having not obtained anything, one would sit down thinking, 'I will not eat what is given here.'

original: ta evainam upamantrayante ye purastāt pratyācakṣīran /
analyzed: te eva enam upamantrayante ye purastāt pratyācakṣīran
translated: Those who had previously rejected him, they alone advise him.

original: eṣa dharmo 'yācato bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa dharmaḥ yācataḥ bhavati
translated: This is the rule for one who does not beg.

original: annadās tvevainam upamantrayante dadāma ta iti //
analyzed: anna dāḥ tu eva enam upamantrayante dadāma te iti
translated: But those who give food, they alone advise him, saying, We will give to you.

original: athāta ekadhanāvarodhanam /
analyzed: atha atas ekadhana avarodhanam
translated: Now, then, the one-wealth-obstruction.

original: ya ekadhanam abhidhyāyāt paurṇamāsyāṃ vāmāvāsyāyāṃ vā śuddhapakṣe vā puṇye nakṣatra
analyzed: yaḥ ekadhanam abhidhyāyāt paurṇamāsyām vā amāvāsyāyām vā śuddhapakṣe vā puṇye nakṣatra
translated: One who would covet single wealth, on the full moon day or new moon day or in the bright fortnight or on an auspicious lunar mansion

original: eteṣām ekasmin parvaṇyagnim upasamādhāya parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: eteṣām ekasmin parvaṇi agnim upasamādhāya parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇam
translated: on one of these lunar days, having put the fire in order, having enclosed it, having strewn it around, having sprinkled it around, having churned the fire, having put wood on it, having gone around it,

original: ānvācya sruveṇāyahutīr juhoti /🔽vāṅ nāma devatāvarodhinī sā me 'muṣmād idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā /
analyzed: ā anvācya sruveṇa āya hutīḥ juhoti  vāc nāma devatā avarodhinī sā me muṣmāt idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā
translated: having recited the Anvāhārya, he offers the Āyus oblations with the dipping-spoon.🔽Speech, named the deity-obstructor, may it obstruct this for me from that, to it Svāhā.

original: prāṇo nāma devatāvarodhinī sā me 'muṣmād idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ nāma devatā avarodhinī sā me muṣmāt idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā
translated: Life-breath, named the deity-obstructor, may it obstruct this for me from that, to it Svāhā.

original: śrotraṃ nāma devatāvarodhinī sā me 'muṣmād idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā /
analyzed: śrotram nāma devatā avarodhinī sā me muṣmāt idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā
translated: Hearing, named the deity-obstructor, may it obstruct this for me from that, to it Svāhā.

original: mano nāma devatāvarodhinī sā me 'muṣmād idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā /
analyzed: manaḥ nāma devatā avarodhinī sā me muṣmāt idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā
translated: Mind, named the deity-obstructor, may it obstruct this for me from that, to it Svāhā.

original: prajñā nāma devatāvarodhinī sā me 'muṣmād idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā /
analyzed: prajñā nāma devatā avarodhinī sā me muṣmāt idam avarundhyāt tasyai svāhā
translated: The deity named wisdom is the bestower of (the object of) desire. May she grant me this from him. To her, Svâhâ!

original: atha dhūmagandhaṃ prajighrāyājyalepanenāṅgānyanuvimṛjya vācaṃyamo 'bhipravrajyārthaṃ brūyād dūtaṃ vā prahiṇuyāt /
analyzed: atha dhūma gandham prajighrāya ājya lepanena aṅgāni anuvimṛjya vācaṃyamaḥ abhipravrajya artham brūyāt dūtam vā prahiṇuyāt
translated: Then, having smelt the smell of the smoke, and having anointed his limbs with the remains of the offering, silent, he should go forth, or he should send a messenger to speak his purpose.

original: labhate haiva //
analyzed: labhate ha eva
translated: He will certainly obtain (his object).

original: athāto daivaḥ smaraḥ /🔽yasya priyo bubhūṣed yasyai yeṣāṃ vā yāsāṃ vaiteṣām evaikasmin parvaṇyetayaivāvṛtaitā ājyāhutīr juhoti /🔽vācaṃ te mayi juhomyasau svāhā /🔽prāṇaṃ te mayi juhomyasau svāhā /🔽mayi cakṣus te juhomyasau svāhā /
analyzed: atha atas daivaḥ smaraḥ  yasya priyaḥ bubhūṣet yasyai yeṣām vā yāsām vai teṣām eva ekasmin parvaṇi etayā eva āvṛtā etāḥ ājya āhutīḥ juhoti  vācam te mayi juhomi asau svāhā  prāṇam te mayi juhomi asau svāhā  mayi cakṣuḥ te juhomi asau svāhā
translated: Now, then, the divine Smara.

original: śrotraṃ te mayi juhomyasau svāhā /🔽manas te mayi juhomyasau svāhā /🔽prajñāṃ te mayi juhomyasau svāheti /🔽atha dhūmagandhaṃ prajighrāyājyalepanenāṅgānyanuvimṛjya vācaṃyamo 'bhipravrajy saṃsparśaṃ jigamiṣet /🔽abhivātād vā tiṣṭhet saṃbhāṣamāṇaḥ /🔽priyo haiva bhavati /
analyzed: śrotram te mayi juhomi asau svāhā 🔽manaḥ te mayi juhomi asau svāhā 🔽prajñām te mayi juhomi asau svāhā iti 🔽atha dhūma gandham prajighrāya ājya lepanena aṅgāni anuvimṛjya vācaṃyamaḥ bhipravraji saṃsparśam jigamiṣet 🔽abhivātāt vā tiṣṭhet saṃbhāṣamāṇaḥ 🔽priyaḥ ha eva bhavati
translated: For whomsoever he may desire to be dear, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whomsoever, for whom

original: smarate haivāsya //
analyzed: smarate ha eva asya
translated: He is indeed remembered by him.

original: athātaḥ sāṃyamanaṃ prātardanam /
analyzed: atha atas sāṃyamanam prātardanam
translated: Now, then, the morning offering of the Samyama.

original: āntaram agnihotram ityācakṣate /
analyzed: āntaram agnihotram iti ācakṣate
translated: They call it the inner Agnihotra.

original: yāvad vai puruṣo bhāṣate na tāvat prāṇituṃ śaknoti /
analyzed: yāvat vai puruṣaḥ bhāṣate na tāvat prāṇitum śaknoti
translated: For as long as a person speaks, for so long he is not able to breathe.

original: prāṇaṃ tadā vāci juhoti /
analyzed: prāṇam tadā vāci juhoti
translated: Then he offers the breath into speech.

original: yāvad vai puruṣaḥ prāṇiti na tāvad bhāṣituṃ śaknoti /
analyzed: yāvat vai puruṣaḥ prāṇiti na tāvat bhāṣitum śaknoti
translated: For as long as a person breathes, for so long he is not able to speak.

original: vācaṃ tadā prāṇe juhoti /
analyzed: vācam tadā prāṇe juhoti
translated: Then he offers speech into the breath.

original: ete anante amṛte āhutī jāgracca svapaṃśca saṃtataṃ juhoti /
analyzed: ete anante amṛte āhutī jāgrat ca svapan ca saṃtatam juhoti
translated: These two offerings, endless and immortal, he offers continuously, whether awake or sleeping.

original: atha yā anyā āhutayo 'ntavatyas tāḥ karmamayyo hi bhavanti /
analyzed: atha yāḥ anyāḥ āhutayaḥ ntavatyaḥ tāḥ karma mayyaḥ hi bhavanti
translated: Now, the other offerings, which are finite, are indeed made of action.

original: tad dha smaitat pūrve vidvāṃso 'gnihotraṃ na juhavāñcakruḥ //
analyzed: tat ha sma etat pūrve vidvāṃsaḥ gnihotram na juhavāñcakruḥ
translated: Therefore, the ancient wise ones did not offer the Agnihotra.

original: ukthaṃ brahmeti ha smāha śuṣkabhṛṅgāraḥ /
analyzed: uktham brahma iti ha sma āha śuṣkabhṛṅgāraḥ
translated: Sukhabhringaraja said, The Uktha is Brahman.

original: tad ṛg ityupāsīta /
analyzed: tat ṛc iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as the Rig Veda.

original: sarvāṇi hāsmai bhūtani śraiṣṭhyāyābhyacyante /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ha asmai śraiṣṭhyāya abhyacyante
translated: All beings bow to him for supremacy.

original: tad yajur ityupāsīta /
analyzed: tat yajuḥ iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as the Yajur Veda.

original: sarvāṇi hāsmai bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya yujyante /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ha asmai bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya yujyante
translated: All beings are yoked to him for supremacy.

original: tat sāma ityupāsīta /
analyzed: tat sāma iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as the Sama Veda.

original: sarvāṇi hāsmai bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya saṃnamante /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ha asmai bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya saṃnamante
translated: All beings bow to him for supremacy.

original: tac chrīr ityupāsīt /
analyzed: tat śrīḥ iti upāsīt
translated: One should worship it as prosperity.

original: tad yaśa ityupāsīta /
analyzed: tat yaśaḥ iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as glory.

original: tat teja ityupāsīta /
analyzed: tat tejaḥ iti upāsīta
translated: One should worship it as splendour.

original: tad yathaitac chrīmattamaṃ yaśasvitamaṃ tejasvitamam iti śastreṣu bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā etat śrīmattamam yaśasvitamam tejasvitamam iti śastreṣu bhavati
translated: Just as in the scriptures it is said to be the most glorious, most famous, and most resplendent,

original: evaṃ haiva sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu śrīmattamo yaśasvitamas tejasitamo bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: evam ha eva sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu śrīmattamaḥ yaśasvitamaḥ tejasitamaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: so indeed does one become the most glorious, most famous, and most resplendent of all beings, one who knows this.

original: tad etad aiṣṭikaṃ karma yam ātmānam adhvaryuḥ saṃskaroti /
analyzed: tat etat aiṣṭikam karma yam ātmānam adhvaryuḥ saṃskaroti
translated: This is the ritual of the fire, which the Adhvaryu priest performs on the self.

original: tasmin yajurmayaṃ pravayati /🔽yajurmaya ṛṅmayaṃ hotā /
analyzed: tasmin yajuḥ mayam pravayati  yajuḥ mayaḥ ṛk mayam hotā
translated: In it, he places the Yajur Veda.🔽The Hotri priest, who is made of the Yajur Veda, places the Rig Veda.

original: ṛṅmaye sāmamayam udgātā /
analyzed: ṛk maye sāma mayam udgātā
translated: The Udgâtri priest, who is made of the Rig Veda, places the Sâma Veda.

original: sa eṣa trayyai vidyāyā ātmā /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa trayyai vidyāyai ātmā
translated: This is the essence of the three Vedas.

original: eṣa u evaitad indrasyātmā bhavati ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva etat indrasya ātmā bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And this indeed becomes the essence of Indra, one who knows this.

original: athātaḥ sarvajitaḥ kauṣītakes trīṇyupāsanāni bhavanti /
analyzed: atha atas sarvajitaḥ kauṣītakeḥ trīṇi upāsanāni bhavanti
translated: Now, from here, there are three meditations of Sarvajit Kausitikas.

original: sarvajid dha sma kauṣītakir udyantam ādityam upatiṣṭhate yajñopavītaṃ kṛtvodakam ānīya triḥ prasicyodakapātram /
analyzed: sarvajit ha sma kauṣītakiḥ udyantam ādityam upatiṣṭhate yajñopavītam kṛtvā udakam ānīya tris prasicya udaka pātram
translated: Sarvajit Kausitikas, while worshipping the rising sun, having put on the sacred thread, having brought water, having sprinkled the water vessel three times,

original: vargo 'si pāpmānaṃ me vṛṅdhīti /
analyzed: vargaḥ si pāpmānam me vṛṅdhi iti
translated: says, You are the class, remove my sin.

original: etayaivāvṛtā madhye santam /
analyzed: etayā eva āvṛtā madhye santam
translated: With the same procedure, while he is in the middle,

original: udvargo 'si pāpmānaṃ ma udvṛṅdhīti /
analyzed: udvargaḥ si pāpmānam me udvṛṅdhi iti
translated: You are the upward class, remove my sin upwards.

original: etayaivāvṛtāstaṃ yantam /
analyzed: etayā eva āvṛtā astam yantam
translated: With this very formula he should approach him who is going.

original: saṃvargo 'si pāpmānaṃ me saṃvṛṅdhīti /
analyzed: saṃvargaḥ si pāpmānam me saṃvṛṅdhi iti
translated: You are the gatherer, gather my evil for me.

original: tad yad ahorātrābhyāṃ pāpaṃ karoti saṃ tad vṛṅkte /
analyzed: tat yat ahar rātrābhyām pāpam karoti sam tat vṛṅkte
translated: Whatever evil he does by day and night, that he gathers together.

original: tatho evaivaṃ vidvān etayaivāvṛtādityam upatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: tathā u eva evam vidvān etayā eva āvṛtā ādityam upatiṣṭhate
translated: In the same way, one who knows thus, with this very formula, worships the sun.

original: yad ahorātrābhyāṃ pāpaṃ karoti saṃ tad vṛṅkte //
analyzed: yat ahar rātrābhyām pāpam karoti sam tat vṛṅkte
translated: Whatever evil he does by day and night, that he gathers together.

original: atha māsimāsyāvāsyāyāṃ vṛttāyāṃ paścāc candramasaṃ dṛśyamānam upatiṣṭhetaitayaivāvṛtā /
analyzed: atha māsi māsyāvāsyāyām vṛttāyām paścāt candramasam dṛśyamānam upatiṣṭheta etayā eva āvṛtā
translated: Then, when the new moon has passed, he should worship the moon seen in the sky in the evening of every month with this very formula.🔽Or he should lie down on green grass, and recite this verse:

original: haritatṛṇe vā pratyasya yan me susīmaṃ hṛdayaṃ divi candramasi śritam /
analyzed: harita tṛṇe vā pratyasya yat me su sīmam hṛdayam divi candramasi śritam
translated: Whatever good heart of mine is placed in the sky and in the moon,

original: manye 'haṃ māṃ tad vidvāṃsaṃ māhaṃ putryam aghaṃ rudam //
analyzed: manye ham mām tat vidvāṃsam mā aham putryam agham rudam
translated: I think of that as knowing me. May I not weep for my son.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: na hyasmāt pūrvā prajā praitīti nu jātaputrasya /
analyzed: na hi asmāt pūrvā prajā praiti iti nu jāta putrasya
translated: For offspring do not go forth from him before. This is for one who has a son.

original: athājātaputrasya āpyāyasva sametu te /
analyzed: atha a jāta putrasya āpyāyasva sametu te
translated: Now for one who has no son: Be swollen, let them meet with thee.

original: saṃ te payāṃsi sam u yantu vājāḥ /
analyzed: sam te payāṃsi sam u yantu vājāḥ
translated: Let thy milk and strength come together.

original: yam ādityā aṃśum āpyāyayantītyetās tisra ṛco japitvā māsmākaṃ prāṇena prajayā paśubhir āpyāyayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: yam ādityāḥ aṃśum āpyāyayanti iti etāḥ tisraḥ ṛcaḥ japitvā mā asmākam prāṇena prajayā paśubhiḥ āpyāyayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The Ādityas who make the moon swell. Having muttered these three verses, Do not swell us with our life, offspring, and cattle.

original: yo' smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tasya prāṇena prajayā paśubhir āpyāyayasvetyaindrīm āvṛtam āvarta ādityasyāvṛtam anvāvarta iti dakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ tasya prāṇena prajayā paśubhiḥ āpyāyayasva iti aindrīm āvṛtam āvarte ādityasya āvṛtam anvāvarte iti dakṣiṇam
translated: 'With the life, the offspring, the cattle of him whom we hate, and of him who hates us, do thou swell', (with these words) he turns round the left foot, turning round the course of Indra, turning round the course of the sun.

original: bāhum anvāvartate //
analyzed: bāhum anvāvartate
translated: He turns round the right arm.

original: atha paurṇamāsyāṃ purastāc candramasaṃ dṛśyamānam upatiṣṭhaitayaivāvṛtā /
analyzed: atha paurṇamāsyām purastāt candramasam dṛśyamānam upatiṣṭha etayā eva āvṛtā
translated: Then on the full moon day, when the moon is seen in front, he worships with the same formula.

original: somo rājāsi vicakṣaṇaḥ pañcamukho 'si prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ rājā asi vicakṣaṇaḥ pañca mukhaḥ si prajāpatiḥ
translated: 'Thou art king Soma, the discerning one, thou art Prajapati with five faces.

original: brāhmaṇas ta ekaṃ mukhaṃ tena mukhena rājño 'tsi /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ te ekam mukham tena mukhena rājñaḥ tsi
translated: The Brahmana is one of thy faces. With that face thou supportest the king.

original: tena mukhena māṃ annādaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tena mukhena mām anna adam kuru
translated: With that face make me an eater of food.

original: rājā ta ekaṃ mukhaṃ tena mukhena viśo 'tsi /
analyzed: rājā te ekam mukham tena mukhena viśaḥ tsi
translated: The king is one of thy faces. With that face thou supportest the people.

original: tena mukhena māṃ annādaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tena mukhena mām anna adam kuru
translated: With that face make me an eater of food.

original: śyenas ta ekaṃ mukhaṃ tena mukhena pakṣiṇo 'tsi /
analyzed: śyenaḥ te ekam mukham tena mukhena pakṣiṇaḥ tsi
translated: The hawk is one of thy faces. With that face thou supportest the birds.

original: tena mukhena māṃ annādaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tena mukhena mām anna adam kuru
translated: With that face make me an eater of food.

original: agniṣ ṭa ekaṃ mukhaṃ tena mukhenemaṃ lokam atsi /
analyzed: agniḥ te ekam mukham tena mukhena imam lokam atsi
translated: Fire is one of thy faces. With that face thou supportest this world.

original: tena mukhena māṃ annādaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tena mukhena mām anna adam kuru
translated: With that face make me an eater of food.

original: māsmākaṃ prāṇena prajayā paśubhir apakṣeṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: mā asmākam prāṇena prajayā paśubhiḥ apakṣeṣṭhāḥ
translated: Do not deprive us of our life, our offspring, our cattle.

original: yo' smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tasya prāṇena prajayā paśubhir apakṣīyasveti daivīm āvṛtam āvarta ādityasyāvṛtam anvāvarta iti dakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ tasya prāṇena prajayā paśubhiḥ apakṣīyasva iti daivīm āvṛtam āvarte ādityasya āvṛtam anvāvarte iti dakṣiṇam
translated: 'Wither away through the life, the offspring, and the cattle of him who hates us and whom we hate,' (with these words) he turns the divine wheel, he turns along the path of the sun.

original: bāhum anvāvartate //
analyzed: bāhum anvāvartate
translated: He turns along the right arm.

original: atha saṃvekṣyan jāyāyai hṛdayam abhi mṛśet yat te susīme hṛdayaṃ śritam antaḥ prajāpatau /
analyzed: atha saṃvekṣyan jāyāyai hṛdayam abhi mṛśet  yat te su sīme hṛdayam śritam antar prajāpatau
translated: Then, when he is about to look (at the child), he should touch the heart of the wife with (the verse), 'What heart of thine is hidden in the womb of the lord of creatures,

original: tenāmṛtatvasyeśāne mā tvaṃ putryam aghaṃ ni gā iti //
analyzed: tena amṛta tvasya īśāne mā tvam putryam agham ni gāḥ iti
translated: through that be thou the mistress of immortality. Let no sin of thine, O daughter, remain.'

original: na hyasyāḥ pūrvā prajā praitīti //
analyzed: na hi asyāḥ pūrvā prajā praiti iti
translated: For no offspring of hers dies before (her).

original: atha proṣyāyan putrasya mūrdhanam abhijighret aṅgād aṅgāt saṃbhavasi hṛdayād adhi jāyase /
analyzed: atha proṣya āyan putrasya mūrdhanam abhijighret aṅgāt aṅgāt saṃbhavasi hṛdayāt adhi jāyase
translated: Then, when he is about to depart (from home), he should smell the head of his son (with the verse), 'From limb to limb thou art born, from the heart thou art produced.🔽Thou art the self, O son, by name; live a hundred years.' He gives him a name.🔽'Be a stone, be an axe,🔽be a sharp knife,🔽be a well-tempered arrow,

original: ātmā vai putranāmāsi sa jīva śaradaḥ śatam iti nāmāsya dadhāti /
analyzed: ātmā vai putra nāmā asi sa jīva śaradaḥ śatam iti nāma asya dadhāti
translated: be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,

original: aśmā bhava paraśur bhava /
analyzed: aśmā bhava paraśuḥ bhava
translated: be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,

original: hiraṇyam astṛtaṃ bhava /
analyzed: hiraṇyam astṛtam bhava
translated: be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,

original: tejo vai putrānāmāsi sa jīva śaradaḥ śatam iti nāmāsya gṛhṇāti /
analyzed: tejaḥ vai putrāḥ nāma asi sa jīva śaradaḥ śatam iti nāma asya gṛhṇāti
translated: be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,

original: athainaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: atha enam parigṛhṇāti
translated: be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,🔽be a well-tempered weapon,🔽be a well-tempered thunderbolt.🔽Be a well-tempered arrow,🔽be a well-tempered sword,

original: yena prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ paryagṛhṇāt tad ariṣṭyaitena tvā parigṛhṇāmi / asāv iti /
analyzed: yena prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ paryagṛhṇāt tat ariṣṭyā etena tvā parigṛhṇāmi asau iti
translated: By which Prajapati took possession of creatures, by that (I take possession) of thee for safety. N.N.

original: athāsya dakṣiṇe karṇe japati asme prayandhi maghavann ṛjīṣin iti /
analyzed: atha asya dakṣiṇe karṇe japati asme prayandhi maghavan ṛjīṣin iti
translated: Then he murmurs into his right ear, 'Bestow upon us, O bountiful one, O impetuous one.'

original: indraṃ śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehīti savye /
analyzed: indram śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi iti savye
translated: 'Bestow upon Indra the best treasures,' (he murmurs) into the left.

original: mā bhetthā mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ śataṃ śarada āyuṣaḥ /🔽jīvasva putra te nāmnā mūrdhānam abhijighrāmīti trir asya mūrdānam abhijighret /
analyzed: mā bhetthāḥ mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ śatam śaradaḥ āyuṣaḥ  jīvasva putra te nāmnā mūrdhānam abhijighrāmi iti tris asya mūrdānam abhijighret
translated: 'Do not be afraid, do not tremble, for a hundred years of life.🔽Live, O son, by thy name I kiss thy head,' he should three times kiss his head.

original: gavāṃ tvāṃ hiṃkāreṇābhihiṃkaromīti trir asya mūrdhānam abhihiṃkaroti //
analyzed: gavām tvām hiṃkāreṇa abhihiṃkaromi iti tris asya mūrdhānam abhihiṃkaroti
translated: 'With the lowing of the cows I make thee low,' three times he makes him low.

original: athato daivaḥ parimaraḥ /
analyzed: athatas daivaḥ parimaraḥ
translated: Now, then, the divine examination.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yad agnir jvalati /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat agniḥ jvalati
translated: This, indeed, is the Brahman which shines, that the fire burns.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na jvalati /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na jvalati
translated: Then this (fire) dies out, that it does not burn.

original: tasyādityam eva tejo gacchati vāyuṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ādityam eva tejaḥ gacchati vāyum prāṇaḥ
translated: Its splendour goes to the sun, its breath to the wind.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yad ādityo dṛśyate /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat ādityaḥ dṛśyate
translated: This, indeed, is the Brahman which shines, that the sun is seen.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na dṛśyate /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na dṛśyate
translated: Then this (sun) dies out, that it is not seen.

original: tasya candramasam eva tejo gacchati vāyuṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya candramasam eva tejaḥ gacchati vāyum prāṇaḥ
translated: Its splendour goes to the moon, its breath to the wind.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yac candramā dṛśyate /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat candramāḥ dṛśyate
translated: This indeed is the shining Brahman, which is seen as the moon.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na dṛśyate /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na dṛśyate
translated: Then this dies, which is not seen.

original: tasya vidyutam eva tejo gacchati vāyuṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya vidyutam eva tejaḥ gacchati vāyum prāṇaḥ
translated: Its radiance goes to lightning, and its life breath to the wind.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yad vidyud vidyotate /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat vidyut vidyotate
translated: This indeed is the shining Brahman, which is the lightning that flashes.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na vidyotate /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na vidyotate
translated: Then this dies, which does not flash.

original: tasyādiśa eva tejo gacchati vāyuṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ādiśaḥ eva tejaḥ gacchati vāyum prāṇaḥ
translated: Its radiance goes to the directions, and its life breath to the wind.

original: tā vā etā sarvā devatā vāyum eva praviśya vāyau mṛtvā na mṛcchante /
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ sarvāḥ devatāḥ vāyum eva praviśya vāyau mṛtvā na mṛcchante
translated: All these deities, indeed, having entered the wind, do not die in the wind.

original: tasmād eva punarudīrate /
analyzed: tasmāt eva punar udīrate
translated: Therefore, they rise up again from there.

original: ityadhidaivam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivam
translated: Thus, in regard to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam //
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now, in regard to the self.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yad vācā vadati /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat vācā vadati
translated: This indeed is the shining Brahman, which one speaks with the voice.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na vadati /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na vadati
translated: Then this dies, which one does not speak.

original: tasya cakṣur eva tejo gacchati /
analyzed: tasya cakṣuḥ eva tejaḥ gacchati
translated: Its radiance goes to the eye.

original: prāṇaṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇam prāṇaḥ
translated: The life breath to the life breath.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yac cakṣuṣā paśyati /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat cakṣuṣā paśyati
translated: This indeed is the shining Brahman, which one sees with the eye.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na paśyati /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na paśyati
translated: Then this dies, which one does not see.

original: tasya śrotram eva tejo gacchati /
analyzed: tasya śrotram eva tejaḥ gacchati
translated: Its radiance goes to the ear.

original: prāṇaṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇam prāṇaḥ
translated: The life breath to the life breath.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yac chrotreṇa śṛṇoti /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat śrotreṇa śṛṇoti
translated: This indeed is the shining Brahman, which one hears with the ear.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na śṛṇoti /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na śṛṇoti
translated: Then this dies, which one does not hear.

original: tasya mana eva tejo gacchati /
analyzed: tasya manaḥ eva tejaḥ gacchati
translated: Its splendor goes to the mind.

original: prāṇaṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇam prāṇaḥ
translated: The vital breath goes to the vital breath.

original: etad vai brahma dīpyate yan manasā dhyāyati /
analyzed: etat vai brahma dīpyate yat manasā dhyāyati
translated: This indeed is the Brahman that shines, which one thinks with the mind.

original: athaitan mriyate yan na dhyāyati /
analyzed: atha etat mriyate yat na dhyāyati
translated: Then this dies, which one does not think.

original: tasya prāṇam eva tejo gacchati /
analyzed: tasya prāṇam eva tejaḥ gacchati
translated: Its splendor goes to the vital breath.

original: prāṇaṃ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇam prāṇaḥ
translated: The vital breath goes to the vital breath.

original: tā vā etā sarvā devatā prāṇam eva praviśya prāṇe mṛtvā na mṛcchante /
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ sarvāḥ devatāḥ prāṇam eva praviśya prāṇe mṛtvā na mṛcchante
translated: All these deities, having entered the vital breath, do not die when the vital breath dies.

original: tasmād eva punar udīrate /
analyzed: tasmāt eva punar udīrate
translated: Therefore, they rise up again from that very [vital breath].

original: tad yad iha vā evaṃ vidvāṃsam ubhau parvatāv abhipravarteyātāṃ dakṣiṇaścottaraś ca tustūrṣamāṇau na hainaṃ stṛṇvīyātām /
analyzed: tat yat iha vai evam vidvāṃsam ubhau parvatau abhipravarteyātām dakṣiṇaḥ ca uttaraḥ ca tustūrṣamāṇau na ha enam stṛṇvīyātām
translated: Now, if both mountains were to move against one who knows this, the southern and the northern, desiring to crush him, they would not crush him.

original: atha ya enaṃ dviṣanti yāṃś ca svayaṃ dveṣṭi ta evainaṃ parimriyante //
analyzed: atha ye enam dviṣanti yān ca svayam dveṣṭi te eva enam parimriyante
translated: But those who hate him and whom he himself hates, they perish around him.

original: athāto niḥśreyasādānam /
analyzed: atha atas niḥśreyasa ādānam
translated: Now, therefore, the attainment of the highest good.

original: etā ha vai devatā ahaṃśreyase vividamānā asmāc charīrād uccakramuḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ ha vai devatāḥ ahaṃśreyase vividamānāḥ asmāt śarīrāt uccakramuḥ
translated: These very deities, desiring the highest good, went out from this body.

original: tad dha papāta /
analyzed: tat ha papāta
translated: That fell down.

original: śuṣkaṃ dārubhūtaṃ śiśye /🔽athainad vāk praviveśa /
analyzed: śuṣkam dāru bhūtam śiśye  atha enat vāc praviveśa
translated: It lay withered, like a piece of wood.🔽Then speech entered it.

original: tad vācā vadac chiśya eva /
analyzed: tat vācā vadat śiśye eva
translated: It lay withered, speaking with speech.

original: athainac cakṣuḥ praviveśa /
analyzed: atha enat cakṣuḥ praviveśa
translated: Then the eye entered it.

original: tad vācā vadac cakṣuṣā paśyac chiśya eva /
analyzed: tat vācā vadat cakṣuṣā paśyat śiśye eva
translated: He, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, was indeed a disciple.

original: athainac chrotraṃ praviveśa /
analyzed: atha enat śrotram praviveśa
translated: Then the ear entered him.

original: tad vācā vadac cakṣuṣā paśyac chrotreṇa śṛṇvac chiśya eva /
analyzed: tat vācā vadat cakṣuṣā paśyat śrotreṇa śṛṇvat śiśye eva
translated: He, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, was indeed a disciple.

original: athainan manaḥ praviveśa /
analyzed: atha enat manaḥ praviveśa
translated: Then the mind entered him.

original: tad vācā vadac cakṣuṣā paśyac chrotreṇa śṛṇvan manasā dhyāyac chiśya eva /
analyzed: tat vācā vadat cakṣuṣā paśyat śrotreṇa śṛṇvat manasā dhyāyat śiśye eva
translated: He, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, thinking with the mind, was indeed a disciple.

original: athainat prāṇaḥ praviveśa /
analyzed: atha enat prāṇaḥ praviveśa
translated: Then the breath entered him.

original: tat tata eva samuttasthau /
analyzed: tat tatas eva samuttasthau
translated: It arose from there itself.

original: tā vā etā sarvā devatā prāṇe niḥśreyasaṃ viditvā prāṇam eva prajñātmānam abhisaṃbhūya sahaivaitaiḥ sarvair asmāc charīrād uccakramuḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ sarvāḥ devatāḥ prāṇe niḥśreyasam viditvā prāṇam eva prajñā ātmānam abhisaṃbhūya saha eva etaiḥ sarvaiḥ asmāt śarīrāt uccakramuḥ
translated: Those very same deities, having recognized the highest good in the breath, having united with the breath itself, which is the self of wisdom, they all together departed from this body.

original: te vāyupratiṣṭhā ākāśātmānaḥ svar īyuḥ /
analyzed: te vāyu pratiṣṭhāḥ ākāśa ātmānaḥ svar īyuḥ
translated: They, having the wind as their abode, having the sky as their self, went to heaven.

original: tatho evaivaṃ vidvān prāṇe niḥśreyasaṃ viditvā prāṇam eva prajñātmānam abhisaṃbhūya sahaivaitaiḥ sarvair asmāc charīrād utkrāmati /
analyzed: tathā u eva evam vidvān prāṇe niḥśreyasam viditvā prāṇam eva prajñā ātmānam abhisaṃbhūya saha eva etaiḥ sarvaiḥ asmāt śarīrāt utkrāmati
translated: In the same way, one who knows thus, having recognized the highest good in the breath, having united with the breath itself, which is the self of wisdom, he all together departs from this body with all these (deities).

original: sa vāyupratiṣṭha ākāśātmā svar eti /🔽sa tad gacchati yatraite devāḥ /
analyzed: sa vāyu pratiṣṭhaḥ ākāśa ātmā svar eti  sa tat gacchati yatra ete devāḥ
translated: He, having the wind as his abode, having the sky as his self, goes to heaven.🔽He goes to that place where those deities are.

original: tat prāpya yad amṛtā devāḥ /
analyzed: tat prāpya yat amṛtāḥ devāḥ
translated: Having reached that, he becomes immortal like the gods.

original: tad amṛto bhavati ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: tat amṛtaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus becomes immortal.

original: athātaḥ pitāputrīyaṃ saṃpradānam iti cācakṣate /
analyzed: atha atas pitāputrīyam saṃpradānam iti ca ācakṣate
translated: Now, from here they call it the gift of father and son.

original: pitā putraṃ preṣyann āhvayati /
analyzed: pitā putram preṣyan āhvayati
translated: When the father is about to send the son, he calls him.

original: navais tṛṇair agāraṃ saṃstīryāgnim upasamādhāyodakumbhaṃ sapātram upanidhāyāhatena vāsasā saṃpracchannaḥ pitā śete /
analyzed: navaiḥ tṛṇaiḥ agāram saṃstīrya agnim upasamādhāya uda kumbham sa pātram upanidhāya ahatena vāsasā saṃpracchannaḥ pitā śete
translated: Having strewn the house with fresh grass, having put wood on the fire, having placed a water-pot with a vessel nearby, the father lies down covered with a new garment.

original: etya putra upariṣṭād abhinipadyata indriyair indriyāṇi saṃspṛśya /
analyzed: etya putraḥ upariṣṭāt abhinipadyate indriyaiḥ indriyāṇi saṃspṛśya
translated: The son comes and sits on top of him, touching sense organ with sense organ.

original: api vāsmā āsīnāyābhimukhāyaiva saṃpradadyāt /
analyzed: api vā asmai āsīnāya abhimukhāya eva saṃpradadyāt
translated: Or he should give it to him while sitting facing him.

original: athāsmai saṃprayacchati /🔽vācaṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: atha asmai saṃprayacchati  vācam me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: Then he gives it to him.🔽The father says, I place my speech in you.

original: vācaṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: vācam te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I place your speech in me.

original: prāṇaṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: prāṇam me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I place my life force in you.

original: prāṇaṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: prāṇam te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I place your life force in me.

original: cakṣur me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I place my eye in you.

original: cakṣus te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I place your eye in me.

original: śrotraṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: śrotram me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I place my ear in you.

original: śrotraṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: śrotram te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I place your ear in me.

original: annarasān me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: anna rasān me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I place the juices of food in you.

original: annarasāṃs te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: anna rasān te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I place your food juices in me.

original: karmāṇi me tvayi dadhānīti
analyzed: karmāṇi me tvayi dadhāni iti
translated: The father says, I entrust my actions to you.

original: pitā / karmāṇi te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: pitā karmāṇi te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I entrust my actions to you.

original: sukhaduḥkhe me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: sukha duḥkhe me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I entrust my happiness and sorrow to you.

original: sukhaduḥkhe te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /🔽ānandaṃ ratiṃ prajātiṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: sukha duḥkhe te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ  ānandam ratim prajātim me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The son says, I entrust my happiness and sorrow to you.🔽The father says, I entrust my joy, delight, and progeny to you.

original: ānandaṃ ratiṃ prajātiṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: ānandam ratim prajātim te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I entrust my joy, delight, and progeny to you.

original: ityāṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: ityām me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I entrust my life to you.

original: ityāṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /🔽dhiyo vijñātavyaṃ kāmān me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: ityām te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ  dhiyaḥ vijñātavyam kāmān me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The son says, I entrust my life to you.🔽The father says, I entrust my thoughts and desires to you.

original: dhiyo vijñātavyaṃ kāmāṃs te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: dhiyaḥ vijñātavyam kāmān te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I entrust my thoughts and desires to you.

original: mano me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: manaḥ me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I entrust my mind to you.

original: manas te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I entrust my mind to you.

original: prajñāṃ me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: prajñām me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: The father says, I entrust my wisdom to you.

original: prajñāṃ te mayi dadha iti putraḥ /
analyzed: prajñām te mayi dadhe iti putraḥ
translated: The son says, I entrust my wisdom to you.

original: yad u vā upābhigadaḥ syāt samāsenaiva brūyāt /🔽prāṇān me tvayi dadhānīti pitā /
analyzed: yat u vai upābhigadaḥ syāt samāsena eva brūyāt  prāṇān me tvayi dadhāni iti pitā
translated: If there is a quarrel, one should speak briefly.🔽The father says, I entrust my life to you.

original: prāṇāṃs te mayi dadha iti
analyzed: prāṇān te mayi dadhe iti
translated: The son says, I entrust my life to you.

original: putraḥ / atha dakṣiṇāvṛd upaniṣkrāmati /
analyzed: putraḥ atha dakṣiṇa āvṛt upaniṣkrāmati
translated: Then he goes out, turning to the right.

original: taṃ pitrānumantrayate /
analyzed: tam pitrā anumantrayate
translated: The father recites for him.

original: yaśo brahmavarcasaṃ kīrtis tvā juṣatām iti /
analyzed: yaśaḥ brahmavarcasam kīrtiḥ tvā juṣatām iti
translated: May fame, spiritual power, glory, and prosperity favor you.

original: athetaraḥ savyam anvaṃsam abhyavekṣate /
analyzed: atha itaraḥ savyam anvaṃsam abhyavekṣate
translated: Then the other looks at the left shoulder,

original: pāṇināntardhāya vasanāntena vā pracchādya svargāl lokān kāmān āpnuhīti /
analyzed: pāṇinā antardhāya vasana antena vā pracchādya svargān lokān kāmān āpnuhi iti
translated: covering it with his hand or the edge of his garment, and says, Attain the desires of the heavenly world.

original: sa yadyugadaḥ syāt putrasyaiśvarye pitā vaset /
analyzed: sa yadi yuga daḥ syāt putrasya aiśvarye pitā vaset
translated: If he is a married man, the father should live under the authority of his son,

original: pari vā vrajet /
analyzed: pari vā vrajet
translated: or should go around him.

original: yadyu vai preyāt tathaivainaṃ samāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yadi u vai preyāt tathā eva enam samāpayeyuḥ
translated: If he should die, they should complete it for him in the same way.

original: yathā samāpayitavyo bhavati yathā samāpayitavyo bhavati //
analyzed: yathā samāpayitavyaḥ bhavati yathā samāpayitavyaḥ bhavati
translated: As it should be completed, as it should be completed.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter of the Sankhayana Aranyaka.

original: pratardano ha vai daivodāsir indrasya priyaṃ dhāmopajagāma yuddhena ca pauruṣeṇa ca /
analyzed: pratardanaḥ ha vai daivodāsiḥ indrasya priyam dhāma upajagāma yuddhena ca pauruṣeṇa ca
translated: Pratardana, the son of Divodasa, approached Indra's beloved abode through battle and manly effort.

original: taṃ indra uvāca pratardanaṃ varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti /
analyzed: tam indraḥ uvāca pratardanam varam vṛṇīṣva iti
translated: Indra said to Pratardana, Choose a boon.

original: sa hovāca pratardanaḥ tvam eva me vṛṇīṣva yaṃ tvaṃ manuṣyāya hitatamaṃ manyasa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca pratardanaḥ tvam eva me vṛṇīṣva yam tvam manuṣyāya hitatamam manyase iti
translated: Pratardana said, Choose for me what you consider most beneficial for a man.

original: taṃ indra uvāca na vai varo 'varasmai vṛṇīte /
analyzed: tam indraḥ uvāca na vai varaḥ varasmai vṛṇīte
translated: Indra said to him, One does not choose a boon for an inferior.

original: tvam eva vṛṇīṣveti /
analyzed: tvam eva vṛṇīṣva iti
translated: You yourself choose.

original: avaro vai kila meti hovāca pratardanaḥ /
analyzed: avaraḥ vai kila mā iti ha uvāca pratardanaḥ
translated: Pratardana said, An inferior, indeed, am I.

original: atho khalvindraḥ satyād eva neyāya /
analyzed: atha u khalu indraḥ satyāt eva na iyāya
translated: Now, indeed, Indra went away from truth.

original: satyaṃ hīndraḥ /
analyzed: satyam hi indraḥ
translated: For Indra is truth.

original: taṃ hendra uvāca mām eva vijānīhi /
analyzed: tam ha indraḥ uvāca mām eva vijānīhi
translated: To him Indra said: Know me alone.

original: etad evāhaṃ manuṣyāya hitatamaṃ manye yo māṃ vijānīyāt /
analyzed: etat eva aham manuṣyāya hitatamam manye yaḥ mām vijānīyāt
translated: This, indeed, I consider to be the most beneficial for man, that he should know me.

original: triśīrṣāṇaṃ tvāṣṭram ahanam /
analyzed: tri śīrṣāṇam tvāṣṭram ahanam
translated: I killed the three-headed son of Tvastr.

original: arurmukhān yatīn sālāvṛkebhyaḥ prāyacchham /
analyzed: arurmukhān yatīn sālāvṛkebhyaḥ prāyacchham
translated: I gave the Yatis with mouths of goats to the wolves of Sāla.

original: bahvīḥ saṃdhā atrikramya divi prahlādīyān atṛṇaham antarikṣe /
analyzed: bahvīḥ saṃdhāḥ a trikramya divi prahlādīyān atṛṇaham antarikṣe
translated: Having passed through many joints, I did not cut the grass in the sky, in the Prahladīya.

original: paulomān pṛthivyāṃ kālakhañjā /
analyzed: paulomān pṛthivyām kālakhañjā
translated: The Paulomas on earth, the Kālakhañjas.

original: tasya me tatra na lomacanāmīyata /
analyzed: tasya me tatra na loma cana amīyata
translated: There I did not feel any hair-raising.

original: sa yo māṃ veda na ha vai tasya kena ca karmaṇā loko mīyate /
analyzed: sa yaḥ mām veda na ha vai tasya kena ca karmaṇā lokaḥ mīyate
translated: He who knows me, his world is not destroyed by any action.

original: na steyena na bhrūṇahatyayā na mātṛvadhena na pitṛvadhena /
analyzed: na steyena na bhrūṇa hatyayā na mātṛ vadhena na pitṛ vadhena
translated: Not by theft, not by killing a fetus, not by killing a mother, not by killing a father.

original: nādya pāpaṃ cakruṣo mukhān nīlaṃ vyetīti //
analyzed: na adya pāpam cakruṣaḥ mukhāt nīlam vyeti iti
translated: The black sin does not pass from the face of the sinful one.

original: sa hovāca prāṇo 'smi prajñātmā /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca prāṇaḥ smi prajñā ātmā
translated: He said: I am the life-breath, the soul of wisdom.

original: taṃ mām āyur amṛtam ityupāsva /🔽āyuḥ prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tam mām āyuḥ amṛtam iti upāsva  āyuḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: Worship me as life, as immortality.🔽Life is the life-breath.

original: prāṇo vā āyuḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai āyuḥ
translated: The life-breath is life.

original: yāvad dhyasmin śarīre prāṇo bhavati yāvad āyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat hi asmin śarīre prāṇaḥ bhavati yāvat āyuḥ
translated: For as long as the life-breath is in this body, for that long is life.

original: prāṇena hyevāsmil loke 'mṛtatvam āpnoti /
analyzed: prāṇena hi eva asmin loke mṛta tvam āpnoti
translated: For by the life-breath one attains immortality in this world.

original: prajñayā satyaṃ saṃkalpaṃ /
analyzed: prajñayā satyam saṃkalpam
translated: By wisdom, truth is conceived.

original: sa yo mām āyur amṛtam ityupāste /
analyzed: sa yaḥ mām āyuḥ amṛtam iti upāste
translated: He who worships me as life and immortality,

original: sarvam āyur asmil loka eti /
analyzed: sarvam āyuḥ asmin loke eti
translated: he attains the full life in this world.

original: āpnotyamṛtatvam akṣitiṃ svarge loke /
analyzed: āpnoti amṛta tvam akṣitim svarge loke
translated: He attains immortality and imperishable heaven.

original: tad dhaika āhur ekabhūyaṃ vai prāṇā gacchantīti /
analyzed: tat ha eke āhuḥ eka bhūyam vai prāṇāḥ gacchanti iti
translated: Now, some say that the vital breaths go to one place.

original: na hi kaścana śaknuyāt sakṛd vācā nāma prajñāpayituṃ cakṣuṣā rūpaṃ śrotreṇa śabdaṃ manasā dhyātum /
analyzed: na hi kaścana śaknuyāt sakṛt vācā nāma prajñāpayitum cakṣuṣā rūpam śrotreṇa śabdam manasā dhyātum
translated: For no one would be able to cognize by speech alone, by the eye alone a form, by the ear alone a sound, by the mind alone.

original: ekabhūyaṃ vai prāṇā bhūtvaivaikaikam etāni sarvāṇi prajñāpayantīti /
analyzed: eka bhūyam vai prāṇāḥ bhūtvā eva ekaikam etāni sarvāṇi prajñāpayanti iti
translated: Having become one place, the vital breaths cognize each of these individually.

original: vācaṃ vadantīṃ sarve prāṇā anuvadanti /
analyzed: vācam vadantīm sarve prāṇāḥ anuvadanti
translated: When speech speaks, all the vital breaths speak after it.

original: cakṣuḥ paśyat sarve prāṇā anupaśyanti /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ paśyat sarve prāṇāḥ anupaśyanti
translated: When the eye sees, all the vital breaths see after it.

original: śrotraṃ śṛṇvat sarve prāṇā anuśṛṇvanti /
analyzed: śrotram śṛṇvat sarve prāṇāḥ anuśṛṇvanti
translated: When the ear hears, all the vital breaths hear after it.

original: mano dhyāyat sarve prāṇā anudhyāyanti /
analyzed: manaḥ dhyāyat sarve prāṇāḥ anudhyāyanti
translated: When the mind thinks, all the vital breaths think after it.

original: prāṇaṃ prāṇantaṃ sarve prāṇā anuprāṇanti /
analyzed: prāṇam prāṇantam sarve prāṇāḥ anuprāṇanti
translated: When the vital breath breathes, all the vital breaths breathe after it.

original: evam u haitad iti hendra uvāca /
analyzed: evam u ha etat iti ha indraḥ uvāca
translated: Thus it is indeed, Indra said.

original: asti tveva prāṇānāṃ niḥśreyasam iti //
analyzed: asti tu eva prāṇānām niḥśreyasam iti
translated: But there is indeed a higher good for the vital breaths.

original: jīvati vāgapetaḥ /
analyzed: jīvati vāc apetaḥ
translated: One lives without speech.

original: mūkān hi paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: mūkān hi paśyāmaḥ
translated: For we see dumb people.

original: jīvati cakṣurapetaḥ /
analyzed: jīvati cakṣuḥ apetaḥ
translated: One lives without the eye.

original: anvān hi paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: anvān hi paśyāmaḥ
translated: For we see blind people.

original: jīvati śrotrāpetaḥ /
analyzed: jīvati śrotra apetaḥ
translated: One lives without ears.

original: badhirān hi paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: badhirān hi paśyāmaḥ
translated: For we see the deaf.

original: jīvati mano'petaḥ /
analyzed: jīvati manaḥ upetaḥ
translated: One lives without mind.

original: bālān hi paśyāmaḥ /🔽jīvati bāhucchinnaḥ /
analyzed: bālān hi paśyāmaḥ  jīvati bāhu chinnaḥ
translated: For we see fools.🔽One lives with an arm cut off.

original: jīvatyūrucchinnaḥ /
analyzed: jīvati ūrucchinnaḥ
translated: One lives with a leg cut off.

original: ityevaṃ hi paśyāma iti /
analyzed: iti evam hi paśyāmaḥ iti
translated: For we see it thus.

original: atha khalu prāṇa eva prajñātmedaṃ śarīraṃ parigṛhyotthāpayati /
analyzed: atha khalu prāṇaḥ eva prajñā ātmā idam śarīram parigṛhya utthāpayati
translated: Then indeed, the vital breath itself, having taken up this body with the self of wisdom, raises it up.

original: tasmād etad evoktham upāsīteti /
analyzed: tasmāt etat eva uktham upāsīta iti
translated: Therefore, one should worship this very hymn.

original: saiṣā prāṇe sarvāptiḥ /🔽yo vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā /
analyzed: sā eṣā prāṇe sarvā āptiḥ  yaḥ vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā
translated: This is the complete attainment in the vital breath.🔽The vital breath is indeed wisdom.

original: yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥ
translated: Or wisdom is the vital breath.

original: tasyaiṣaiva dṛṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: tasya eṣā eva dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: This is its vision.

original: etad vijñānam /
analyzed: etat vijñānam
translated: This is knowledge.

original: yatraitat puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnaṃ na kaṃcana paśyati /
analyzed: yatra etat puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnam na kaṃcana paśyati
translated: Where this person, when asleep, sees no dream at all,

original: athāsmin prāṇa evaikadhā bhavati /
analyzed: atha asmin prāṇaḥ eva ekadhā bhavati
translated: then in that state the vital breath becomes one-fold for him.

original: tad enaṃ vāk sarvair nāmabhiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: tat enam vāc sarvaiḥ nāmabhiḥ saha apyeti
translated: Then speech comes to him with all names.

original: cakṣuḥ sarvai rūpaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ sarvaiḥ rūpaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The eye comes to him with all forms.

original: śrotraṃ sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: śrotram sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The ear comes to him with all sounds.

original: manaḥ sarvair dhyānaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: manaḥ sarvaiḥ dhyānaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The mind comes to him with all thoughts.

original: sa yadā pratibudhyate /
analyzed: sa yadā pratibudhyate
translated: When he awakens,🔽just as from a burning fire

original: yathāgner jvalataḥ sarvā diśo
analyzed: yathā agneḥ jvalataḥ sarvāḥ diśaḥ
translated: all directions

original: visphuliṅgā vipratiṣṭheran evam evaitasmād ātmanaḥ prāṇā yathāyatanaṃ vipratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: visphuliṅgāḥ vipratiṣṭheran evam eva etasmāt ātmanaḥ prāṇāḥ yathāyatanam vipratiṣṭhante
translated: The sparks would go back to their respective places. In the same way, the vital breaths go back to their respective places in this Self.

original: prāṇebhyo devāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇebhyaḥ devāḥ
translated: From the vital breaths, the gods.

original: devebhyo lokāḥ /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ lokāḥ
translated: From the gods, the worlds.

original: sa eṣa prāṇa eva prajñātmedaṃ śarīraṃ parigṛhyotthāpayati /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ eva prajñā ātmā idam śarīram parigṛhya utthāpayati
translated: This very vital breath, which is the Self of wisdom, having encompassed this body, raises it up.

original: tasmād etad evoktham upāsīteti /
analyzed: tasmāt etat eva uktham upāsīta iti
translated: Therefore, one should worship this very Udgītha.

original: saiṣā prāṇe sarvāptiḥ /🔽yo vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā /
analyzed: sā eṣā prāṇe sarvā āptiḥ  yaḥ vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā
translated: This is the complete attainment in the vital breath.🔽He who is the vital breath, that is wisdom.

original: yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥ
translated: And he who is wisdom, that is the vital breath.

original: tasyaiṣaiva siddhiḥ /
analyzed: tasya eṣā eva siddhiḥ
translated: This is its perfection.

original: etad vijñānam /
analyzed: etat vijñānam
translated: This is knowledge.

original: yatraitat puruṣa ārto mariṣyann ābalyam etya saṃmoham eti /
analyzed: yatra etat puruṣaḥ ārtaḥ mariṣyan ābalyam etya saṃmoham eti
translated: When a person is afflicted and about to die, having come to weakness and confusion,

original: tam āhuḥ udakramīc cittam /
analyzed: tam āhuḥ udakramīt cittam
translated: they say, The mind has departed.

original: na śṛṇoti /
analyzed: na śṛṇoti
translated: He does not hear.

original: na paśyati /
analyzed: na paśyati
translated: He does not see.

original: na vācā vadati /
analyzed: na vācā vadati
translated: He does not speak with speech.

original: na dhyāyati /
analyzed: na dhyāyati
translated: He does not think.

original: athāsmin prāṇa ekaikadhā bhavati /
analyzed: atha asmin prāṇe eka ekadhā bhavati
translated: Then in him, the vital breath becomes single.

original: tad enaṃ vāk sarvair nāmabhiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: tat enam vāc sarvaiḥ nāmabhiḥ saha apyeti
translated: Speech comes to him with all names.

original: cakṣuḥ sarvai rūpaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ sarvaiḥ rūpaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The eye comes to him with all forms.

original: śrotraṃ sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: śrotram sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The ear comes to him with all sounds.

original: manaḥ sarvair dhyātaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: manaḥ sarvaiḥ dhyātaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The mind comes to him with all thoughts.

original: sa yadāsmāc charīrād utkrāmati sahaivaitaiḥ sarvair utkrāmati //
analyzed: sa yadā asmāt śarīrāt utkrāmati saha eva etaiḥ sarvaiḥ utkrāmati
translated: When he departs from this body, he departs with all of them.

original: vāg evāsmin sarvāṇi nāmānyabhivisṛjyante /
analyzed: vāc eva asmin sarvāṇi nāmāni abhivisṛjyante
translated: Speech, having emitted all names into this (body),

original: vācā sarvāṇi nāmānyāpnoti /🔽prāṇa evāsmin sarve gandhā abhivisṛjyante /
analyzed: vācā sarvāṇi nāmāni āpnoti  prāṇe eva asmin sarve gandhāḥ abhivisṛjyante
translated: by speech one obtains all names.🔽Breath, having emitted all smells into this (body),

original: prāṇena sarvā gandhān āpnoti /
analyzed: prāṇena sarvān gandhān āpnoti
translated: by breath one obtains all smells.

original: cakṣur evāsmin sarvāṇi rūpāṇyabhivisṛjyante /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ eva asmin sarvāṇi rūpāṇi abhivisṛjyante
translated: The eye, having emitted all forms into this (body),

original: cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi rūpāṇyāpnoti /🔽śrotram evāsmin sarve śabdā abhivisṛjyante /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi rūpāṇi āpnoti  śrotram eva asmin sarve śabdāḥ abhivisṛjyante
translated: by the eye one obtains all forms.🔽The ear, having emitted all sounds into this (body),

original: śrotreṇa sarvāñ chabdān āpnoti /
analyzed: śrotreṇa sarvām śabdān āpnoti
translated: by the ear one obtains all sounds.

original: mana evāsmin sarvāṇi dhyātānyabhivisṛjyante /
analyzed: manaḥ eva asmin sarvāṇi dhyātāni abhivisṛjyante
translated: The mind, having emitted all thoughts into this (body),

original: manasā sarvāṇi dhyātānyāpnoti /
analyzed: manasā sarvāṇi dhyātāni āpnoti
translated: by the mind one obtains all thoughts.

original: saha hyetāvasmiñ charīre vasataḥ sahotkrāmataḥ /
analyzed: saha hi etau asmin śarīre vasataḥ saha utkrāmataḥ
translated: For these two dwell together in this body, and depart together.

original: atha yathāsmai prajñāyai sarvāṇi bhūtānyekaṃ bhavanti /🔽tad vyākhyāsyāmaḥ //
analyzed: atha yathā asmai prajñāyai sarvāṇi bhūtāni ekam bhavanti  tat vyākhyāsyāmaḥ
translated: Now we shall explain how all beings become one for this knowledge.

original: vāg evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: vāc eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: Speech is indeed one part of it that is emitted.

original: tasyai nāma parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasyai nāma parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the element of existence is arranged in order.

original: prāṇa evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: prāṇe eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: Breath is indeed one part of it that is emitted.

original: tasya gandhaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasya gandhaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, smell is the element of existence that is arranged in order.

original: cakṣur evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The eye is indeed one part of it that is emitted.

original: tasya rūpaṃ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasya rūpam parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of the ear.

original: śrotram evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: śrotram eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The ear is indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tasya śabdaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasya śabdaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of sound.

original: jihvaivāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: jihvā eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The tongue is indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tasyā annarasaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasyāḥ anna rasaḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of the taste of food.

original: hastāvevāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: hastau eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The hands are indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tayoḥ karma parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tayoḥ karma parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of their action.

original: śarīramevāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: śarīram eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The body is indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tasya sukhaduḥkhe parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasya sukha duḥkhe parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of pleasure and pain.

original: upastha evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: upasthe eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The genitals are indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tasyānando ratiḥ prajātiḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tasya ānandaḥ ratiḥ prajātiḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of bliss, delight, and procreation.

original: pādāvevāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: pādau eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The feet are indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tayor ityāḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā /
analyzed: tayoḥ ityāḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of those.

original: mana evāsyā ekam aṅgam udūḷham /
analyzed: manaḥ eva asyāḥ ekam aṅgam udūḍham
translated: The mind is indeed one of its protruding limbs.

original: tasya dhīḥ kāmāḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūtamātrā //
analyzed: tasya dhīḥ kāmāḥ parastāt prativihitā bhūta mātrā
translated: Beyond that, the elements are arranged in the form of its thought, desires, and intentions.

original: prajñayā vācaṃ samāruhya vācā sarvāṇi nāmānyāpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā vācam samāruhya vācā sarvāṇi nāmāni āpnoti
translated: Having mounted speech on wisdom, one obtains all names through speech.

original: prajñayā prāṇaṃ samāruhya prāṇena sarvān gandhān āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā prāṇam samāruhya prāṇena sarvān gandhān āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the life-breath with wisdom, one obtains all smells through the life-breath.

original: prajñayā cakṣuḥ samāruhya cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi rūpāṇyāpnoti /🔽prajñayā śrotraṃ samāruhya śrotreṇa sarvāñ chabdān āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā cakṣuḥ samāruhya cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi rūpāṇi āpnoti  prajñayā śrotram samāruhya śrotreṇa sarvān śabdān āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the eye with wisdom, one obtains all forms through the eye.🔽Having mounted the ear with wisdom, one obtains all sounds through the ear.

original: prajñayā jihvāṃ samāruhya jihvayā sarvān rasān āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā jihvām samāruhya jihvayā sarvān rasān āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the tongue with wisdom, one obtains all tastes through the tongue.

original: prajñayā hastau samāruhya hastābhyāṃ sarvāṇi karmāṇyāpnoti /🔽prajñayā śarīraṃ samāruhya śarīreṇa sukhaduḥkhe āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā hastau samāruhya hastābhyām sarvāṇi karmāṇi āpnoti  prajñayā śarīram samāruhya śarīreṇa sukha duḥkhe āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the hands with wisdom, one obtains all actions through the hands.🔽Having mounted the body with wisdom, one obtains pleasure and pain through the body.

original: prajñayopasthaṃ samāruhyupasthenānandaṃ ratiṃ prajātim āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā upastham samāruhi upasthena ānandam ratim prajātim āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the genitals with wisdom, one obtains bliss, delight, and procreation through the genitals.

original: prajñayā pādau samāruhya pādābhyāṃ sarvā ityā āpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā pādau samāruhya pādābhyām sarvāḥ ityāḥ āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the feet with wisdom, one obtains all destinations through the feet.

original: prajñayā manaḥ samāruhya manasā sarvāṇi dhyātānyāpnoti /
analyzed: prajñayā manaḥ samāruhya manasā sarvāṇi dhyātāni āpnoti
translated: Having mounted the mind with wisdom, one obtains all thoughts through the mind.

original: na hi prajñāpetā vāṅ nāma kiṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetā vāc nāma kiṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For speech, when endowed with wisdom, would not cause one to know anything by name.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: My mind was elsewhere, he says.

original: nāham etan nāma prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etat nāma prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: I did not understand this name.

original: na hi prajñāpetaḥ prāṇo gandhaṃ kaṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetaḥ prāṇaḥ gandham kaṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For the life-breath, when endowed with wisdom, would not cause one to know any smell.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etaṃ gandhaṃ prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etam gandham prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: He says, I did not perceive that smell.

original: na hi prajñāpetaṃ cakṣū rūpaṃ kiṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetam cakṣuḥ rūpam kiṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For the eye, devoid of wisdom, would not cause any form to be known.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etad rūpaṃ prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etat rūpam prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: He says, I did not perceive that form.

original: na hi prajñāpetaṃ śrotraṃ śabdaṃ kaṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetam śrotram śabdam kaṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For the ear, devoid of wisdom, would not cause any sound to be known.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etaṃ śabdaṃ prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etam śabdam prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: He says, I did not perceive that sound.

original: na hi prajñāpetā jihvānnarasaṃ kaṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetā jihvā anna rasam kaṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For the tongue, devoid of wisdom, would not cause any taste to be known.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etam annarasaṃ prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etam anna rasam prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: He says, I did not perceive that taste.

original: na hi prajñāpetau hastau karma kiṃcana prajñāpayetām /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetau hastau karma kiṃcana prajñāpayetām
translated: For the hands, devoid of wisdom, would not cause any action to be known.

original: anyatra nau mano 'bhūd ityāhatuḥ /
analyzed: anyatra nau manaḥ bhūt iti āhatuḥ
translated: They say, Our mind was elsewhere.

original: nāvām etat karma prājñāsiṣveti /
analyzed: na āvām etat karma prājñāsiṣva iti
translated: They say, We did not perceive that action.

original: na hi prajñāpetaṃ śarīraṃ na sukhaṃ na duḥkhaṃ kiṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetam śarīram na sukham na duḥkham kiṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For the body, devoid of wisdom, would not cause any pleasure or pain to be known.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etaṃ na sukhaṃ na duḥkhaṃ prājñāsiṣam iti /
analyzed: na aham etam na sukham na duḥkham prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: He says, I did not perceive that pleasure or pain.

original: na hi prajñāpeta upastha ānandaṃ na ratiṃ na prajātiṃ kāṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetaḥ upasthaḥ ānandam na ratim na prajātim kāṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For one without wisdom would not be able to point out any joy, delight, or arising.

original: anyatra me mano 'bhūd ityāha /
analyzed: anyatra me manaḥ bhūt iti āha
translated: He says, My mind was elsewhere.

original: nāham etam ānandaṃ na ratiṃ prajātiṃ prājñāsiṣam iti
analyzed: na aham etam ānandam na ratim prajātim prājñāsiṣam iti
translated: I did not know that joy, delight, or arising,

original: na hi prajñāpetau pādāv ityāṃ kāṃcana prajñāpayet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetau pādau ityām kāṃcana prajñāpayet
translated: For one without feet would not be able to point out anything.

original: anyatra nau mano 'bhūd ityāha /🔽nāvām etām ityāṃ prājñāsiṣveti /
analyzed: anyatra nau manaḥ bhūt iti āha  na āvām etām ityām prājñāsiṣva iti
translated: He says, Our minds were elsewhere.🔽I did not know that,

original: na hi prajñāpetā dhīḥ kāṃcana sidhyet /
analyzed: na hi prajñā apetā dhīḥ kāṃcana sidhyet
translated: For one without wisdom would not be able to accomplish anything.

original: na prajñātavyaṃ prajñāyet //
analyzed: na prajñātavyam prajñāyet
translated: One should not know what is to be known.

original: na vācaṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na vācam vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek speech.

original: vaktāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: vaktāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the speaker.

original: na gandhaṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na gandham vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek smell.

original: ghrātāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: ghrātāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the smeller.

original: na rūpaṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na rūpam vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek form.

original: draṣṭāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: draṣṭāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the seer.

original: na śabdaṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na śabdam vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek sound.

original: śrotāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: śrotāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the hearer.

original: nānnarasaṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na anna rasam vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek the taste of food.

original: annarasasya vijñātāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: anna rasasya vijñātāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the one who knows the taste of food.

original: na karma vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na karma vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek action.

original: kartāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: kartāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the doer.

original: na sukhaduḥkhe vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na sukha duḥkhe vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek pleasure and pain.

original: sukhaduḥkhayor vistāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: sukha duḥkhayoḥ vistāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the experiencer of pleasure and pain.

original: nānandaṃ na ratiṃ na prajātiṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na ānandam na ratim na prajātim vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek joy, delight, or arising.

original: ānandasya rateḥ prajāter vijñātāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: ānandasya rateḥ prajāteḥ vijñātāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the knower of bliss, of joy, of generation.

original: netyāṃ vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na ityām vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek to know the mind.

original: etāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: etāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the thinker.

original: na mano vijijñāsīti /
analyzed: na manaḥ vijijñāsīti
translated: One should not seek to know the mind.

original: mantāraṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: mantāram vidyāt
translated: One should know the knower.

original: tā vā etā daśaiva bhūtamātrā adhiprajñam /
analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ daśa eva bhūtamātrāḥ adhiprajñam
translated: These ten elements are indeed the parts of the earth.

original: daśa prajñāmātrā adhibhutam /🔽yad dhi bhūtamātrā na syur na prajñāmātrāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: daśa prajñāmātrāḥ adhibhutam  yat hi bhūtamātrāḥ na syuḥ na prajñāmātrāḥ syuḥ
translated: The ten parts of wisdom are the parts of the elements.🔽For if there were no parts of the elements, there would be no parts of wisdom.

original: yad vā prajñāmātrā na syur na bhūtamātrāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: yat vā prajñāmātrāḥ na syuḥ na bhūtamātrāḥ syuḥ
translated: Or if there were no parts of wisdom, there would be no parts of the elements.

original: na hyanyatarato rūpaṃ kiṃcana sidhyet /
analyzed: na hi anyataratas rūpam kiṃcana sidhyet
translated: For no form would be established from either side.

original: no eta nānā /
analyzed: no eta nānā
translated: But they are not different.

original: tad yathā rathasyāreṣu nemir arpitaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā rathasya areṣu nemiḥ arpitaḥ
translated: Just as the rim of a chariot is fixed to the spokes,

original: nābhāvarā arpitāḥ /
analyzed: nābhau arāḥ arpitāḥ
translated: and the spokes are fixed to the nave.

original: evam evaitā bhūtāmātrāḥ prajñāmātrāsvarpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva etāḥ bhūtāmātrāḥ prajñāmātrāsu arpitāḥ
translated: In the same way, these parts of the elements are fixed to the parts of wisdom.

original: prajñāmātrāḥ prāṇe 'rpitāḥ /
analyzed: prajñāmātrāḥ prāṇe rpitāḥ
translated: The parts of wisdom are fixed to the vital breath.

original: sa eṣa prāṇa eva prajñātmānanto 'jaro 'mṛto na sādhunā karmaṇā bhūyān bhavati np evāsādhunā kanīyān /🔽eṣa hyeva sādhu karma kārayati taṃ yam ebhyo lokebhya unninīṣate /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ eva prajñā ātmā anantaḥ jaraḥ mṛtaḥ na sādhunā karmaṇā bhūyān bhavati np eva asādhunā kanīyān  eṣa hi eva sādhu karma kārayati tam yam ebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ unninīṣate
translated: This vital breath itself is the self of wisdom, infinite, immortal, and deathless. It does not become greater by good action, nor smaller by bad action.🔽For it is he who makes one do good action whom it leads upwards from these worlds.

original: eṣa u evāsādhu karma kārayati taṃ yam adho ninīṣate /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva asādhu karma kārayati tam yam adhas ninīṣate
translated: And it is he who makes one do bad action whom it leads downwards.

original: eṣa lokapālaḥ /🔽eṣa lokādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa lokapālaḥ  eṣa loka adhipatiḥ
translated: He is the guardian of the world.🔽He is the lord of the worlds.

original: eṣa lokeśaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa loka īśaḥ
translated: He is the lord of the world.

original: sa ma ātmeti vidyāt sa ma ātmeti vidyāt //
analyzed: sa me ātmā iti vidyāt sa me ātmā iti vidyāt
translated: One should know that he is my Self, one should know that he is my Self.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: atha gārgyo bālākir anūcānaḥ saṃspaṣṭa āsa /
analyzed: atha gārgyaḥ bālākiḥ anūcānaḥ saṃspaṣṭaḥ āsa
translated: Now, the student Gārgya Bālāki was staying with the Uśīnara people.

original: so 'vasad uśīnareṣu so 'vasan matsyeṣu kurupañcāleṣu kāśivideheṣviti /
analyzed: saḥ vasat uśīnareṣu saḥ vasat matsyeṣu kuru pañcāleṣu kāśi videheṣu iti
translated: He stayed with the Matsya people, the Kuru-Pāñcāla people, the Kāśi-Videha people.

original: sa hājātaśatruṃ kāśyam āvrajyovāca brahma te bravāṇīti /
analyzed: sa ha ajātaśatrum kāśyam āvrajya uvāca brahma te bravāṇi iti
translated: He went to Ajātaśatru of Kāśi and said, I will tell you the Brahman.

original: taṃ hovācājataśatruḥ sahasraṃ dadmi ta ityetasyāṃ vāci /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajataśatruḥ sahasram dadmi te iti etasyām vāci
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, I will give you a thousand for this statement.

original: janako janaka iti vā u janā dhāvantīti //🔽āditye bṛhat /
analyzed: janakaḥ janakaḥ iti vai u janāḥ dhāvanti iti  āditye bṛhat
translated: Janaka, Janaka, the people run to him.🔽In the sun, the great.

original: candramasyannam /
analyzed: candramasi annam
translated: In the moon, food.

original: vidyuti satyam /🔽stanayitnau śabdaḥ /
analyzed: vidyuti satyam  stanayitnau śabdaḥ
translated: In lightning, truth.🔽In thunder, sound.

original: vāyāvindro vaikuṇṭhaḥ /
analyzed: vāyau indraḥ vaikuṇṭhaḥ
translated: In the wind, Indra, the unshaken.

original: ākāśe pūrṇam /
analyzed: ākāśe pūrṇam
translated: In space, the full.

original: agnau viṣāsahiḥ / apsu tejaḥ /
analyzed: agnau viṣāsahiḥ apsu tejaḥ
translated: In fire, the poison-enduring. In water, brilliance.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus, in the gods.

original: atādhyātmam ādarśe pratirūpaḥ /
analyzed: ādarśe pratirūpaḥ

original: chāyāyāṃ dvitīyaḥ /🔽pratiśrutkāyām asuriti /
analyzed: chāyāyām dvitīyaḥ  pratiśrutkāyām asuḥ iti

original: śabde mṛtyuḥ /
analyzed: śabde mṛtyuḥ

original: svapne yamaḥ /
analyzed: svapne yamaḥ

original: śarīre prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: śarīre prajāpatiḥ
translated: In the body, Prajāpati.

original: dakṣiṇe' kṣiṇi vācaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇe kṣiṇi vācaḥ

original: savye 'kṣiṇi satyasya //
analyzed: savye kṣiṇi satyasya

analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa āditye puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ

analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste tiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām mūrdhā bhavati

analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa candramasi puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /

translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not discuss this with me.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa vidyuti puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaka said, 'The person who is in the lightning, him I worship.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: satyasyātmeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /

translated: He who worships him thus becomes the soul of truth.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa stanayitnau puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in the thunder, on him I meditate.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ

analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste śabdasya ātmā bhavati
translated: He who meditates on him thus becomes the soul of sound.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa vāyau puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa vāyau puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in the wind, on him I meditate.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: indro vaikuṇṭho 'parājitā seneti vā aham etam upāsa iti /

analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste jiṣṇuḥ ha vai aparājiṣṇuḥ anyatastya jāyī bhavati
translated: He who meditates on him thus becomes victorious and unconquerable, and is born elsewhere as a conqueror.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa ākāśe puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa ākāśe puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in space, on him I meditate.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: pūṛnam apravarti brahmeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: pūṛnam a pravarti brahma iti vai aham etam upāse iti
