analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste pūryate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who reverences him thus is filled with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual lustre, with heaven, with all life.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣo 'gnau puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣaḥ gnau puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in the fire, him I reverence.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: viṣāsahir iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: viṣāsahiḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I reverence him as one who conquers poison.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste viṣāsahir haivānyeṣu bhavati //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste viṣāsahiḥ ha eva anyeṣu bhavati
translated: He who reverences him thus conquers poison in regard to others.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣo 'psu puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa u psu puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in the water, him I reverence.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: tejasa ātmeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: tejasaḥ ātmā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I reverence him as the self of light.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste tejasa ātmā bhavati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste tejasaḥ ātmā bhavati
translated: He who reverences him thus becomes the self of light.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: This is in regard to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam //
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now in regard to the self.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa ādarśe puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa ādarśe puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Bālāki said, 'The person who is in the mirror, him I reverence.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: pratirūpa iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: pratirūpaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I reverence him as a reflection.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste pratirūpo haivāsya prajāyām ājāyate nāpratirūpaḥ //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste pratirūpaḥ ha eva asya prajāyām ājāyate na apratirūpaḥ
translated: One who reveres him thus is born in his own family, not in an alien one.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa cchāyāyāṃ puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa chāyāyām puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaki said, 'I worship that person who is in the shadow.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: dvitīyo 'napaga iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ napagaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as the second, the non-departing one.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste vindate dvitīyāt /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste vindate dvitīyāt
translated: One who reveres him thus obtains a second.

original: dvitīyavān bhavati //
analyzed: dvitīyavān bhavati
translated: He becomes possessed of a second.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa pratiśrutkāyāṃ puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa pratiśrutkāyām puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaki said, 'I worship that person who is in the echo.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: asur iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: asuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste na purā kālāt saṃmoham eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste na purā kālāt saṃmoham eti
translated: One who reveres him thus does not become confused before his time.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa śabde puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa śabde puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaki said, 'I worship that person who is in the sound.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: mṛtyur iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as Death.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste na purā kālāt praiti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste na purā kālāt praiti
translated: One who reveres it in this way does not die before his time.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ yenaitat puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnayā carati tamu evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yena etat puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnayā carati tam u eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaka said, 'I worship that by which the person moves about in a dream while asleep.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: yamo rājeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: yamaḥ rājā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as Yama, the king.'

analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste sarvam ha asmai idam śraiṣṭhyāya yamyate
translated: One who reveres him in this way is made by him the foremost in everything.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa śarīre puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa śarīre puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaka said, 'I worship that person who is in the body.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: prajāpatir iti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: I worship him as Prajapati.'

analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste prajāyate prajayā paśbhiḥ yaśasā brahmavaracasema svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: One who reveres him in this way is born with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with the highest blessing of Brahmins, with heaven, and with the whole life span.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa dakṣiṇe 'kṣiṇi puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa dakṣiṇe kṣiṇi puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaka said, 'I worship that person who is in the right eye.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not discuss this with me.

original: vāca ātmāgner ātmā jyotiṣa ātmeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: vācaḥ ātmā agneḥ ātmā jyotiṣaḥ ātmā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: 'Speech is the self of Agni, the self of light,' thus I worship him.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste eteṣāṃ sarveṣām ātmā bhavati //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste eteṣām sarveṣām ātmā bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes the self of all these.

original: sa hovāca bālākiḥ ya evaiṣa savye 'kṣiṇi puruṣas tam evāham upāsa iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca bālākiḥ yaḥ eva eṣa savye kṣiṇi puruṣaḥ tam eva aham upāse iti
translated: Balaki said, 'I worship the person who is in the left eye.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mā maitasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Do not argue with me about this.

original: satyasyātm vidyuta ātmā tejasa ātmeti vā aham etam upāsa iti /
analyzed: satyasya ātm vidyutaḥ ātmā tejasaḥ ātmā iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: 'The self of truth, the self of lightning, the self of light,' thus I worship him.'

original: sa yo haitam evam upāste eteṣāṃ sarveṣām ātmā bhavati //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ha etam evam upāste eteṣām sarveṣām ātmā bhavati
translated: He who worships him thus becomes the self of all these.

original: tata u ha bālākis tūṣṇīm āsa /
analyzed: tatas u ha bālākiḥ tūṣṇīm āsa
translated: Then Balaki sat silent.

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ etāvān nu iti /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ etāvān nu bālākāḥ iti
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'Is this all?'

original: etāvad iti hovāca bālākiḥ /
analyzed: etāvat iti ha uvāca bālākiḥ
translated: Balaki said, 'This is all.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ mṛṣā vai khalu mā saṃvādayiṣṭhā brahma te bravāṇīti /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mṛṣā vai khalu mā saṃvādayiṣṭhāḥ brahma te bravāṇi iti
translated: Ajatasatru said to him, 'You have certainly deceived me. I will tell you about Brahman.'

original: sa hovāca yo vai bālāka eteṣāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ kartā yasya vaitat karma sa vai veditavya iti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yaḥ vai bālākaḥ eteṣām puruṣāṇām kartā yasya vā etat karma sa vai veditavyaḥ iti
translated: He said, 'Balaki, he who is the maker of these persons, for whom this is the work, he should be known.'

original: tata u ha bālākiḥ samitpāṇiḥ praticakrama upāyānīti /
analyzed: tatas u ha bālākiḥ samidh pāṇiḥ praticakrame upāyāni iti
translated: Then Balaki came back with a bundle of sacrificial fuel in his hand, saying, 'Let us go.'

original: taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ pratilomarūpam eva tan manye yat kṣatriyo brāhmaṇam upanayeta /
analyzed: tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ pratiloma rūpam eva tat manye yat kṣatriyaḥ brāhmaṇam upanayeta
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'I consider it to be against the natural order that a Kṣatriya should initiate a Brāhmaṇa.

original: ehi vyeva tvā jñapayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: ehi vi eva tvā jñapayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Come, I will make you understand.'

original: taṃ ha pāṇāvabhipadya pravavrāja /
analyzed: tam ha pāṇau abhipadya pravavrāja
translated: He took him by the hand and went away.

original: tau ha suptaṃ puruṣam ājagmatuḥ /
analyzed: tau ha suptam puruṣam ājagmatuḥ
translated: They came to a sleeping man.

original: taṃ hājātaśatrur āmantrayāñcakre bṛhan pāṇḍaravāsaḥ soma rājann iti /
analyzed: tam ha ajātaśatruḥ āmantrayāñcakre bṛhan pāṇḍara vāsaḥ soma rājan iti
translated: Ajātaśatru addressed him, 'O Soma, king, you who are great, clothed in white!'

original: sa u ha śiśya eva /🔽tat u hainaṃ yaṣṭyā vicikṣepa /
analyzed: saḥ u ha śiśye eva  tat u ha enam yaṣṭyā vicikṣepa
translated: He was indeed asleep.🔽He struck him with a stick.

original: sa tata eva samuttasthau /🔽taṃ hovācājātaśatruḥ kvaiṣa etad bālāke puruṣo 'śayiṣṭa /🔽yatraitad abhūt /
analyzed: sa tatas eva samuttasthau  tam ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ kva eṣa etat bālāke śayiṣṭa  yatra etat abhūt
translated: He got up right then.

original: yata etad āgād iti /
analyzed: yatas etat āgāt iti
translated: Ajātaśatru said to him, 'Where did this man lie down, Bālāka, where was he, from where did he come?'

original: hitā nama puruṣasya nāḍyo hṛdayāt purītatam abhipratanvanti tad yathā sahasradhā keśo vipāṭitastvāvad aṇvyaḥ /
analyzed: hitāḥ puruṣasya nāḍyaḥ hṛdayāt purītatam abhipratanvanti tat yathā sahasradhā keśaḥ vipāṭitaḥ tvāvat aṇvyaḥ
translated: The vital channels of a man extend from the heart to the navel, just as a hair split a thousandfold, so fine are they.

original: piṅgalasyāṇimnyas tiṣṭhanti śuklasya kṛṣṇasya pītasya lohitasya ca /
analyzed: piṅgalasya aṇimnyaḥ tiṣṭhanti śuklasya kṛṣṇasya pītasya lohitasya ca
translated: They are of the colors of the subtle elements: yellow, black, white, and red.

original: tāsu tadā bhavati yadā suptaḥ svapnaṃ na kaṃcana paśyati //
analyzed: tāsu tadā bhavati yadā suptaḥ svapnam na kaṃcana paśyati
translated: In them he abides when he is asleep and sees no dreams at all.

original: athāsmin prāṇa ekaikadhā bhavati /
analyzed: atha asmin prāṇe eka ekadhā bhavati
translated: Then in him that vital air becomes one-fold.

original: tad enaṃ vāk sarvair nāmabhiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: tat enam vāc sarvaiḥ nāmabhiḥ saha apyeti
translated: Speech comes to him together with all names.

original: cakṣuḥ sarvai rūpaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ sarvaiḥ rūpaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The eye comes to him together with all forms.

original: śrotraṃ sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: śrotram sarvaiḥ śabdaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The ear comes to him together with all sounds.

original: manaḥ sarvair dhyātaiḥ sahāpyeti /
analyzed: manaḥ sarvaiḥ dhyātaiḥ saha apyeti
translated: The mind comes to him together with all thoughts.

original: sa yadA pratibudhyate /
analyzed: sa yadā pratibudhyate
translated: When he awakes,

original: yathāgner jvalataḥ sarvā diśo visphuliṅgā vipratiṣṭheran evam evaitasmād ātmanaḥ prāṇā yathāyatanaṃ vipratiṣṭhante prāṇebhyo devāḥ devebhyo
analyzed: yathā agneḥ jvalataḥ sarvāḥ diśaḥ visphuliṅgāḥ vipratiṣṭheran evam eva etasmāt ātmanaḥ prāṇāḥ yathāyatanam vipratiṣṭhante prāṇebhyaḥ devāḥ devebhyaḥ
translated: just as sparks fly out in all directions from a blazing fire, in the same way, from this Self, the vital breaths go out to their respective abodes. From the vital breaths, the gods. From the gods,

original: lokāḥ /
analyzed: lokāḥ
translated: the worlds.

original: sa eṣa prāṇa eva prajñātmedaṃ śarīram AtmAnam anupraviṣṭa ā lomabhya ā nakhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa prāṇaḥ eva prajñā ātmā idam śarīram anupraviṣṭaḥ ā lomabhyaḥ ā nakhebhyaḥ
translated: This very vital breath, which is the Self consisting of intelligence, enters this body from the hair to the nails.

original: tad yathā kṣuraḥ kṣuradhāne vopahito viśvaṃbharo vā viśvaṃbarakulāya evam evaiṣa prajñātmedaṃ śarīram ātmānam anupraviṣṭa ā lomabhya ā nakhebhyaḥ
analyzed: tat yathā kṣuraḥ kṣura dhāne vā upahitaḥ viśvaṃbharaḥ vā viśvaṃbara kulāyaḥ evam eva eṣa prajñā ātmā idam śarīram ātmānam anupraviṣṭaḥ ā lomabhyaḥ ā nakhebhyaḥ
translated: Just as a razor is placed in a razor-case or a snake in a snake-case, in the same way, this Self consisting of intelligence enters this body from the hair to the nails.

original: tam etam ātmānam eta ātmāno 'nvavasyante yathā śreṣṭhinaṃ svāḥ /
analyzed: tam etam ātmānam ete ātmānaḥ nu avasyante yathā śreṣṭhinam svāḥ
translated: These selves enter into this Self, just as dependents enter into a chief.

original: tad yatha śreṣṭhī svair bhuṅkte yathā vā svāḥ śreṣṭhinaṃ bhuñjanti /
analyzed: tat śreṣṭhī svaiḥ bhuṅkte yathā vā svāḥ śreṣṭhinam bhuñjanti
translated: Just as a chief eats with his dependents or the dependents eat with the chief,

original: evam evaiṣa prajñātmaitair ātmabhir bhuṅkte /
analyzed: evam eva eṣa prajñā ātmā etaiḥ ātmabhiḥ bhuṅkte
translated: In the same way, this one, whose essence is wisdom, enjoys with these selves.

original: evam evaita ātmāna etam ātmānaṃ bhuñjanti /
analyzed: evam eva ete ātmānaḥ etam ātmānam bhuñjanti
translated: In the same way, these selves enjoy this self.

original: sa yāvad dha vā indra etam ātmānaṃ na vijajñe tāvad enam asurā abhibabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sa yāvat ha vai indraḥ etam ātmānam na vijajñe tāvat enam asurāḥ abhibabhūvuḥ
translated: As long as Indra did not know this self, for so long the Asuras overpowered him.

original: sa yadā vijajñe 'tha hatvāsurān vijitya sarveṣāṃ ca devānāṃ śraiṣṭhyaṃ svārājyam ādhipatyaṃ paryait /
analyzed: sa yadā vijajñe tha hatvā asurān vijitya sarveṣām ca devānām śraiṣṭhyam svārājyam ādhipatyam paryait
translated: But when he knew it, then having killed the Asuras and conquered, he attained the supremacy, the sovereignty, the lordship over all the gods.

original: tathau evaivaṃ vidvān sarvān pāpmano 'pahaty sarveṣāṃ ca bhūtānām śraiṣṭhyaṃ svārājya ādhipatyaṃ paryeti /
analyzed: tathā eva evam vidvān sarvān pāpmanaḥ u pahati sarveṣām ca bhūtānām śraiṣṭhyam svārājye ādhipatyam paryeti
translated: In the same way, one who knows this, having removed all evil, attains the supremacy, the sovereignty, the lordship over all beings.

original: ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows this, he who knows this.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: om ṛtaṃ vadiṣyāmi /
analyzed: om ṛtam vadiṣyāmi
translated: Om. I shall speak the truth.

original: satyaṃ vadiṣyāmi /
analyzed: satyam vadiṣyāmi
translated: I shall speak the truth.

original: tan mām avatu tad vaktāram avatvavatu mām avatu vaktāram /
analyzed: tat mām avatu tat vaktāram avatu avatu mām avatu vaktāram
translated: May that protect me. May that protect the speaker. May it protect me. May it protect the speaker.

original: mayi bhargo mayi mahaḥ /🔽vāṅ me manasi pratiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: mayi bhargaḥ mayi mahaḥ  vāc me manasi pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Let there be radiance in me. Let there be greatness in me.🔽My speech is established in my mind.

original: mano me vāci pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: manaḥ me vāci pratiṣṭhitam
translated: My mind is established in my speech.

original: āvir āvir mayyābhūḥ /
analyzed: āvis āvis mayi ābhūḥ
translated: Be manifest, manifest in me.

original: vedasya ma āṇīḥ /
analyzed: vedasya me āṇīḥ
translated: The essence of the Veda is in me.

original: ṛta mā mā hiṃsīḥ /
analyzed: ṛta mā mā hiṃsīḥ
translated: Do not injure me, O truth.

original: anenādhītenāhorātrān tsaṃvasāmi /
analyzed: anena adhītena ahar rātrān tsaṃvasāmi
translated: With this learning, I spend the day and night.

original: agne iḷā nama iḷā namaḥ /
analyzed: agne iḷā namaḥ iḷā namaḥ
translated: O Agni, I pay homage to Iḷā, I pay homage to Iḷā.

original: ṛṣibhyo mantrakṛdbhyo mantrapatibhyo namo 'stu devebhyaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣibhyaḥ mantra kṛdbhyaḥ mantra patibhyaḥ namaḥ stu devebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to the sages, the creators of mantras, the lords of mantras, to the gods.

original: śivā naḥ śaṭamā bhava sumṛḍīkā sarasvati mā te vyoma saṃdṛśi /
analyzed: śivā naḥ śaṭamā bhava su mṛḍīkā sarasvati mā te vyoma saṃdṛśi
translated: Be auspicious to us, O Śatā, be kindly disposed, O Sarasvatī. May your sky not be seen by us.

original: adabdhaṃ mana iṣiraṃ cakṣuḥ sūryo jyotiṣāṃ śreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: adabdham manaḥ iṣiram cakṣuḥ sūryaḥ jyotiṣām śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: The mind is undeluded, the eye is swift. The sun is the best of lights.

original: dīkṣe mā mā hiṃsīḥ //
analyzed: dīkṣe mā mā hiṃsīḥ
translated: O initiation, do not harm me.

original: athātaḥ saṃhitāyā upaniṣat /
analyzed: atha atas saṃhitāyāḥ upaniṣad
translated: Now, therefore, the Upaniṣad of the Saṃhitā.

original: pṛthivī pūrvarūpaṃ dyaur uttararūpaṃ vāyuḥ saṃhiteti śauravīro māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī pūrva rūpam dyauḥ uttara rūpam vāyuḥ saṃhitā iti śaura vīraḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: The earth is the prior form, the sky is the subsequent form, and the wind is the Saṃhitā, so Śaurāvīra Māṇḍūkya said.

original: ākāśaḥ saṃhitetyasya māṇḍavyo vedayāñ cakre sa hāviparihṛto mene na me 'sya putreṇa samagād iti /
analyzed: ākāśaḥ saṃhitā iti asya māṇḍavyaḥ vedayām cakre sa ha aviparihṛtaḥ mene na me sya putreṇa samagāt iti
translated: Ākāśa is the Saṃhitā, so his Māṇḍavya disciple understood. He considered himself not surpassed, thinking, My son has not equaled me.

original: parihṛto mena ity āgastyaḥ /
analyzed: parihṛtaḥ mene iti āgastyaḥ
translated: Āgastya considered himself surpassed.

original: samānaṃ hyatra pituśca putrasya ca vāyuś cākāśaś ca /
analyzed: samānam hi atra pituḥ ca putrasya ca vāyuḥ ca ākāśaḥ ca
translated: For here the father and the son have the same, namely, the wind and the space.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus, with regard to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now, with regard to the self.

original: vāk pūrvarūpaṃ mana uttararūpaṃ prāṇaḥ saṃhiteti śauravīro māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: vāc pūrva rūpam manaḥ uttara rūpam prāṇaḥ saṃhitā iti śaura vīraḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: Speech is the prior form, the mind is the subsequent form, and the vital breath is the Saṃhitā, so Śaurāvīra Māṇḍūkya said.

original: atha ha smāsya putra āha dīrghaḥ manasā vā agre kīrtayati tad vācā vadati /
analyzed: atha ha sma asya putraḥ āha dīrghaḥ manasā vai agre kīrtayati tat vācā vadati
translated: Then his son said: 'The mind first proclaims the long [syllable], then the speech speaks it.

original: tasmān mana eva pūrvarūpaṃ vāg uttararūpaṃ mano vāk prāṇas tveva saṃhiteti /
analyzed: tasmāt manaḥ eva pūrva rūpam vāc uttara rūpam manaḥ vāc prāṇaḥ tu eva saṃhitā iti
translated: Therefore, the mind is the first form, speech is the second form, and the mind, speech, and breath are combined.'

original: sa eṣo 'śvarathaḥ praṣṭivāhano manovākprāṇasaṃhitaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ gamayati /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa śva rathaḥ praṣṭi vāhanaḥ manaḥ vāc prāṇa saṃhitaḥ svargam lokam gamayati
translated: This chariot with a horse and a cart, combined with mind, speech, and breath, carries one to the heavenly world.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur etīti nu māṇḍūkeyānām //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti iti nu māṇḍūkeyānām
translated: One who knows this combination in this way is combined with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He attains the whole life. Thus it is for the Mandukyayanas.

original: śākalyasya pṛthivyagniḥ pṛthivī vāg anuvyāhārāḥ /
analyzed: śākalyasya pṛthivī agniḥ pṛthivī vāc anuvyāhārāḥ
translated: For Sakalya, the earth is the fire, the earth is speech, the repetitions.

original: sa yadi nirbhujaḥ khalu vai vayaṃ madhyamo vāk prāṇena mātā jāyā prajñā vāg bṛhadgatirvālisarvamuttamam //
analyzed: sa yadi nirbhujaḥ khalu vai vayam madhyamaḥ vāc prāṇena mātā jāyā prajñā vāc bṛhat gatiḥ vāli sarvam uttamam
translated: If he is without arms, indeed we are the middle, speech is with the breath, the mother is the wife, wisdom is speech, the great path is the best.

original: atha śākalyasya /
analyzed: atha śākalyasya
translated: Now for Sakalya.

original: pṛthivī pūrvarūpaṃ dyaur uttararūpaṃ vāyuḥ saṃhitā vṛṣṭiḥ saṃdhiḥ saṃdhātā /
analyzed: pṛthivī pūrva rūpam dyauḥ uttara rūpam vāyuḥ saṃhitā vṛṣṭiḥ saṃdhiḥ saṃdhātā
translated: The earth is the first form, the sky is the second form, the wind is the combination, the rain is the connection, the connector.

original: tad utāpi yatraitad balavad anugṛhṇan mahāmegho vṛṣṭiṃ varṣati /
analyzed: tat uta api yatra etat balavat anugṛhṇan mahā meghaḥ vṛṣṭim varṣati
translated: And also when that great cloud, bestowing strength, rains rain.

original: dyāvāpṛthivyau samadhātām ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivyau samadhātām iti adhidaivatam
translated: 'Heaven and Earth have been well-ordered' - this is in regard to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now in regard to the self.

original: puruṣo 'yaṃ sarvam āṇḍam /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ yam sarvam āṇḍam
translated: This man is the whole egg.

original: dve vidale bhavataḥ /
analyzed: dve vidale bhavataḥ
translated: It has two halves.

original: tatredam eva pūrvarūpam idam uttararūpam /
analyzed: tatra idam eva pūrva rūpam idam uttara rūpam
translated: This is the former form, this is the latter form.

original: tatrāyam antareṇākāśaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ayam antareṇa ākāśaḥ
translated: In between here is the space.

original: yathāsau dyāvāpṛthivyor antareṇākāśa etasminn ākāśe prāṇa āyatto bhavati yathāmuṣminn ākāśe vāyur āyatto bhavati /
analyzed: yathā asau dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ antareṇa ākāśe etasmin ākāśe prāṇaḥ āyattaḥ bhavati yathā amuṣmin ākāśe vāyuḥ āyattaḥ bhavati
translated: Just as there is space between heaven and earth, so in this space the breath is dependent, just as the wind is dependent in that space.

original: yathāmūni trīṇi jyotīṃṣyevam imāni puruṣe trīṇi jyotīṃṣi /
analyzed: yathā amūni trīṇi jyotīṃṣi evam imāni puruṣe trīṇi jyotīṃṣi
translated: Just as there are these three lights, so in the man there are these three lights.

original: yathāsau divyāditya evam idaṃ śirasi cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: yathā asau divya ādityaḥ evam idam śirasi cakṣuḥ
translated: Just as that is the sun in the sky, so this is the eye in the head.

original: yathāsāvantarikṣe vidyud evam idam ātmani hṛdayam /
analyzed: yathā asau antarikṣe vidyut evam idam ātmani hṛdayam
translated: Just as that is the lightning in the atmosphere, so this is the heart in the body.

original: yathāyam agniḥ pṛthivyam evam idam upasthe retaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ayam agniḥ pṛthivyam evam idam upasthe retaḥ
translated: Just as this fire is on the earth, so this is the semen in the genitals.

original: evamiva ha sma sarvata ātmānam anuvidhāyāha idam eva pūrvarūpam idam uttararūpaṃ mano vāk prāṇas tveva saṃhiteti /
analyzed: evam iva ha sma sarvatas ātmānam anuvidhāya āha idam eva pūrva rūpam idam uttara rūpam manaḥ vāc prāṇaḥ tu eva saṃhitā iti
translated: Thus, having arranged the self everywhere, he says: 'This is the former form, this is the latter form. The mind, speech, and breath are indeed united.'

original: sa eṣo ' śvarathaḥ praṣṭivahano manovākprāṇasaṃhitaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ gamayati /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ śva rathaḥ praṣṭi vahanaḥ manaḥ vāc prāṇa saṃhitaḥ svargam lokam gamayati
translated: This chariot of the horse, drawn by the back, united with the mind, speech, and breath, carries one to the heavenly world.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena
translated: He who knows this Saṃhitā thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and heavenly world.

original: sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He attains the full life-span.

original: pṛthivī pūrvarūpaṃ dyaur uttararūpaṃ vāyuḥ saṃhitā diśaḥ saṃdhir ādityaḥ saṃdhāteti vaiśvāmitraḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī pūrva rūpam dyauḥ uttara rūpam vāyuḥ saṃhitā diśaḥ saṃdhiḥ ādityaḥ saṃdhātā iti vaiśvāmitraḥ
translated: The earth is the prior form, the sky is the subsequent form, the wind is the Saṃhitā, the directions are the junction, the sun is the uniter. Vaiśvānara is thus.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: This is in relation to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now in relation to the self.

original: vāk pūrvarūpaṃ mana uttararūpaṃ prāṇaḥ saṃhitā śrotraṃ saṃdhiś cakṣuḥ saṃdhātā /
analyzed: vāc pūrva rūpam manaḥ uttara rūpam prāṇaḥ saṃhitā śrotram saṃdhiḥ cakṣuḥ saṃdhātā
translated: Speech is the prior form, the mind is the subsequent form, the breath is the Saṃhitā, the ear is the junction, the eye is the uniter.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this Saṃhitā thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and heavenly world. He attains the full life-span.

original: agniḥ pūrvarūpaṃ candramā uttararūpaṃ vidyut saṃhiteti sūryadattaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ pūrva rūpam candramāḥ uttara rūpam vidyut saṃhitā iti sūryadattaḥ
translated: Fire is the prior form, the moon is the subsequent form, the lightning is the Saṃhitā. Sūryadatta is thus.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: This is in relation to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam vāk pūrvarūpaṃ mana uttararūpaṃ satyaṃ saṃhitā /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam vāc pūrva rūpam manaḥ uttara rūpam satyam saṃhitā
translated: Now in relation to the self. Speech is the prior form, the mind is the subsequent form, truth is the Saṃhitā.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He lives his full life.

original: pṛthivī pūrvarūpaṃ dyaur uttararūpaṃ kālaḥ saṃhiteti rādheyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī pūrva rūpam dyauḥ uttara rūpam kālaḥ saṃhitā iti rādheyaḥ
translated: The earth is the first form, the sky is the second form, and time is the collection, says Rādheyas.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus it is in relation to the gods.

original: athādhyātmam vāk pūrvarūpaṃ mana uttararūpaṃ ātmā saṃhitā /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam vāc pūrva rūpam manaḥ uttara rūpam ātmā saṃhitā
translated: Now in relation to the self: speech is the first form, mind is the second form, and the self is the collection.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He lives his full life.

original: vāk pūrvarūpaṃ mana uttararūpaṃ vidyā saṃhiteti pauṣkarasādiḥ /
analyzed: vāc pūrva rūpam manaḥ uttara rūpam vidyā saṃhitā iti pauṣkarasādiḥ
translated: Speech is the first form, mind is the second form, and knowledge is the collection, says Pauṣkara-sādi.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He lives his full life.

original: athāto 'nuvyāhārāḥ /
analyzed: atha atas nuvyāhārāḥ
translated: Now, therefore, the anuvyañjanas.

original: prāṇo vaṃśa iti vidyāt /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vaṃśaḥ iti vidyāt
translated: One should know that the vital breath is the vamśa.

original: sa ya enaṃ prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ bruvan param upavadet śaknuvan kaścic cen manyeta prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ samadhām /
analyzed: sa yaḥ enam prāṇam vaṃśam bruvan param upavadet śaknuvan kaścid ced manyeta prāṇam vaṃśam samadhām
translated: If someone, being able, should think of challenging him who speaks of this life-breath as a bamboo, saying, 'I will split the life-breath as a bamboo,'

original: prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ saṃdhitsituṃ na śaknoṣītyāttha /
analyzed: prāṇam vaṃśam saṃdhitsitum na śaknoṣi iti āttha
translated: 'You say you will split the life-breath as a bamboo, but you are not able to split the life-breath as a bamboo.'

original: prāṇas tvā vaṃśo hāsyatītyevainaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tvā vaṃśaḥ hāsyati iti eva enam brūyāt
translated: 'The life-breath as a bamboo will abandon you,' he should say to him.

original: atha ced aśaknuvan manyeta prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ samadhitsīḥ taṃ nāśakaḥ saṃdhātuṃ prāṇas tvā vaṃśo hāsyatītyevainaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: atha ced a śaknuvan manyeta prāṇam vaṃśam samadhitsīḥ tam na aśakaḥ saṃdhātum prāṇaḥ tvā vaṃśaḥ hāsyati iti eva enam brūyāt
translated: And if he should think of challenging him who has split the life-breath as a bamboo, saying, 'You have split the life-breath as a bamboo, but you are not able to join it,' 'The life-breath as a bamboo will abandon you,' he should say to him.

original: yathā nu kathā ca bruvan vābruvan vā brūyād abhyāśam eva yat tat tathā syāt /🔽na tvevānyat kuśalād brāhmaṇaṃ brūyād atidyumna eva brāhmaṇaṃ brūyān nātidyumne ca na brāhmaṇaṃ brūyān namo 'stu brāhmaṇebhya iti śauravīro
analyzed: yathā nu kathā ca bruvan vā a bruvan vā brūyāt abhyāśam eva yat tat tathā syāt  na tu eva anyat kuśalāt brāhmaṇam brūyāt ati dyumne eva brāhmaṇam brūyāt na ati dyumne ca na brāhmaṇam brūyāt namaḥ stu brāhmaṇebhyaḥ iti
translated: For just as one would say, whether speaking or not speaking, so it would be in this case.

original: māṇḍūkeyaḥ //
analyzed: māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: But one should not speak of a brahmin as other than skilled. One should speak of a brahmin as having great splendor. One should not speak of a brahmin as not having great splendor. Let there be homage to the brahmins. This is the view of Sauravi's son Mandukya.

original: sa yadi prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ bruvantaṃ param upavadet śaknuvantaṃ cen manyeta prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ samadhitsiṣam prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ saṃdhitsituṃ na śaknoṣītyāttha
analyzed: sa yadi prāṇam vaṃśam bruvantam param upavadet śaknuvantam ced manyeta prāṇam vaṃśam samadhitsiṣam prāṇam vaṃśam saṃdhitsitum na śaknoṣi iti āttha
translated: If someone should challenge him who speaks of the life-breath as a bamboo, thinking him able, saying, 'I will split the life-breath as a bamboo,' 'I will split the life-breath as a bamboo, but you are not able to split the life-breath as a bamboo,' he should say to him.

original: prāṇas tvā vaṃśo hāsyatītyevainaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tvā vaṃśaḥ hāsyati iti eva enam brūyāt
translated: He should say to him, 'The breath will destroy your family.'

original: atha ced aśaknuvantaṃ manyeta prāṇaṃ vaṃśaṃ samadhitsīs tan nāśakaḥ saṃdhātum /
analyzed: atha ced a śaknuvantam manyeta prāṇam vaṃśam samadhitsīḥ tat na aśakaḥ saṃdhātum
translated: And if he thinks he is unable, he should say to him, 'You have put together the breath as a family, but you are unable to put it together.

original: prāṇas tvā vaṃśo hāsyatītyevainaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tvā vaṃśaḥ hāsyati iti eva enam brūyāt
translated: The breath will destroy your family.'

original: yathā nu kathā ca bruvantaṃ vābruvantaṃ vā brūyād abhyāśam eva yat tat tathā syāt /
analyzed: yathā nu kathā ca bruvantam vā a bruvantam vā brūyāt abhyāśam eva yat tat tathā syāt
translated: Just as one would say to one who speaks or does not speak, so it would be.

original: na tvevānyat kuśalād brāhmaṇaṃ brūyād atidyumna eva brāhmaṇaṃ brūyān nātidyumne ca na brāhmaṇaṃ brūyān namo 'stu brāhmaṇebhya iti śauravīro
analyzed: na tu eva anyat kuśalāt brāhmaṇam brūyāt ati dyumne eva brāhmaṇam brūyāt na ati dyumne ca na brāhmaṇam brūyāt namaḥ stu brāhmaṇebhyaḥ iti
translated: But one should not say anything else than what is skillful. One should speak about the Brahman with great splendor, but one should not speak about the Brahman without great splendor. Let there be homage to the Brahmins. This is the teaching of Shuravir

original: māṇḍūkeyaḥ //
analyzed: māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: Mandukya.

original: athāto nirbhujapravādāḥ /
analyzed: atha atas nirbhuja pravādāḥ
translated: Now, then, the teachings of Nirbhuj.

original: pṛthivyāyatanaṃ nirbhujaṃ divāyatanaṃ pratṛṇṇam antartikṣāyatanam ubhayam antareṇa /
analyzed: pṛthivī āyatanam nirbhujam divāyatanam pratṛṇṇam antartikṣa āyatanam ubhayam antareṇa
translated: The abode of the earth is Nirbhuj, the abode of the day is Pratrṇṇam, the abode of the atmosphere is both in between.

original: sa ya enaṃ nirbhujaṃ bruvan param upavadet /
analyzed: sa yaḥ enam nirbhujam bruvan param upavadet
translated: If someone were to revile him, saying he is Nirbhuj,

original: pṛthivīṃ devatām āraḥ pṛthivī tvā devatāriṣyatītyenaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: pṛthivīm devatām āraḥ pṛthivī tvā devatā ariṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: he should say to him, 'You have offended the deity Earth, Earth will destroy you as a deity.'

original: atha yadi pratṛṇṇam bruvan param upavaded divaṃ devatām āro dyaus tvā devatāriṣyatītyenaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi pratṛṇṇam bruvan param upavadet divam devatām āraḥ dyauḥ tvā devatā ariṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: Now if one, speaking of the Nirbhuj, should accuse another, he should say to him, 'You have accused the heaven as the deity; the heaven as the deity will punish you.'

original: atha yadyubhayam antareṇa bruvan param upavaded antarikṣaṃ devatām āra antarikṣaṃ tvā devatāriṣyatītiyenaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi ubhayam antareṇa bruvan param upavadet antarikṣam devatām āre antarikṣam tvā devatā ariṣyati iti yenam brūyāt
translated: Now if one, speaking of the Pratiṇṇā, should accuse another, he should say to him, 'You have accused the atmosphere as the deity; the atmosphere as the deity will punish you.'

original: yad dhi saṃdhiṃ vivartayati tan nirbhujasya rūpam /
analyzed: yat hi saṃdhim vivartayati tat nirbhujasya rūpam
translated: For what he turns away from the connection, that is the form of the Nirbhuj.

original: atha yac chuddhe akṣare abhivyāharati tat pratṛṇṇasyāgra u eva /
analyzed: atha yat śuddhe akṣare abhivyāharati tat pratṛṇṇasya agre u eva
translated: Now what he utters in the pure syllable, that is the tip of the Pratiṇṇā.

original: ubhayam antareṇobhayaṃ vyāptaṃ bhavati /🔽annādyakāmo nirbhujaṃ brūyāt svargakāṃaḥ pratṛṇṇam ubhayakāma ubhayamantareṇa /
analyzed: ubhayam antareṇa ubhayam vyāptam bhavati  annādya kāmaḥ nirbhujam brūyāt svarga kāṃaḥ pratṛṇṇam ubhaya kāmaḥ ubhayam antareṇa
translated: Both are pervaded by the two.🔽One who desires food should speak the Nirbhuj; one who desires heaven the Pratiṇṇā; one who desires both, between the two.

original: sa ya enaṃ nirbhujaṃ bruvan param upavaded acyoṣṭhā avarābhyāṃ sthānābhyām ityenaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: sa yaḥ enam nirbhujam bruvan param upavadet acyoṣṭhāḥ avarābhyām sthānābhyām iti enam brūyāt
translated: Now if one, speaking of the Nirbhuj, should accuse another, he should say to him, 'You are not superior to the two lower positions.'

original: atha yadi pratṛṇṇam bruvan param upavaded acyoṣṭhā uttarābhyāṃ sthānābhyām ityevainaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi pratṛṇṇam bruvan param upavadet acyoṣṭhāḥ uttarābhyām sthānābhyām iti eva enam brūyāt
translated: Now if one, speaking of the Pratiṇṇā, should accuse another, he should say to him, 'You are not superior to the two higher positions.'

original: yastvevobhayam antareṇāha tasya tasya nāstyupavādaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu eva ubhayam antareṇa āha tasya tasya na asti upavādaḥ
translated: But he who speaks between the two, to him there is no accusation of either.

original: yathā nu kathā ca bruvan vābruvan vā brūyād abhyāśam kuśalād brāhmaṇaṃ brūyād atidyumna evaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūyān nātidyumne ca na brāhmaṇaṃ brūyāt
analyzed: yathā nu kathā ca bruvan vā a bruvan vā brūyāt abhyāśam kuśalāt brāhmaṇam brūyāt ati dyumne evam brāhmaṇam brūyāt na ati dyumne ca na brāhmaṇam brūyāt
translated: As one would say speak or do not speak to a skilled brahmin in close proximity, one should say speak to a brahmin, and one should not say do not speak to a brahmin.

original: namo 'stu brāhmaṇebhya iti śauravīro māṇḍūkeyaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ stu brāhmaṇebhyaḥ iti śaura vīraḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: Salutations to the Brahmins. Thus spoke Saurivīra Māṇḍūkya.

original: atha khalvāhur nirbhujavaktrāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āhuḥ nirbhuja vaktrāḥ
translated: Then indeed they say, the Nirbhujavaktras (those whose faces are like the trunk of an elephant).

original: pūrvam evākṣaraṃ pūrvarūpam uttaram uttararūpam /
analyzed: pūrvam eva akṣaram pūrva rūpam uttaram uttara rūpam
translated: The first syllable is the first form, the second is the second form.

original: yakāravakārāvantareṇa sā saṃhiteti /
analyzed: yakāra vakārau antareṇa sā saṃhitā iti
translated: The saṃhitā is that which is between the y and the v.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this saṃhitā thus is united with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with brahminical splendor, with heaven, and attains the full life span.

original: atha vai vayaṃ brūmo nirbhujavaktrāḥ sma iti ha smāha hvastro māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: atha vai vayam brūmaḥ nirbhuja vaktrāḥ smaḥ iti ha sma āha hvastraḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: Then indeed we say, We are the Nirbhujavaktras, said Hvashṭra Māṇḍūkya.

original: pūrvam evākṣaraṃ pūrvarūpam uttaram uttararūpam /
analyzed: pūrvam eva akṣaram pūrva rūpam uttaram uttara rūpam
translated: The first syllable is the first form, the second is the second form.

original: tad yāsau mātrā pūrvarūpottarūpe antareṇa yena saṃdhiṃ vivartayati yena mātrāmātraṃ vibhajati yena svarāt svaraṃ vijñāpayati sā saṃhiteti /
analyzed: tat yā asau mātrā pūrva rūpa uttarūpe antareṇa yena saṃdhim vivartayati yena mātrā mātram vibhajati yena svarāt svaram vijñāpayati sā saṃhitā iti
translated: That which is the measure between the first form and the second form, by which one turns the saṃdhi, by which one divides one mātrā from another mātrā, by which one indicates one svarita from another svarita, that is the saṃhitā.🔽Here is the realigned and corrected output:

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this Saṃhitā thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He attains the full life-span.

original: atha ha smāsya putra āha madhyamaḥ prātiyodhīputro magadhavāsī pūrvam evākṣaraṃ pūrvarūpam uttaram uttararūpam /
analyzed: atha ha sma asya putraḥ āha madhyamaḥ prātiyodhī putraḥ magadha vāsī pūrvam eva akṣaram pūrva rūpam uttaram uttara rūpam
translated: Now his son, the middle one, Prātiyo dhi's son, the resident of Magadha, said: The first syllable is the first form, the second is the second form.

original: tad yāsau mātrā saṃdhivijñāpanī sāma tad bhavati sāmaihāvaṃ saṃhitāṃ manya iti /
analyzed: tat yā asau mātrā saṃdhi vijñāpanī sāma tat bhavati sāma aihāvam saṃhitām manye iti
translated: That measure which is to be known as the connection is the Sāman. I consider the Sāman to be the Saṃhitā.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam mā naḥ stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo 'nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam mā naḥ stenebhyaḥ ye abhi druhaḥ pade nirāmiṇaḥ ripavaḥ nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ
translated: This is stated in the Ṛg Veda: Do not let the thieves who attack in treacherous places, the emaciated enemies who watch over our food,

original: ā devānām ohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmno viduḥ //
analyzed: ā devānām ohate vi vrayaḥ hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmnaḥ viduḥ
translated: O Bṛhaspati, let the bonds in the heart be loosened. None knows the Sāman beyond this.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this Saṃhitā thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and the heavenly world. He attains the full life-span.

original: vāk prāṇena saṃdhīyata iti kauṇṭharavyaḥ /
analyzed: vāc prāṇena saṃdhīyate iti kauṇṭharavyaḥ
translated: Kauṇḍarvavya said: Speech is connected with the vital breath.

original: prāṇaḥ pavamānena pavamāno viśvair devair viśve devāḥ svargeṇa lokena svargo loko brahmaṇā saiṣāvaraparā saṃhitā /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ pavamānena pavamānaḥ viśvaiḥ devaiḥ viśve devāḥ svargeṇa lokena svargaḥ lokaḥ brahmaṇā sā eṣā avara parā saṃhitā
translated: Prana with Pavamana, Pavamana with the All-gods, the All-gods with the world of heaven, and the world of heaven with Brahman. This is the lower and higher Samhita.

original: sa ya evam etām avaraparāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda evaṃ haiva sa prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena saṃdhīyate yathaiṣāvaraparā
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām avara parām saṃhitām veda evam ha eva sa prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena saṃdhīyate yathā eṣā avara parā
translated: One who knows this lower and higher Samhita thus, is indeed united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual radiance, and the world of heaven, just as this lower and higher (Samhita) is united.

original: sa yadi pareṇa vopasṛṣṭaḥ svena vārthenābhivyāhared abhivyāharann eva vidyāt divaṃ saṃhitāgamad viduṣo devān abhivyāhārārtham evaṃ bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: sa yadi pareṇa vā upasṛṣṭaḥ svena vā arthena abhivyāharet abhivyāharan eva vidyāt divam saṃhitā agamat viduṣaḥ devān abhivyāhāra artham evam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: If one is attacked by an enemy or one's own purpose is spoken against, while speaking against it, one should know that the gods who know the coming of the Samhita to heaven speak against it for the sake of speaking against it, thinking 'It will be like this.'

original: etenāvarapareṇa tathā haiva tad bhavati //
analyzed: etena avara pareṇa tathā ha eva tat bhavati
translated: It becomes just like that by this lower and higher (Samhita).

original: mātā pūrvarūpaṃ pitottararūpaṃ prajā saṃhiteti bhārgavaḥ /
analyzed: mātā pūrva rūpam pitā uttara rūpam prajā saṃhitā iti bhārgavaḥ
translated: Bhargava said: The mother is the earlier form, the father is the later form, and the offspring is the Samhita.

original: tad etad ekam eva sarvaṃ abhyanūktam /
analyzed: tat etat ekam eva sarvam abhyanūktam
translated: This is all indeed spoken of as one.

original: mātā ca hyevedaṃ pitā ca prajā ca sarvam /
analyzed: mātā ca hi eva idam pitā ca prajā ca sarvam
translated: For the mother and the father and the offspring are all this.

original: saiṣāditisaṃhitā /
analyzed: sā eṣā aditi saṃhitā
translated: This is the Samhita of Aditi.

original: aditir hevedaṃ sarvaṃ yad idaṃ kiṃcid viśvabhūtam /
analyzed: aditiḥ ha iva idam sarvam yat idam kiṃcid viśva bhūtam
translated: Aditi is indeed all this, whatever exists here, all that has been.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam aditir dyaur aditir antarikṣaṃ aditir mātā sā pitā sa putraḥ /
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sā pitā sa putraḥ
translated: This is stated in a verse: Aditi is the sky, Aditi is the atmosphere, Aditi is the mother, she is the father, she is the son.

original: viśve devā aditiḥ pañca janā aditir jātam aditir janitvam //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam
translated: The All-gods are Aditi, the five peoples are Aditi, the born is Aditi, the unborn is Aditi.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: One who knows this collection thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual power, and the heavenly world. He attains the full life span.

original: jāyā pūrvarūpaṃ patir uttararūpaṃ putraḥ saṃhitā retaḥ saṃdhiḥ prajananaṃ saṃdhānam iti sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ /
analyzed: jāyā pūrva rūpam patiḥ uttara rūpam putraḥ saṃhitā retaḥ saṃdhiḥ prajananam saṃdhānam iti sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ
translated: The wife is the prior form, the husband is the subsequent form, the son is the collection, the semen is the union, the procreation is the connection, says the elder Śākalya.

original: saiṣā prajāpatisaṃhitā /
analyzed: sā eṣā prajāpati saṃhitā
translated: This is the collection of Prajāpati.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: One who knows this collection thus is united with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual power, and the heavenly world. He attains the full life span.

original: prajñā pūrvarūpaṃ śraddhottararūpaṃ karma saṃhitā satyaṃ saṃdhānam iti kāśyapaḥ /🔽saiṣā satyasaṃhitā /
analyzed: prajñā pūrva rūpam śraddhā uttara rūpam karma saṃhitā satyam saṃdhānam iti kāśyapaḥ  sā eṣā satya saṃhitā
translated: Wisdom is the prior form, faith is the subsequent form, action is the collection, truth is the connection, says Kāśyapa.🔽This is the collection of truth.

original: tad āhur yat satyasaṃdhā devā iti /
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat satya saṃdhāḥ devāḥ iti
translated: They say, The gods are united with truth.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is collected with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual lustre, with the heavenly world, and reaches the full life-span.

original: vāk saṃhiteti pañcālacaṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: vāc saṃhitā iti pañcālacaṇḍaḥ
translated: The Pancala Chandas says, Speech is the collection.

original: vācā vai vedāḥ saṃdhīyante vācā chandāṃsi vācā mitrāṇi saṃdadhati /
analyzed: vācā vai vedāḥ saṃdhīyante vācā chandāṃsi vācā mitrāṇi saṃdadhati
translated: For by speech the Vedas are collected, by speech the metres, by speech friends are collected.

original: tad yatraitad adhīte vā bhāṣate vā vāci tadā prāṇo bhavati /
analyzed: tat yatra etat adhīte vā bhāṣate vā vāci tadā prāṇaḥ bhavati
translated: So when one either studies or speaks, then speech is in the breath.

original: vāk tadā prāṇaṃ reḷhi /
analyzed: vāc tadā prāṇam reḍhi
translated: Speech then delights the breath.

original: atha yat svapiti vā tūṣṇīṃ vā bhavati prāṇe tadā vāg bhavati prāṇastadā vācaṃ reḷhi / tāv anyonyaṃ rīḷhaḥ /
analyzed: atha yat svapiti vā tūṣṇīm vā bhavati prāṇe tadā vāc bhavati prāṇaḥ tadā vācam reḍhi tau anyonyam rīḍhaḥ
translated: Then when one sleeps or is silent, then speech is in the breath. The breath then delights the speech. They delight each other.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudram āviveśa /
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudram āviveśa
translated: This is stated in the Ṛc: The one bird entered the ocean.

original: sa idaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ vicaṣṭe /
analyzed: saḥ idam viśvam bhuvanam vicaṣṭe
translated: He observes this entire world.

original: taṃ pākena manasāpaśyam antitas /
analyzed: tam pākena manasā apaśyam antitas
translated: I saw him with a purified mind within.

original: taṃ mātā reḷhi sa u reḷhi mātaram //🔽iti /
analyzed: tam mātā reḍhi saḥ u reḍhi mātaram  iti
translated: The mother delights him, and he delights the mother.

original: vāg vai mātā prāṇo vatsaḥ /
analyzed: vāc vai mātā prāṇaḥ vatsaḥ
translated: Speech is the mother, the breath is the calf.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is collected with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual luster, with heaven, with the world, and lives the full life.

original: bṛhadrathaṃtareṇa rūpeṇa saṃhitā saṃdhīyata iti tārkṣyaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhat rathaṃtareṇa rūpeṇa saṃhitā saṃdhīyate iti tārkṣyaḥ
translated: The collection is collected in the form of the Bṛhat and Rathantara, says Tārkṣya.

original: vāg vai rathaṃtarasya rūpaṃ prāṇo bṛhataḥ /
analyzed: vāc vai rathaṃtarasya rūpam prāṇaḥ bṛhataḥ
translated: Speech is the form of the Rathantara, and breath is that of the Bṛhat.

original: ubhābhyām u khalu saṃhitā saṃdhīyate vācā ca prāṇena ca /
analyzed: ubhābhyām u khalu saṃhitā saṃdhīyate vācā ca prāṇena ca
translated: And indeed the collection is collected by both, by speech and by breath.

original: etasyāṃ ha smopaniṣadi saṃvatsaraṃ gā rakṣayata iti tārkṣyaḥ /
analyzed: etasyām ha sma upaniṣadi saṃvatsaram gāḥ rakṣayata iti tārkṣyaḥ
translated: In this Upanishad, they say, We protect the cows for a year, says Tārkṣya.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is collected with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual luster, with heaven, with the world, and lives the full life.

original: gatiḥ pūrvvarūpaṃ nivṛttir uttararūpaṃ sthitiḥ saṃhiteti jāratkārava ārtabhāgaḥ /
analyzed: gatiḥ pūrvva rūpam nivṛttiḥ uttara rūpam sthitiḥ saṃhitā iti jāratkāravaḥ ārtabhāgaḥ
translated: The forward movement is the earlier form, the cessation is the later form, and the stability is the collection, says Jāratkārava Ārtabhāga.

original: tasyām etasyāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ dhvaṃsayo nimeṣāḥ kāṣṭhāḥ kalāḥ kṣaṇā muhūrtā ahorātrā ardhamāsā māsā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarāś ca saṃdhīyante /
analyzed: tasyām etasyām saṃhitāyām dhvaṃsayaḥ nimeṣāḥ kāṣṭhāḥ kalāḥ kṣaṇāḥ muhūrtāḥ ahar rātrāḥ ardha māsāḥ māsāḥ ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarāḥ ca saṃdhīyante
translated: In this collection, the moments, the instants, the half-instants, the time-atoms, the time-moments, the time-muhurtas, the days and nights, the fortnights, the months, the seasons, and the years are collected.

original: saiṣā saṃhitainān kālān saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: sā eṣā saṃhitā enān kālān saṃdadhāti
translated: This collection collects these times.

original: kālo gatinivṛttisthitīḥ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: kālaḥ gati nivṛtti sthitīḥ saṃdadhāti
translated: Time connects the motions, cessations, and states.

original: gatinivṛttisthitibhir idaṃ sarvaṃ saṃdhīyate /
analyzed: gati nivṛtti sthitibhiḥ idam sarvam saṃdhīyate
translated: Everything here is connected by motion, cessation, and state.

original: ityadhidaivatam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam
translated: Thus it is about the gods.

original: athādhyātmam bhūtaṃ pūrvarūpaṃ bhaviṣyad uttararūpaṃ bhavat saṃhiteti kālasaṃdhiḥ /
analyzed: atha adhyātmam bhūtam pūrva rūpam bhaviṣyat uttara rūpam bhavat saṃhitā iti kāla saṃdhiḥ
translated: Now about the self: The past form is the former state, the future form is the latter state, and the present is the connection. Thus the connection is with time.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam mahat tan nāma guhyaṃ puruspṛg yena bhutaṃ janayo yena bhavyam /
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam mahat tat nāma guhyam puruspṛh yena bhutam janayaḥ yena bhavyam
translated: This is stated in the Ṛc: That great secret name by which the past was generated and by which the future will be generated,

original: pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotir yad asya priyaṃ priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca //
analyzed: pratnam jātam jyotiḥ yat asya priyam priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca
translated: The ancient born light, into which its five dear ones have entered, dear to it.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: One who knows this connection in this way is connected with offspring, cattle, fame, spiritual glory, and heaven. He attains the full life span.

original: athāto vāliśikhāyaner vacaḥ /
analyzed: atha atas vāliśikhāyaneḥ vacaḥ
translated: Now, therefore, the words of Vāliśikhāyani.

original: pañcemāni mahābhūtāni bhavantīti ha smāha vāliśikhayaniḥ /
analyzed: pañca imāni mahābhūtāni bhavanti iti ha sma āha vāliśikhayaniḥ
translated: Vāliśikhāyani said: These five great elements exist.

original: pṛthivī vāyur ākāśam āpo jyautīṃṣi tāni mithaḥ saṃhitani bhavanti /
analyzed: pṛthivī vāyuḥ ākāśam āpaḥ jyautīṃṣi tāni mithas saṃhitani bhavanti
translated: Earth, air, space, water, and light - they are mutually connected.

original: aatha yānyanyāni kṣudrāṇi mahābhūtaiḥ saṃdhīyante saiṣā sarvavibhūtasaṃhitā /
analyzed: atha yāni anyāni kṣudrāṇi mahābhūtaiḥ saṃdhīyante sā eṣā sarva vibhūta saṃhitā
translated: And the other smaller ones are connected with the great elements. This is the connection of all existing things.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is collected with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual luster, with heaven, with all life.

original: sarvā vāg brahmeti ha smāha lauhikyaḥ /
analyzed: sarvā vāc brahma iti ha sma āha lauhikyaḥ
translated: All speech is Brahman, said Lauhīkya.

original: ye tu kecana śabdā vācam eva tāṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: ye tu kecana śabdāḥ vācam eva tām vidyāt
translated: Whatever sounds there are, one should know that to be speech.

original: tad apyetad ṛṣir āha ahaṃ rudrebhir vasubhiś carāmīti /
analyzed: tat api etat ṛṣiḥ āha aham rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ carāmi iti
translated: The seer also said this: I move with the Rudras and the Vasus.

original: saiṣā vāk sarvaśabdā bhavati /
analyzed: sā eṣā vāc sarva śabdā bhavati
translated: That speech becomes all sounds.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ saṃhitāṃ veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhir yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyur eti /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām saṃhitām veda saṃdhīyate prajayā paśubhiḥ yaśasā brahmavarcasena svargeṇa lokena sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He who knows this collection thus is collected with offspring, with cattle, with fame, with spiritual luster, with heaven, with all life.

original: yatā caitad brahma kāmarūpi kāmacāri bhavatyevaṃ haiva sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu kāmarūpī kāmacārī bhavati /
analyzed: yatā ca etat brahma kāmarūpi kāma cāri bhavati evam ha eva sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu kāmarūpī kāma cārī bhavati
translated: And just as this Brahman becomes one who assumes any form at will and moves as it wishes, so indeed does he become one who assumes any form at will and moves as it wishes in all beings.

original: ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: One who knows thus, one who knows thus.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake saptamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake saptamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: prāṇo vaṃśa iti ha smāha sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vaṃśaḥ iti ha sma āha sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ
translated: The vital breath is the bamboo, said the elder Śākalya.

original: tadu yathā śālāvaṃśe sarve 'nye vaṃśāḥ samāhitāḥ syur evam evaitasmin prāṇe sarva ātmā samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: tat u yathā śālā vaṃśe sarve nye vaṃśāḥ samāhitāḥ syuḥ evam eva etasmin prāṇe sarvaḥ ātmā samāhitaḥ
translated: Just as all the other bamboos are assembled in the bamboo of the house, so is the whole self assembled in this breath.

original: tasyaitadyātmanaḥ prāṇa ūṣmarūpam asthīni sparśarūpaṃ majjānaḥ svararūpaṃ māṃsaṃ lohitam ityetac caturtham antasthārūpam iti /
analyzed: tasya etat yātmanaḥ prāṇaḥ ūṣma rūpam asthīni sparśa rūpam majjānaḥ svara rūpam māṃsam lohitam iti etat caturtham antasthā rūpam iti
translated: Of that self, this breath is of the form of heat, the bones are of the form of touch, the marrow is of the sound form, and the flesh and blood are the fourth internal form.

original: treyaṃ tveva na etat proktam iti ha smāha hvastro māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: treyam tu eva naḥ etat proktam iti ha sma āha hvastraḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: But this triad has not been mentioned, said Hvastro Mandukeya.

original: tasyaitasya trayasya trīṇītaḥ ṣaṣṭiśatāni bhavanti saṃdhīnāṃ trīṇītas tāni saptaviṃśatiśatāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya etasya trayasya trīṇi itas ṣaṣṭi śatāni bhavanti saṃdhīnām trīṇi itas tāni saptaviṃśati śatāni bhavanti
translated: Of this triad, there are three hundred and sixty joints, and of those there are two thousand and seven hundred.

original: sapta vai viṃśatiśatāni saṃvatsarasyāhorātrāṇām /
analyzed: sapta vai viṃśatiśatāni saṃvatsarasya ahar rātrāṇām
translated: There are twenty-seven hundred of the year's days and nights.

original: tat saṃvatsarasyāhorātrāṇyāpnoti /
analyzed: tat saṃvatsarasya ahar rātrāṇi āpnoti
translated: He obtains the year's days and nights.

original: sa eṣa saṃvatsarasaṃmānaś cakṣurmayaś śrotramayaś chandomayo manomayo vāṅmaya ātmā /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa saṃvatsara saṃmānaḥ cakṣuḥ mayaḥ śrotra mayaḥ chandaḥ mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ vāc mayaḥ ātmā
translated: This is the year's honor, consisting of the eye, the ear, the meter, the mind, and speech, the self.

original: sa ya evam etaṃ saṃvatsarasaṃmānaṃ cakṣurmayaṃ śrotramayaṃ chandomayaṃ manomayaṃ vāmayam ātmānaṃ veda saṃvatsarasya sāyaujyaṃ salokatāṃ sarūpatāṃ
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etam saṃvatsara saṃmānam cakṣuḥ mayam śrotra mayam chandaḥ mayam manaḥ mayam vāmayam ātmānam veda saṃvatsarasya sāyaujyam salokatām sarūpa tām
translated: He who knows this year-long self, consisting of eye, consisting of ear, consisting of metre, consisting of mind, consisting of food, attains the union, the same world, the same form,

original: sabhakṣatām aśnute /
analyzed: sabhakṣa tām aśnute
translated: the same enjoyment as the year.

original: putrī paśumān bhavati sarvam āyur etyasyāruṇikeyo devayāñcakre //
analyzed: putrī paśumān bhavati sarvam āyuḥ eti asya āruṇikeyaḥ devayāñcakre
translated: He becomes a father, he becomes rich in cattle, he reaches the full life-span. This was declared by Āruṇikeya to Devayāñja.

original: atha kauṣṭharavyaḥ /🔽trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatānyakṣarāṇām /
analyzed: atha kauṣṭharavyaḥ  trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatāni akṣarāṇām
translated: Now, of Kauṣṭharāyanī.🔽There are three hundred and sixty letters.

original: trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatānyūṣmaṇām /
analyzed: trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatāni ūṣmaṇām
translated: There are three hundred and sixty heat-moments.

original: trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatāni saṃdhīnām /🔽yānyakṣarāṇyavocāmāhāni tāni /🔽yān ūṣmaṇo rātrayastāḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi ṣaṣṭiśatāni saṃdhīnām  yāni akṣarāṇi avocāma ahāni tāni  yān ūṣmaṇaḥ rātrayaḥ tāḥ
translated: There are three hundred and sixty joints.🔽The letters that we have mentioned are the days.🔽The heat-moments are the nights.

original: yān saṃdhīn avocāmāhorātrāṇāṃ te saṃdhayaḥ /
analyzed: yān saṃdhīn avocāma ahar rātrāṇām te saṃdhayaḥ
translated: The joints that we have mentioned are the joints of the days and nights.

original: ityadhidaivatam /🔽athādhyātmam yānyakṣarāṇyadhidaivatam avocāmāsthīni tānyadhyātmam /
analyzed: iti adhidaivatam  atha adhyātmam yāni akṣarāṇi adhidaivatam avocāma asthīni tāni adhyātmam
translated: This is in relation to the gods.🔽Now, in relation to the self, the bones are the letters in relation to the gods.

original: yān ūṣmaṇo 'dhidaivatam avocāma majjānas te 'dhyātmam /
analyzed: yān ūṣmaṇaḥ dhidaivatam avocāma majjānaḥ te dhyātmam
translated: The marrow is the heat-moments in relation to the gods.

original: eṣa u ha vai saṃpratiprāṇo yan majjā etad retaḥ na vā ṛte prāṇād retasaḥ siddhir asti /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u ha vai saṃpratiprāṇaḥ yat majjā etat retaḥ na vai ṛte prāṇāt retasaḥ siddhiḥ asti
translated: This is indeed the self-prāṇa, which is the marrow. This is the semen. For without the prāṇa, the success of semen does not exist.

original: yad vā ṛte prāṇād retaḥ sicyeta tat pūyen na saṃbhavet /
analyzed: yat vai ṛte prāṇāt retaḥ sicyeta tat pūyet na saṃbhavet
translated: Or, if semen were to be emitted without the vital breath, it would be polluted and would not be able to unite.

original: yān saṃdhīn adhidaivatam avocāma parvāṇi tānyadhyātmam /🔽tasyaitasyāsthnāṃ majjā parvaṇām iti pañcetaścatvāriṃśacchatāni bhavanti /
analyzed: yān saṃdhīn adhidaivatam avocāma parvāṇi tāni adhyātmam  tasya etasya asthnām majjā parvaṇām iti pañca itas catvāriṃśat śatāni bhavanti
translated: The joints that we have mentioned in relation to the gods are the same in the individual.🔽The marrow of his bones is the joints. There are five hundred and forty.

original: saṃdhīnāṃ pañcetastadaśītisahasraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: saṃdhīnām pañca itas tat aśīti sahasram bhavati
translated: The joints are eighty thousand.

original: aśītisahasraṃ vārkalino bṛhatīr aharahani saṃpādayanti /
analyzed: aśīti sahasram vārkalinaḥ bṛhatīḥ ahar ahani saṃpādayanti
translated: Day after day, the Brhatîs of the sun's rays make up eighty thousand.

original: sa eṣo 'haḥsaṃmānaś cakṣurmayaś śrotramayaś chandomayo manomayo vāṅmaya ātmā /
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ haḥ saṃmānaḥ cakṣuḥ mayaḥ śrotra mayaḥ chandaḥ mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ vāc mayaḥ ātmā
translated: This is the self, consisting of the day, consisting of the eye, consisting of the ear, consisting of the metres, consisting of the mind, consisting of speech.

original: sa ya evam etad ahaḥsaṃmānaṃ cakṣurmayaṃ śrotramayaṃ chandomayaṃ manomayaṃ vāmayam ātmānaṃ veda ahnāṃ sāyaujyaṃ salokatāṃ sarūpatāṃ sabhakṣatām
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etat ahar saṃmānam cakṣuḥ mayam śrotra mayam chandaḥ mayam manaḥ mayam vāmayam ātmānam veda ahnām sāyaujyam salokatām sarūpa tām sabhakṣa tām
translated: He who thus knows this self, consisting of the day, consisting of the eye, consisting of the ear, consisting of the metres, consisting of the mind, consisting of speech, attains union with the days, the same world, the same form, the same share

original: aśnute /
analyzed: aśnute
translated: as the days.

original: putrī paśumān bhavati sarvam āyur eti //
analyzed: putrī paśumān bhavati sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: He becomes a father, has cattle, and lives his full life.

original: catvāraḥ puruṣā iti vāstyaḥ śarīrapuruṣaś chandaḥpuruṣo vedepuruṣo mahāpuruṣa iti /
analyzed: catvāraḥ puruṣāḥ iti vāstyaḥ śarīra puruṣaḥ chandaḥ puruṣaḥ vede puruṣaḥ mahā puruṣaḥ iti
translated: There are four kinds of men: the bodily man, the man of the metres, the man of the Veda, and the great man.

original: śarīrapuruṣa iti yam avocam ya evāyaṃ daivika ātmā tasyaitasya yo 'yam aśarīraḥ prajñātmā sa rasaḥ /
analyzed: śarīra puruṣaḥ iti yam avocam yaḥ eva ayam daivikaḥ ātmā tasya etasya yaḥ yam aśarīraḥ prajñā ātmā sa rasaḥ
translated: The embodied person, whom I mentioned, is the same as the divine Self. The essence of that Self is the bodiless conscious Self.

original: chandaḥpuruṣa iti yam avocāmākṣarasamāmnāya eva /
analyzed: chandaḥ puruṣaḥ iti yam avocāma akṣara samāmnāyaḥ eva
translated: The person of the Vedas, whom I mentioned, is the same as the recitation of the syllables.

original: tasyaitasyākāro rasaḥ /
analyzed: tasya etasya akāraḥ rasaḥ
translated: The essence of that is the form.

original: vedapuruṣa iti yam avocāma yena devān vedargvedaṃ yajurvedaṃ sāmavedam iti tasyaitasya brahmarasaḥ /
analyzed: veda puruṣaḥ iti yam avocāma yena devān veda ṛgvedam yajurvedam sāmavedam iti tasya etasya brahma rasaḥ
translated: The person of the Vedas, whom I mentioned, by whom one knows the gods, the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the Sama Veda, the essence of that is Brahman.

original: tasmād brahmiṣṭhaṃ brahmāṇam ṛtvijaṃ kurvīta yo yajñasyolvaṇaṃ vidyāt /
analyzed: tasmāt brahmiṣṭham brahmāṇam ṛtvijam kurvīta yaḥ yajñasya ulvaṇam vidyāt
translated: Therefore, one should appoint as the officiating priest the one who knows the most about Brahman, who knows the essence of the sacrifice.

original: mahāpuruṣa iti yam avocāma saṃvatsara eva tasyaitasyāsāv ādityo rasaḥ /
analyzed: mahā puruṣaḥ iti yam avocāma saṃvatsaraḥ eva tasya etasya asau ādityaḥ rasaḥ
translated: The great person, whom I mentioned, is the same as the year. The essence of that is the sun.

original: sa yaś cāyam aśarīraḥ prajñātmā yaś cāsāv āditya ekam etad iti vidyāt /
analyzed: sa yaḥ ca ayam aśarīraḥ prajñā ātmā yaḥ ca asau ādityaḥ ekam etat iti vidyāt
translated: One should know that this bodiless conscious Self and that sun are one.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam //
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam
translated: This is stated in the Ṛc verse:

original: citraṃ devānām udagād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ /
analyzed: citram devānām udagāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ
translated: The wonderful form of the gods has arisen, the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni.

original: āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca //
analyzed: āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: It has pervaded heaven, earth, and the atmosphere. The sun is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: etām evānuvidyāṃ saṃhitāṃ saṃdhīyamānāṃ manya iti ha smāha vātsyaḥ etam u haiva
analyzed: etām eva anuvidyām saṃhitām saṃdhīyamānām manye iti ha sma āha vātsyaḥ etam u ha eva
translated: This very knowledge, this very collection, I consider as being put together, said Vatsya.

original: bahvṛcā mahadukthe mīmāṃsanta etam agnāv adhvaryava etaṃ mahāvrate chandogā etam
analyzed: bahvṛcāḥ mahat ukthe mīmāṃsantaḥ etam agnau adhvaryavaḥ etam mahāvrate chandogāḥ etam
translated: They indeed ponder over this very [Self] in the Bahvṛca [śākhā] as the great hymn, in the Adhvaryu [śākhā] in the fire, in the Mahāvrata [śākhā] of the Chandogas,

original: asyām etam antarikṣa etaṃ divi etam agnāv etaṃ vāyāv etaṃ candramasy etaṃ nakṣatreṣv
analyzed: asyām etam antarikṣe etam divi etam agnau etam vāyau etam candramasi etam nakṣatreṣu
translated: in this [earth], in this atmosphere, in this heaven, in this fire, in this wind, in this moon, in this stars,

original: etam apsv etam oṣadhīṣv etaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣv etam akṣareṣv etam eva brahmetyupāsate /
analyzed: etam apsu etam oṣadhīṣu etam sarveṣu bhūteṣu etam akṣareṣu etam eva brahma iti upāsate
translated: in this water, in this plants, in this all beings, in this imperishable [Self], in this very Brahman they meditate.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam //
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam
translated: This is declared in the Ṛg Veda:

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari jyotiṣ paśyanta uttaram /
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari jyotiḥ paśyantaḥ uttaram
translated: We have risen above the darkness, and see the light above.

original: devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: We have gone to the god, the god among the gods, the sun, the highest light.

original: iti /🔽sa eṣo 'kṣarasaṃmānaś cakṣurmayaḥ śrotramayaś chandamayo manomayo vāṅmaya ātmā /
analyzed: iti  saḥ eṣa u kṣara saṃmānaḥ cakṣuḥ mayaḥ śrotra mayaḥ chanda mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ vāc mayaḥ ātmā
translated: Thus.🔽This imperishable collection is made of eye, made of ear, made of mind, made of speech, made of the Self.

original: sa ya evam etam akṣarasaṃānaṃ cakṣurmayaṃ śrotramayaṃ chandamayaṃ manomayaṃ vāṅmayam ātmānaṃ parasmai śaṃsati dugdhadohā asya vedā bhavanti
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etam akṣara saṃānam cakṣuḥ mayam śrotra mayam chanda mayam manaḥ mayam vāc mayam ātmānam parasmai śaṃsati dugdha dohāḥ asya vedāḥ bhavanti
translated: He who thus proclaims to another this imperishable collection, made of eye, made of ear, made of mind, made of speech, made of the Self, his Vedas are milked out.

original: abhāgo vāci bhavati abhāgo 'nūkte /
analyzed: a bhāgaḥ vāci bhavati a bhāgaḥ nu ukte
translated: He is not a sharer in speech, nor in what is said after it.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam //
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam
translated: This is declared in the Ṛc:

original: yas tityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācy api bhāgo asti /
analyzed: yaḥ tityāja sacividam sakhāyam na tasya vāci api bhāgaḥ asti
translated: He who abandons a friend who knows his heart, has no share even in his speech.

original: yad īṃ śṛnoty alakaṃ śṛṇoti na hi praveda sukṛtasya panthām //🔽iti /
analyzed: yat īm śṛnoti alakam śṛṇoti na hi praveda sukṛtasya panthām  iti
translated: When he hears it, he hears as if it were not heard, for he does not know the path of good deeds.

original: nāsyānūkte vāco bhāgo astīty eva tad āha tan na parasmā etad ahaḥ śaṃset /
analyzed: na asya anūkte vācaḥ bhāgaḥ asti iti eva tat āha tat na parasmai etat ahar śaṃset
translated: Thus it is said that he has no share in what is said after it. Therefore, one should not recite this day to another.

original: nāgniṃ cinuyān na mahāvratena stuyān ned ātmano 'pihīyā iti /
analyzed: na agnim cinuyāt na mahāvratena stuyāt na id ātmanaḥ iti
translated: One should not build a fire altar, nor praise with the Mahāvrata, lest one should be separated from one's self.

original: sa yaś cāyam aśarīraḥ prajñātmā yaś cāsāv āditya ekam etad ity avocāma tau yatra vipradṛśyete //
analyzed: sa yaḥ ca ayam aśarīraḥ prajñā ātmā yaḥ ca asau ādityaḥ ekam etat iti avocāma tau yatra vipradṛśyete
translated: We have said that this one who is bodiless and has knowledge as his essence, and that one in the sun, are one. When they are seen to be separate,

original: candramā ivādityo dṛśyate na raśmayaḥ prādur bhavanti /
analyzed: candramāḥ iva ādityaḥ dṛśyate na raśmayaḥ prādur bhavanti
translated: the sun is seen like the moon, and its rays do not appear.

original: lohinī dyaur bhavati yathā mañjiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: lohinī dyauḥ bhavati yathā mañjiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The sky becomes bloody, like madder.

original: vyastaḥ pāyur bhavati /
analyzed: vyastaḥ pāyuḥ bhavati
translated: The anus becomes separated.

original: saṃpareto 'syātmā na ciram iva jīviṣyatīti vidyāt /
analyzed: saṃparetaḥ sya ātmā na ciram iva jīviṣyati iti vidyāt
translated: One should know that his soul will soon die.

original: sa yat karaṇīyaṃ manyeta tat kuryāt /
analyzed: sa yat karaṇīyam manyeta tat kuryāt
translated: Whatever he thinks should be done, he should do it.

original: athāpyādarśe vodake vā jihmaśirasaṃ vāśirasaṃ vātmānaṃ paśyen na vā paśyet /
analyzed: atha api ādarśe vā udake vā jihma śirasam vā aśirasam vā ātmānam paśyet na vā paśyet
translated: Now, if he sees himself in a mirror or in water, with a crooked head or without a head, or if he does not see it,

original: tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpi cchidrā chāyā bhavati na vā bhavati tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: atha api chidrā chāyā bhavati na vā bhavati tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: Now, if his shadow is broken or not, he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpi cchidra ivādityo rathanābhir ivākhyāyet tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: atha api chidraḥ iva ādityaḥ ratha nābhiḥ iva ākhyāyet tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: Now, if the sun seems as if it were in a hole, like the hub of a chariot wheel, he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpi nīla ivāgnir dṛśyeta yathā mayūragrīvā mahāmeghe vā marīcīr iva paśyet /
analyzed: atha api nīlaḥ iva agniḥ dṛśyeta yathā mayūragrīvā mahā meghe vā marīcīḥ iva paśyet
translated: Now, if fire seems blue, like the neck of a peacock, or if he sees great clouds or rays in it,

original: anabhre vā vidyutaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: anabhre vā vidyutam paśyet
translated: or if he sees lightning in the sky,

original: abhra enāṃ mna paśyet tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: abhre enām mna paśyet tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: or if he sees it in the clouds, he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpy apidhāyākṣiṇī upekṣeta tatraitad varāṭakānīva na paśyet tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: atha api apidhāya akṣiṇī upekṣeta tatra etat varāṭakāni iva na paśyet tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: Now, if he closes his eyes and looks, and does not see those pebbles there, he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpy apidhāya karṇā upāsīta /
analyzed: atha api apidhāya karṇau upāsīta
translated: Now, if he sits with his ears covered,

original: ya eṣo 'gner iva jvalataḥ śabdo rathasyevopabdis taṃ na yadā śṛṇuyāt tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ eṣaḥ gneḥ iva jvalataḥ śabdaḥ rathasya iva upabdiḥ tam na yadā śṛṇuyāt tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: and does not hear that sound which is like that of a burning fire or like the rumbling of a chariot, he should know that it is just the same.

original: athāpi viparyaste kanyake dṛśyete dvijihmevā na vā dṛśyetetad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: atha api viparyaste kanyake dṛśyete dvi jihmā iva na vā dṛśyet etat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: Now, if two inverted maidens are seen, as if double, or if they are not seen, he should know that it is just the same.

original: sa yo 'to 'śruto 'mato 'vijñāto 'dṛṣṭo 'nādiṣṭo 'ghuṣṭaḥ śrotā mantā vijñātā draṣṭādeṣṭā ghoṣṭā sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām āntaraḥ puruṣaḥ sa ma ātmeti
analyzed: sa yaḥ śrutaḥ mataḥ vijñātaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ na ādiṣṭaḥ ghuṣṭaḥ śrotā mantā vijñātā draṣṭā ādeṣṭā ghoṣṭā sarveṣām bhūtānām āntaraḥ puruṣaḥ sa me ātmā iti
translated: He who is not heard, not thought of, not known, not seen, not described, not proclaimed, who is the hearer, the thinker, the knower, the seer, the describer, the proclaimer, the inner self of all beings, he is my Self.

original: vidyāt / sa utkrāmann evaitam aśarīraṃ prajñātmānam abhisaṃpadyate vijahātītaraṃ dauhikam /
analyzed: vidyāt saḥ utkrāman eva etam aśarīram prajñā ātmānam abhisaṃpadyate vijahāti itaram dauhikam
translated: He, when departing, enters this bodyless Self, which is knowledge. He abandons the other, which is of the mother.

original: saiṣā sarvasyai vāca upaniṣat /
analyzed: sā eṣā sarvasyai vāce upaniṣad
translated: This is the Upaniṣad of all speech.

original: sarvā haivemāḥ sarvasyai vācaupaniṣadaḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ ha eva imāḥ sarvasyai vācā aupaniṣadaḥ
translated: All these are the Upaniṣads of all speech.

original: imāṃ tv evam ācakṣate //
analyzed: imām tu evam ācakṣate
translated: But they speak of this one in this way:

original: pṛthivyā rūpaṃ sparśā antarikṣasyoṣmāṇo divaḥ svarāḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ rūpam sparśāḥ antarikṣasya ūṣmāṇaḥ divaḥ svarāḥ
translated: The form of earth is touch, the warmth of space, the sound of heaven.

original: agne rūpaṃ sparśā vāyor ūṣmāṇa ādityasya svarāḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ rūpam sparśāḥ vāyoḥ ūṣmāṇaḥ ādityasya svarāḥ
translated: The form of fire is touch, the warmth of wind, the sound of the sun.

original: ṛgvedasya rūpaṃ sparśā yajurvedasyoṣmāṇaḥ sāmavedasya svarāḥ /
analyzed: ṛgvedasya rūpam sparśāḥ yajurvedasya ūṣmāṇaḥ sāmavedasya svarāḥ
translated: The form of the Ṛg Veda is touch, the warmth of the Yajur Veda, the sound of the Sāma Veda.

original: rathantarasya rūpaṃ sparśā vāmadevyasyoṣmāṇo bṛhataḥ svarāḥ /
analyzed: rathantarasya rūpam sparśāḥ vāmadevyasya ūṣmāṇaḥ bṛhataḥ svarāḥ
translated: The form of the Rathantara is touch, the warmth of the Vāmadevya, the sound of the Bṛhat.

original: prāṇasya rūpaṃ sparśā apānasyoṣmāṇo manasaḥ svarāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇasya rūpam sparśāḥ apānasya ūṣmāṇaḥ manasaḥ svarāḥ
translated: The form of the out-breath is touch, the warmth of the in-breath, the sound of the mind.

original: prāṇasya rūpaṃ sparśā apānasyoṣmāṇa udānasya svarāḥ svarā iti punardattaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇasya rūpam sparśāḥ apānasya ūṣmāṇaḥ udānasya svarāḥ svarāḥ iti punardattaḥ
translated: The form of the out-breath is touch, the warmth of the up-breath, the sound of the up-breath, the sound again given by Pundarīka.

original: eṣa u haiva sarvāṃ vācaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: eṣaḥ u ha eva sarvām vācam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows this indeed knows all speech.

original: atha khalv iyaṃ daivī vīṇā bhavati tadanukṛtir asau mānuṣī bhavati /🔽tad yatheyaṃ śastravatī tardmavatī bhavaty evam evāsau śastravatī tardmavatī bhavati /
