analyzed: atha khalu iyam daivī vīṇā bhavati tad anukṛtiḥ asau mānuṣī bhavati  tat yathā iyam śastravatī tardmavatī bhavati evam eva asau śastravatī tardmavatī bhavati
translated: Now this is the divine lute, its imitation is the human one.🔽Just as this one has strings and a sounding board, so that one has strings and a sounding board.

original: tad yathāsyāḥ śira evam amuṣyāḥ śiraḥ /🔽tad yathāsyai vaṃśa evam amuṣyā daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā asyāḥ śiraḥ evam amuṣyāḥ śiraḥ  tat yathā asyai vaṃśaḥ evam amuṣyāḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: Just as this one's head is so is that one's head.🔽Just as this one's bamboo is so is that one's staff.

original: tad yathāsyā udaram evam amuṣyā ambhaṇaṃ /
analyzed: tat yathā asyāḥ udaram evam amuṣyāḥ ambhaṇam
translated: Just as this one's belly is so is that one's bag.

original: tad yathāsyai mukhanāsike akṣiṇī ity evam amuṣyāś chidrāṇi /🔽tad yathāsyā aṅgulinigrahā upastaraṇānīty evam amuṣyāḥ parvāṇi /
analyzed: tat yathā asyai mukha nāsike akṣiṇī iti evam amuṣyāḥ chidrāṇi  tat yathā asyāḥ aṅguli nigrahāḥ upastaraṇāni iti evam amuṣyāḥ parvāṇi
translated: Just as this one's mouth, nose, and eyes are so are that one's holes.🔽Just as this one's finger-stops are the cushions so are that one's joints.

original: tad yathāsyā aṅgulaya evam amuṣyās tantryaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā asyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ evam amuṣyāḥ tantryaḥ
translated: Just as this one's fingers are so are that one's strings.

original: tad yathāsyai jihvaivam amuṣyā vādanam /🔽tad yathāsyāḥ svarā evam amuṣyāḥ svarāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā asyai jihvā evam amuṣyāḥ vādanam  tat yathā asyāḥ svarāḥ evam amuṣyāḥ svarāḥ
translated: Just as this one's tongue is so is that one's playing.🔽Just as this one's notes are so are that one's notes.

original: tad yathā haiveyaṃ romaśena carmaṇāpihitā bhavaty evam evāsau romaśena carmaṇāpihitā bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā ha eva iyam romaśena carmaṇā apihitā bhavati evam eva asau romaśena carmaṇā apihitā bhavati
translated: Just as this one is covered with hairy skin so is that one covered with hairy skin.

original: romaśena ha sma carmaṇā purā vīṇā apidadhati /
analyzed: romaśena ha sma carmaṇā purā vīṇāḥ apidadhati
translated: In ancient times, they used to cover the lute with a hairy skin.

original: saiṣā daivī vīṇā bhavati /
analyzed: sā eṣā daivī vīṇā bhavati
translated: This is the divine lute.

original: sa ya evam etāṃ daivīṃ vīṇāṃ veda śrutavadanatamo bhavati bhūmiprāsya kīrtir bhavati
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam etām daivīm vīṇām veda śruta vadana tamaḥ bhavati bhūmiprā asya kīrtiḥ bhavati
translated: One who knows this divine lute becomes one with much learning, his fame spreads on the earth,

original: śuśrūṣante hāsya parṣatsu bhāṣyamāṇasyedam astu yad ayam īhate yatrāryā vāg vadati vidur enaṃ tatra //
analyzed: śuśrūṣante ha asya parṣatsu bhāṣyamāṇasya idam astu yat ayam īhate yatra āryā vāc vadati viduḥ enam tatra
translated: and his assembly listens to his speech, thinking Let it be so, what he desires, where the noble speech speaks, the wise one knows it there.

original: athātas tāṇḍavindasya vacaḥ /
analyzed: atha atas tāṇḍavindasya vacaḥ
translated: Now, therefore, the words of Tândavîna.

original: tad yatheyaṃ akuśalena vādayitrāvīṇārabdhā na kṛtsnaṃ vīṇārthaṃ sādhayaty evam evākuśalena vaktrā vāg ārabdhā na kṛtsnaṃ vāg arthaṃ sādhayati
analyzed: tat yathā iyam akuśalena vādayitrā a vīṇā ārabdhā na kṛtsnam vīṇā artham sādhayati evam eva akuśalena vaktrā vāc ārabdhā na kṛtsnam vāc artham sādhayati
translated: Just as this lute, when played by an unskillful player, does not accomplish the purpose of the lute in its entirety, in the same way, speech, when spoken by an unskillful speaker, does not accomplish the purpose of speech in its entirety.

original: tad yathā haiveyaṃ kuśalena vādayitrā vīṇārabdhā kṛtsnaṃ vīṇārthaṃ sādhayaty evam eva kuśalena vaktrā vāg ārabdhā kṛtsnaṃ vāg arthaṃ sādhayati
analyzed: tat yathā ha eva iyam kuśalena vādayitrā vīṇā ārabdhā kṛtsnam vīṇā artham sādhayati evam eva kuśalena vaktrā vāc ārabdhā kṛtsnam vāc artham sādhayati
translated: Just as this lute, when played by a skillful player, accomplishes the purpose of the lute in its entirety, in the same way, speech, when spoken by a skillful speaker, accomplishes the purpose of speech in its entirety.

original: tasyai vā etasyai vīṇāyai yā tviṣiḥ sā saṃhiteti kātyāyanīputro jātūkarṇyaḥ /
analyzed: tasyai vai etasyai vīṇāyai yā tviṣiḥ sā saṃhitā iti kātyāyanīputraḥ jātūkarṇyaḥ
translated: The brilliance of this very lute is the collection, says Kâtyâyanîputra Jâtukarnya.

original: atha ha smaitat kṛtsnahārito brāhmaṇam evodāharati //
analyzed: atha ha sma etat kṛtsnahāritaḥ brāhmaṇam eva udāharati
translated: Now, indeed, Kṛtsnāhārīta used to recite this Brāhmaṇa:

original: prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā vyasraṃsata sa chandobhir ātmānaṃ samadadhat /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā vyasraṃsata sa chandobhiḥ ātmānam samadadhat
translated: Prajāpati, having created the creatures, became relaxed. He put himself together with the metres.

original: tad yac chandobhir ātmānaṃ samadadhat tasmāt saṃhitā /
analyzed: tat yat chandobhiḥ ātmānam samadadhat tasmāt saṃhitā
translated: Since he put himself together with the metres, therefore it is a saṃhitā.

original: tasyai vā etasyai saṃhitāyai ṇakaro balaṃ ṣakāraḥ prāṇa ātmā saṃhitā /
analyzed: tasyai vai etasyai saṃhitāyai ṇakaraḥ balam ṣakāraḥ prāṇaḥ ātmā saṃhitā
translated: To that very saṃhitā, Ṇ is its strength, Ṣ is its life-breath, and Ā is its self, the saṃhitā.

original: athaiṣā kṣudramiśrā vikṛtis tāni nakhāni romāṇi vyañjanānīti /
analyzed: atha eṣā kṣudra miśrā vikṛtiḥ tāni nakhāni romāṇi vyañjanāni iti
translated: Now this is the minor mixture, the modification. Those are the nails, the hair, and the consonants.

original: sa yo 'tra vicikitset saṇakāraṃ eva brūyād ṛte ṇakāram iti saṇakāram eva brūyāt /
analyzed: sa yaḥ tra vicikitset sa ṇakāram eva brūyāt ṛte ṇakāram iti sa ṇakāram eva brūyāt
translated: One who would doubt here should say only Ṇ, excluding Ṇ. He should say only Ṇ.

original: evam eva yo 'tra vicikitset saṣakāraṃ eva brūyād ṛte ṣakāram iti saṣakāram eva brūyāt /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ tra vicikitset sa ṣakāram eva brūyāt ṛte ṣakāram iti sa ṣakāram eva brūyāt
translated: In the same way, one who would doubt here should say only Ṣ, excluding Ṣ. He should say only Ṣ.

original: tau vā etau ṇakāraṣakārau vidvān anusaṃhitam ṛco 'dhīyītāyuṣyam iti vidyād evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: tau vai etau ṇakāra ṣakārau vidvān anusaṃhitam ṛcaḥ dhīyīta āyuṣyam iti vidyāt evam eva vidyāt
translated: One who knows these two, Ṇ and Ṣ, should study the Ṛg verses with the saṃhitā. He should know it is for longevity. He should know it in this very way.

original: atha vāg itihāsapurāṇaṃ yac cānyat kiṃcid brāhmīkṛtyevādhīyīta tad apy evam eva vidyāt /
analyzed: atha vāc itihāsa purāṇam yat ca anyat kiṃcid brāhmīkṛtya iva adhīyīta tat api evam eva vidyāt
translated: Then speech is the Itihāsas and Purāṇas, and whatever else is studied as if it were Brahman. He should know that also in this very way.

original: te yad vayam anusaṃhitam ṛco 'dhīmahe yac ca māṇḍūkeyīyam adhyāyaṃ prabrūmas tena no ṇakāraṣakārā upāptāv iti ha smāha hrasvo māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: te yat vayam anusaṃhitam ṛcaḥ dhīmahe yat ca māṇḍūkeyīyam adhyāyam prabrūmaḥ tena naḥ ṇakāra ṣakārāḥ upāptau iti ha sma āha hrasvaḥ māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: They said, Since we study the Ṛc verses with the Anushtubh metre and recite the chapter of Māṇḍūkīya, therefore the Ṇa and Ṣa sounds have come to us. Thus said Hrasva Māṇḍūkīya.

original: atha yad vayam anusaṃhitam ṛco 'dhīmahe yac ca svādhyāyam adhīmahe tena no ṇakāraṣakārā upāptāv iti ha smāha sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ /
analyzed: atha yat vayam anusaṃhitam ṛcaḥ dhīmahe yat ca svādhyāyam adhīmahe tena naḥ ṇakāra ṣakārāḥ upāptau iti ha sma āha sthaviraḥ śākalyaḥ
translated: Then the elder Śākalya said, Since we study the Ṛc verses with the Anushtubh metre and study the recitation of the Veda, therefore the Ṇa and Ṣa sounds have come to us.

original: etad dha sma vai tad vidvāṃsa āhuḥ kāvaṣeyāḥ kimarthā vayaṃ yakṣyāmahe kimarthā vayam adheṣyāmahe vāci hi prāṇaṃ juhumaḥ prāṇe vācaṃ yo hy 🔽eva prabhavaḥ sa evāpyaya iti /
analyzed: etat ha sma vai tat vidvāṃsaḥ āhuḥ kāvaṣeyāḥ kimarthāḥ vayam yakṣyāmahe kimarthāḥ vayam adheṣyāmahe vāci hi prāṇam juhumaḥ prāṇe vācam yaḥ hi  eva prabhavaḥ saḥ eva apyayaḥ iti
translated: They who knew this said, For what purpose shall we sacrifice? For what purpose shall we study? For speech we offer the vital breath, and the vital breath speech, for he who is the origin is also the end.

original: tā etāḥ saṃhitā
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ saṃhitā
translated: These are the collections.

original: nānantevāsine brūyān nāsaṃvatsaravāsine nābrahmacāriṇe nāvedavide nāpavaktra ity ācāryā ity ācāryāḥ //
analyzed: na an antevāsine brūyāt na a saṃvatsara vāsine na a brahmacāriṇe na a veda vide na apavaktre iti ācāryāḥ iti ācāryāḥ
translated: One should not tell this to one who does not live with the teacher, to one who has not lived with the teacher for a year, to one who is not celibate, to one who does not know the Veda, or to one who is not a student. Thus the teachers, thus the teachers.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake aṣṭamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake aṣṭamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: om / tat savitur vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: om tat savituḥ vṛṇīmahe
translated: Om. We choose that of Savita.

original: vayaṃ devasya bhojanam /
analyzed: vayam devasya bhojanam
translated: We, the food of the god.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ sarvadhātamam /
analyzed: śreṣṭham sarva dhātamam
translated: The best of all essences.

original: turaṃ bhagasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: turam bhagasya dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the swift of Bhaga.

original: tat savitur vareṇyaṃ /🔽bhargo devasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam  bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: That excellent glory of Savitar,🔽we meditate upon.

original: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt //
analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt
translated: May he stimulate our thoughts.

original: adabdhaṃ mana iṣiraṃ cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: adabdham manaḥ iṣiram cakṣuḥ
translated: Unswerving thought and swift eye,

original: sūryo jyotiṣāṃ śreṣṭho dīkṣe mā mā hiṃsīḥ //
analyzed: sūryaḥ jyotiṣām śreṣṭhaḥ dīkṣe mā mā hiṃsīḥ
translated: the sun, the best of lights, in the consecration, do not injure me.

original: yo ha vai jyeṣṭhaṃ ca śreṣṭhaṃ ca veda jyeṣṭhaś ca ha vai śreṣṭhaś ca svānāṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai jyeṣṭham ca śreṣṭham ca veda jyeṣṭhaḥ ca ha vai śreṣṭhaḥ ca svānām bhavati
translated: One who knows the eldest and the best becomes the eldest and the best of his own people.

original: prāṇo vai jyeṣṭhaś ca śreṣṭhaś ca /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai jyeṣṭhaḥ ca śreṣṭhaḥ ca
translated: The breath is indeed the eldest and the best.

original: yo ha vai vasiṣṭhāṃ veda vasiṣṭho ha svānāṃ bhavati vāg vai vasiṣṭhā /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai vasiṣṭhām veda vasiṣṭhaḥ ha svānām bhavati vāc vai vasiṣṭhā
translated: One who knows the most prosperous becomes the most prosperous of his own people. Speech is indeed the most prosperous.

original: yo ha vai pratiṣṭhāṃ veda prati ha tiṣṭhaty asmiṃś ca loke 'muṣmiṃś ca cakṣur ha pratiṣṭhā /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai pratiṣṭhām veda prati ha tiṣṭhati asmin ca loke muṣmin ca cakṣuḥ ha pratiṣṭhā
translated: One who knows the foundation finds support in this world and the next. The eye is indeed the foundation.

original: yo ha vai saṃpadaṃ veda saṃ hāsmai kāmāḥ saṃpadyante śrotraṃ ha vā u saṃpat /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai saṃpadam veda sam ha asmai kāmāḥ saṃpadyante śrotram ha vai u saṃpad
translated: One who knows the completeness has all his desires fulfilled. The ear is indeed completeness.

original: yo ha vā āyatanaṃ vedāyatano ha svānāṃ bhavati mano vā āyatanam /
analyzed: yaḥ ha vai āyatanam veda āyatanaḥ ha svānām bhavati manaḥ vai āyatanam
translated: One who knows the abode becomes the abode of his own people. The mind is indeed the abode.

original: atha hemā devatāḥ prajāpatiṃ pitaram etyābruvan ko vai naḥ śreṣṭha iti /
analyzed: atha ha imāḥ devatāḥ prajāpatim pitaram etya abruvan kaḥ vai naḥ śreṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: Then the gods went to their father Prajapati and said, Who is the best among us?

original: sa hovāca prajāpatir yasmin va utkrānte śarīraṃ pāpiṣṭham iva manyate sa vai śreṣṭha iti //
analyzed: sa ha uvāca prajāpatiḥ yasmin vaḥ utkrānte śarīram pāpiṣṭham iva manyate sa vai śreṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: Prajapati said, 'He who, when he departs, the body considers as the worst, he is the best.'

original: sā ha vāg uccakrāma /
analyzed: sā ha vāc uccakrāma
translated: Then Speech departed.

original: yathā mūkā avadantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena paśyantaś cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyanto manasaivam iti //
analyzed: yathā mūkāḥ a vadantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: 'As if dumb, not speaking, breathing with breath, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, thinking with the mind, so it is.'

original: cakṣur hoccakrāma /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: Then the Eye departed.

original: yathāndhā apaśyantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyanto manasaivam iti //
analyzed: yathā andhāḥ a paśyantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: 'As if blind, not seeing, breathing with breath, speaking with speech, hearing with the ear, thinking with the mind, so it is.'

original: śrotraṃ hoccakrāma /
analyzed: śrotram ha uccakrāma
translated: Then the Ear departed.

original: yathā badhirā aśṛṇvantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā dhyāyanto manasaivam iti //
analyzed: yathā badhirāḥ a śṛṇvantaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā dhyāyantaḥ manasā evam iti
translated: 'As if deaf, not hearing, breathing with breath, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, thinking with the mind, so it is.'

original: mano hoccakrāma /
analyzed: manaḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: Then the Mind departed.

original: yathā bālā amanasaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadanto vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇaivam iti //
analyzed: yathā bālāḥ amanasaḥ prāṇantaḥ prāṇena vadantaḥ vācā paśyantaḥ cakṣuṣā śṛṇvantaḥ śrotreṇa evam iti
translated: 'As if infants, without mind, breathing with breath, speaking with speech, seeing with the eye, hearing with the ear, so it is.'

original: prāṇo hoccakrāma /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha uccakrāma
translated: Then Breath departed.

original: tatas tad yatheha saindhavaḥ suhayaḥ paḍbīśaśaṅkūn saṃkhided evam asau prāṇān samakhidat /
analyzed: tatas tat yathā iha saindhavaḥ su hayaḥ paḍbīśa śaṅkūn saṃkhidet evam asau prāṇān samakhidat
translated: Then it tore the other vital airs as a strong horse tears the pegs of a four-wheeled chariot.

original: te ha sametyocur bhagavan motkramīr iti /
analyzed: te ha sametya ūcuḥ bhagavat mā utkramīḥ iti
translated: Having come together, they said, 'O revered one, do not depart.'

original: sa hovāca prāṇaḥ kiṃ me 'nnaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca prāṇaḥ kim me nnam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: He said, 'What will be my food?'

original: yat kiṃcāśvabhya ivāśakunibhya iti /
analyzed: yat kiṃca a śvabhyaḥ iva a śakunibhyaḥ iti
translated: 'Whatever is on the earth and in the sky,' they said.

original: kiṃ me vāso bhaviṣyatīty āpa iti hocuḥ /
analyzed: kim me vāsaḥ bhaviṣyati iti āpaḥ iti ha ūcuḥ
translated: 'What will be my clothing?' 'Water,' they said.

original: tasmād vā ayam aśiṣyan purastāc copariṣṭāc cādbhiḥ paridadhāti /
analyzed: tasmāt vai ayam a śiṣyan purastāt ca upariṣṭāt ca adbhiḥ paridadhāti
translated: Therefore, before eating, he encloses it with water on all sides.

original: lambhuko hāsya vāso bhavaty anagno hi bhavati /
analyzed: lambhukaḥ ha asya vāsaḥ bhavati anagnaḥ hi bhavati
translated: His clothing becomes sufficient, for he is not naked.

original: had dha smaitat satyakāmo jābālo gośrute vaiyāghrapadyāyoktvovāca /
analyzed: hat ha sma etat satyakāmaḥ jābālaḥ gośrute vaiyāghrapadyāya uktvā uvāca
translated: Now, Satyakama Jabala, having said this to Gosru of the Vyaghrapadya lineage,

original: apy evaṃ śuṣkasya sthāṇoḥ prabrūyāj jayerann asya śākhāḥ praroheyuḥ palāśanīti /
analyzed: api evam śuṣkasya sthāṇoḥ prabrūyāt jayeran asya śākhāḥ praroheyuḥ palāśanī iti
translated: said, 'One could even speak thus to a dry stump: its branches would grow and leaves would sprout.'

original: vanaspate śatavalśo viroheti dyāṃ mā lekhīr antarikṣaṃ mā mā hiṃsīr iti ha yājñavalkyaḥ //
analyzed: vanaspate śata valśaḥ viroha iti dyām mā lekhīḥ antarikṣam mā mā hiṃsīḥ iti ha yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: 'O tree, grow with a hundred shoots,' 'Do not scratch the sky,' 'Do not harm the atmosphere,' said Yajnavalkya.

original: atha yadi mahaj jigamiṣet trirātraṃ dīkṣitvāmāvāsyāyāṃ sarvauṣadasya manthaṃ dadhimadhubhyām
analyzed: atha yadi mahat jigamiṣet tri rātram dīkṣitvā amāvāsyāyām sarvauṣadasya mantham dadhi madhubhyām
translated: Now, if one wishes to go to a great place, having been initiated for three nights, on the new moon day, one should churn all the herbs with curd and honey,

original: upamanthyāgnim upassamādhāya parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇaṃ jānv ācyottarato
analyzed: upamanthya agnim upassamādhāya parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇam jānu ācya uttaratas
translated: churn out the fire, kindle it, encircle it, strew it around, sprinkle it, and sitting on the right knee facing north,

original: 'gneḥ kaṃse manthaṃ kṛtvā hutvā homān manthe saṃpātaṃ ānayet /🔽jyeṣṭhāya śreṣṭhāya svāhety agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet /
analyzed: gneḥ kaṃse mantham kṛtvā hutvā homān manthe saṃpātam ānayet  jyeṣṭhāya śreṣṭhāya svāhā iti agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet
translated: Having prepared the churning in the pan of the fire and offered the oblations, he should bring the remnants to the churning.

original: pratiṣṭhāyai svāhety agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāyai svāhā iti agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet
translated: Having offered into the fire with To the eldest, to the best, svāhā, he should bring the remnants to the churning.🔽Having offered into the fire with To the established one, svāhā, he should bring the remnants to the churning.

original: saṃpade svāhety agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet /
analyzed: saṃpade svāhā iti agnau hutvā manthe saṃpātam ānayet
translated: Having offered into the fire with To prosperity, svāhā, he should bring the remnants to the churning.

original: tat savitur vareṇyam iti pacchaḥ prāśya tat savitur vṛṇīmaha iti paccha ācāmati mahāvyāhṛtibhiś caturthaṃ nirṇijya kāṃsyaṃ carmaṇi vā sthaṇḍile 🔽vā saṃviśati /
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam iti pacchas prāśya tat savituḥ vṛṇīmahe iti pacchas ācāmati mahāvyāhṛtibhiḥ caturtham nirṇijya kāṃsyam carmaṇi vā sthaṇḍile  vā saṃviśati
translated: Having eaten the remnants with That excellent of Savitr, he sips water with That of Savitr we choose. Having purified the fourth time with the Mahāvyāhṛtis, he lies down on a bronze vessel or on a skin or on the bare ground.

original: sa yadi striyaṃ paśyet samṛddhaṃ karmeti vidyāt samṛddhaṃ karmeti vidyāt //
analyzed: sa yadi striyam paśyet samṛddham karma iti vidyāt samṛddham karma iti vidyāt
translated: If he sees a woman, he should know that the rite is successful. He should know that the rite is successful.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake navamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Āraṇyaka.

original: athāto 'dhyātmikam /
analyzed: atha atas dhyātmikam
translated: Now, therefore, about the inner [self].

original: āntaram agnihotram ity ācakṣate /
analyzed: āntaram agnihotram iti ācakṣate
translated: They call it the inner Agnihotra.

original: etā ha vai devatāḥ puruṣa eva pratiṣṭhitā agnir vāci vāyuḥ prāṇa ādityaś cakṣuṣi candramā manasi diśaḥ śrotra āpo retasi /
analyzed: etāḥ ha vai devatāḥ puruṣe eva pratiṣṭhitāḥ agniḥ vāci vāyuḥ prāṇe ādityaḥ cakṣuṣi candramāḥ manasi diśaḥ śrotre āpaḥ retasi
translated: These deities are indeed established in the person itself - Agni in speech, Vāyu in the breath, Āditya in the eye, Candra in the mind, the quarters in the ear, and water in the semen.

original: etāsu ha vai sarvāsu hutaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca /
analyzed: etāsu ha vai sarvāsu hutam bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca
translated: For in all of these, indeed, an oblation is made, he who, knowing this, eats and drinks and makes others eat and drink.

original: so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //🔽sa tṛpto vācaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati  sa tṛptaḥ vācam tarpayati
translated: He eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.🔽When he is satisfied, he satisfies speech.

original: vāk tṛptāgniṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: vāc tṛptā agnim tarpayati
translated: Speech, being satisfied, satisfies fire.

original: agnis tṛptaḥ pṛthivīṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: agniḥ tṛptaḥ pṛthivīm tarpayati
translated: Fire, being satisfied, satisfies the earth.

original: pṛthivī tṛptā yat kiṃcit pṛthhivyāpihitaṃ bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: pṛthivī tṛptā yat kiṃcid pṛthhivyā apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: The earth, being satisfied, satisfies everything that is hidden on the earth, that was, that will be, that is being.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //🔽sa tṛptaḥ prāṇaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati  sa tṛptaḥ prāṇam tarpayati
translated: He who, knowing this, eats and drinks and makes others eat and drink, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.🔽When he is satisfied, he satisfies the life-breath.

original: prāṇas tṛpto vāyuṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tṛptaḥ vāyum tarpayati
translated: The life-breath, being satisfied, satisfies the wind.

original: vāyus tṛpta ākāśaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: vāyuḥ tṛptaḥ ākāśam tarpayati
translated: The wind, being satisfied, satisfies space.

original: ākāśas tṛpto yat kiṃcākāśenāpihitam bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: ākāśaḥ tṛptaḥ yat kiṃca ākāśena apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: Space, being satisfied, satisfies everything that is hidden in space, that was, that will be, that is being.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati
translated: He who, knowing this, eats and drinks and makes others eat and drink, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.

original: sa tṛptaś cakṣus tarpayati /
analyzed: sa tṛptaḥ cakṣuḥ tarpayati
translated: When that is satisfied, it satisfies the eye.

original: cakṣus tṛptam ādityaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ tṛptam ādityam tarpayati
translated: When the eye is satisfied, it satisfies the sun.

original: ādityas tṛpto divaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: ādityaḥ tṛptaḥ divam tarpayati
translated: When the sun is satisfied, it satisfies the sky.

original: dyaus tṛptā yat kiṃcid divāpihitam bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: dyauḥ tṛptā yat kiṃcid divā apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: When the sky is satisfied, it satisfies whatever is covered by the sky, whether past, future, or present.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati
translated: One who, knowing this, eats and drinks, causes to be eaten and to be drunk, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies.

original: sa tṛpto manas tarpayati /
analyzed: sa tṛptaḥ manaḥ tarpayati
translated: When that is satisfied, it satisfies the mind.

original: manas tṛptaṃ candramasaṃ tarpayati /🔽candramās tṛpto nakṣatrāṇi tarpayati /
analyzed: manaḥ tṛptam candramasam tarpayati  candramāḥ tṛptaḥ nakṣatrāṇi tarpayati
translated: When the mind is satisfied, it satisfies the moon.🔽When the moon is satisfied, it satisfies the stars.

original: nakṣatrāṇi tṛptāni māsāṃs tarpayanti /🔽māsās tṛptā ardhamāsāṃs tarpayanti /
analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi tṛptāni māsān tarpayanti  māsāḥ tṛptāḥ ardha māsān tarpayanti
translated: When the stars are satisfied, they satisfy the months.🔽When the months are satisfied, they satisfy the half-months.

original: ardhamāsās tṛptā ahorātre tarpayanti /🔽ahorātre tṛpte ṛtūṃs tarpayataḥ /
analyzed: ardha māsāḥ tṛptāḥ ahar rātre tarpayanti  ahar rātre tṛpte ṛtūn tarpayataḥ
translated: When the half-months are satisfied, they satisfy the day and night.🔽When the day and night are satisfied, they satisfy the seasons.

original: ṛtavas tṛptāḥ saṃvatsaraṃ tarpayanti /
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ tṛptāḥ saṃvatsaram tarpayanti
translated: When the seasons are satisfied, they satisfy the year.

original: saṃvatsaras tṛpto yat kiṃcit saṃvatsareṇāpihitam bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ tṛptaḥ yat kiṃcid saṃvatsareṇa apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: When the year is satisfied, it satisfies whatever is covered by the year, whether past, future, or present.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //🔽sa tṛptaḥ śrotraṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati  sa tṛptaḥ śrotram tarpayati
translated: One who, knowing thus, eats and drinks, and makes others eat and drink, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.🔽He, being satisfied, satisfies the ear.

original: śrotraṃ tṛptaṃ diśas tarpayati /
analyzed: śrotram tṛptam diśaḥ tarpayati
translated: The ear, being satisfied, satisfies the directions.

original: diśas tṛptā avāntaradiśas tarpayanti /
analyzed: diśaḥ tṛptāḥ avāntaradiśaḥ tarpayanti
translated: The directions, being satisfied, satisfy the intermediate directions.

original: avāntaradiśas tṛptā yat kiṃcāvāntaradigbhir apihitam bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: avāntara diśaḥ tṛptāḥ yat kiṃca avāntara digbhiḥ apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: The intermediate directions, being satisfied, satisfy whatever is covered by the intermediate directions, whether past, future, or present, all that they satisfy.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati
translated: One who, knowing thus, eats and drinks, and makes others eat and drinks, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.

original: sa tṛpto retas tarpayati /🔽retas tṛptam apas tarpayati /
analyzed: sa tṛptaḥ retaḥ tarpayati  retaḥ tṛptam apaḥ tarpayati
translated: He, being satisfied, satisfies semen.🔽Semen, being satisfied, satisfies water.

original: āpas tṛptā nadīṃs tarpayanti /
analyzed: āpaḥ tṛptāḥ nadīn tarpayanti
translated: Water, being satisfied, satisfies the rivers.

original: nadyas tṛptāḥ samudraṃ tarpayanti /
analyzed: nadyaḥ tṛptāḥ samudram tarpayanti
translated: The rivers, being satisfied, satisfy the ocean.

original: samudro tṛpto yat kiṃcit samudreṇāpihitam bhavad bhaviṣyad bhūtaṃ tat sarvaṃ tarpayati /
analyzed: samudraḥ tṛptaḥ yat kiṃcid samudreṇa apihitam bhavat bhaviṣyat bhūtam tat sarvam tarpayati
translated: The ocean, being satisfied, satisfies whatever is covered by the ocean, whether past, future, or present, all that it satisfies.

original: ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca so 'śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati //
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca saḥ śnāti sa pibati sa tṛpyati sa tarpayati
translated: He who, knowing thus, eats and drinks and makes others eat and drink, he eats, he drinks, he is satisfied, he satisfies others.

original: sa tṛptas tad etad vairājaṃ daśavidhaṃ agnihotraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: sa tṛptaḥ tat etat vairājam daśavidham agnihotram bhavati
translated: That is the tenfold Vaiśvānara Agnihotra.

original: tasya prāṇa evāhavanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya prāṇaḥ eva āhavanīyaḥ
translated: Its Āhavanīya fire is the out-breath,

original: apāno gārhapatyo vyāno 'nvāhāryapacano mano dhūmo manyur arcir dantā aṅgārāḥ śraddhā payo vāk samit satyam āhutiḥ prajñātmā sa rasaḥ /
analyzed: apānaḥ gārhapatyaḥ vyānaḥ nvāhāryapacanaḥ manaḥ dhūmaḥ manyuḥ arciḥ dantāḥ aṅgārāḥ śraddhā payaḥ vāc samidh satyam āhutiḥ prajñā ātmā sa rasaḥ
translated: the Gārhapatya fire is the in-breath, the Anvāhāryapacana fire is the through-breath, the mind is the smoke, anger is the flame, the teeth are the embers, faith is the milk, speech is the fuel, truth is the oblation, the self consisting of wisdom is the essence.

original: tad etad vairājaṃ daśavidhaṃ agnihotraṃ hutaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat etat vairājam daśavidham agnihotram hutam bhavati
translated: That tenfold Vaiśvānara Agnihotra is offered.

original: rohobhyāṃ rohobhyām abhyārūḷham abhi svargaṃ lokaṃ gamayati ya evaṃ vidvān aśnāti ca pibati cāśayati ca pāyayati ca /
analyzed: rohobhyām rohobhyām abhyārūḍham abhi svargam lokam gamayati yaḥ evam vidvān aśnāti ca pibati ca āśayati ca pāyayati ca
translated: By the two thighs it is mounted, and by the two thighs it is mounted, and it goes to heaven, he who, knowing thus, eats and drinks and makes others eat and drink.

original: atha ya idam avidvān agnihotraṃ juhoti yathāṅgārān apohya bhasmani hutaṃ tādṛk tatyās tādṛk tat syāt //
analyzed: atha yaḥ idam a vidvān agnihotram juhoti yathā aṅgārān apohya bhasmani hutam tādṛś tatyāḥ tādṛś tat syāt
translated: But he who offers the Agnihotra without knowing this, it is as if he were to offer on coals and ashes, so small, so trifling would that be.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake daśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake daśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: prajāpatir vā imaṃ puruṣam udañcata /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai imam puruṣam udañcata
translated: Prajāpati indeed raised this man upwards.

original: tasminn etā devatā āveśayad vācy agniṃ prāṇe vāyuṃ apāne vidyuta udāne parjanyaṃ
analyzed: tasmin etāḥ devatāḥ āveśayat vāci agnim prāṇe vāyum apāne vidyutaḥ udāne parjanyam
translated: In him he placed these deities: speech in Agni, breath in Vayu, lightning in Udana, Parjanya in the eyes,

original: cakṣuṣy ādityaṃ manasi candramasaṃ śrotre diśaḥ śarīre pṛthivīṃ retasy apo bala indraṃ
analyzed: cakṣuṣi ādityam manasi candramasam śrotre diśaḥ śarīre pṛthivīm retasi apaḥ bale indram
translated: the sun in the mind, the moon in the ears, the directions in the body, the earth in the semen, the waters in the strength, Indra in the neck,

original: manyāv īśānaṃ mūrdhany ākāśaṃ ātmani brahma /
analyzed: manyau īśānam mūrdhani ākāśam ātmani brahma
translated: Ishana in the head, space in the soul, and Brahman in the atman.

original: sa yathā mahān amṛtakumbhaḥ pinvamānas tiṣṭhed evaṃ haiva sa tasthau /
analyzed: sa yathā mahān amṛta kumbhaḥ pinvamānaḥ tiṣṭhet evam ha eva sa tasthau
translated: Just as a large jar full of nectar would stand, so indeed did he stand.

original: atha hemā devatā īkṣāṃ cakrire kim ayam asmābhiḥ puruṣaḥ kariṣyati kiṃ vā vayam anena /
analyzed: atha ha imāḥ devatāḥ īkṣām cakrire kim ayam asmābhiḥ puruṣaḥ kariṣyati kim vā vayam anena
translated: Then the gods considered: What will this man do with us? Or what will we do with him?

original: hantāsmāc carīrād utkramāmeti /
analyzed: hantā asmāt carīrāt utkramāma iti
translated: Let us depart from this body.

original: tā hoccakramuḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ha uccakramuḥ
translated: They departed.

original: atha hedaṃ śarīraṃ riktam iva parisuṣiraṃ sa hekṣāñcakre prajāpatī randhrāya na kṣamam /
analyzed: atha ha idam śarīram riktam iva parisuṣiram sa ha īkṣāñcakre prajāpatiḥ randhrāya na kṣamam
translated: Then this body became empty, as it were, hollow. Prajapati considered: It is not fit for a hole.

original: hantāham imā aśanāyāpipāsābhyām upasṛjā iti /
analyzed: hanta aham imāḥ aśanāyā pipāsābhyām upasṛje iti
translated: Let me release these from hunger and thirst.

original: tā hopasasṛje /
analyzed: tāḥ ha upasasṛje
translated: He released them.

original: tā hopāṣrṣṭāḥ sukhaṃ alabhamānā imam eva puruṣaṃ punaḥ pratyāviviśuḥ //🔽vāṅ mamety agnir āviveśa /
analyzed: tāḥ ha upāṣrṣṭāḥ sukham a labhamānāḥ imam eva puruṣam punar pratyāviviśuḥ  vāc mama iti agniḥ āviveśa
translated: Being released, not finding happiness, they entered again this very man.🔽Speech is mine, Agni entered.

original: prāṇo mameti vāyur āviveśa /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ mama iti vāyuḥ āviveśa
translated: Breath is mine, Vayu entered.

original: apāno mameti vidyuta āviviśuḥ /
analyzed: apānaḥ mama iti vidyutaḥ āviviśuḥ
translated: The lightning entered, saying, 'I am the downward breath of that one.'

original: udāno mameti parjanya āviveśa /🔽cakṣur mamety āditya āviveśa /
analyzed: udānaḥ mama iti parjanyaḥ āviveśa  cakṣuḥ mama iti ādityaḥ āviveśa
translated: Parjanya entered, saying, 'I am the upward breath of that one.'🔽The sun entered, saying, 'I am the eye of that one.'

original: mano mameti candramā āviveśa /
analyzed: manaḥ mama iti candramāḥ āviveśa
translated: The moon entered, saying, 'I am the mind of that one.'

original: śrotram asmākam iti diśa āviviśuḥ /🔽śarīraṃ mameti pṛthivy āviveśa /
analyzed: śrotram asmākam iti diśaḥ āviviśuḥ  śarīram mama iti pṛthivī āviveśa
translated: The directions entered, saying, 'We are the ears of that one.'🔽The earth entered, saying, 'I am the body of that one.'

original: reto 'smākam ity āpa āviviśuḥ /
analyzed: retaḥ smākam iti āpaḥ āviviśuḥ
translated: The waters entered, saying, 'We are the seed of that one.'

original: balaṃ mametīndra āviveśa /🔽manyur mametīśāna āviveśa /
analyzed: balam mama iti indraḥ āviveśa  manyuḥ mama iti īśānaḥ āviveśa
translated: Indra entered, saying, 'I am the strength of that one.'🔽The Lord entered, saying, 'I am the anger of that one.'

original: mūrdhā mamety ākāśa āviveśa /
analyzed: mūrdhā mama iti ākāśaḥ āviveśa
translated: The sky entered, saying, 'I am the head of that one.'

original: ātmā mameti brahmāviveśa /
analyzed: ātmā mama iti brahma āviveśa
translated: Brahman entered, saying, 'I am the self of that one.'

original: sa yathā mahān vṛkṣa ārdra upasiktamūlas tiṣṭhed evaṃ haiva sa tasthau //
analyzed: sa yathā mahān vṛkṣaḥ ārdraḥ upasikta mūlaḥ tiṣṭhet evam ha eva sa tasthau
translated: He stood there just as a great tree stands with its roots and trunk well watered.

original: athāyaṃ puruṣaḥ preṣyan purā saṃvatsarāt saṃvatsarasya dṛṣṭīḥ paśyati /
analyzed: atha ayam puruṣaḥ preṣyan purā saṃvatsarāt saṃvatsarasya dṛṣṭīḥ paśyati
translated: Now this man, when he is about to die, before a year has passed, sees the visions of the year.

original: chidrā chāyā bhavati na vā bhavati /
analyzed: chidrā chāyā bhavati na vā bhavati
translated: He has a shadow, or he does not.

original: mahāmeghe vā marīcīr iva paśyed anabhre vā vidyutaṃ paśyed abhra enāṃ na paśyet /
analyzed: mahā meghe vā marīcīḥ iva paśyet anabhre vā vidyutam paśyet abhre enām na paśyet
translated: He sees rays in a great cloud, or he sees lightning in a cloudless sky, or he does not see it in a cloud.

original: akṣiṇī vā apidhāya varāṭakānīvā na paśyati /
analyzed: akṣiṇī vā apidhāya varāṭakānīvā na paśyati
translated: Or he sees as if through a hole, or he does not see.

original: karṇau vāpidhāyopabdim iva na śṛṇoti /
analyzed: karṇau vā apidhāya upabdim iva na śṛṇoti
translated: Or he hears as if with his ears closed, or he does not hear.

original: nāsmil loke ramate nainaṃ manaś chandayati /
analyzed: na asmin loke ramate na enam manaḥ chandayati
translated: In this world, he does not delight in it, nor does his mind find pleasure in it.

original: iti pratyakṣadarśanāni //
analyzed: iti pratyakṣa darśanāni
translated: Thus, these are the direct observations.

original: atha svapnāḥ /
analyzed: atha svapnāḥ
translated: Now, the dreams.

original: puruṣaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ kṛṣṇadantaṃ paśyati sa enaṃ hanti varāha enaṃ hanti markaṭa enaṃ hanti
analyzed: puruṣam kṛṣṇam kṛṣṇa dantam paśyati saḥ enam hanti varāhaḥ enam hanti markaṭaḥ enam hanti
translated: One sees a black man with black teeth, he kills him. A boar kills him. A monkey kills him.

original: enaṃ hanti bisāni khādayati suvarṇaṃ bhakṣayitvāvagiraty ekapauṇḍarīkaṃ dhārayati
analyzed: enam hanti bisāni khādayati suvarṇam bhakṣayitvā avagirati eka pauṇḍarīkam dhārayati
translated: He kills him. He makes him eat lotus stalks. Having eaten gold, he vomits. He wears a single white lotus.

original: gāṃ savatsāṃ dakṣiṇāmukho naladamālī vrājayati /
analyzed: gām sa vatsām dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ nalada mālī vrājayati
translated: Facing south, wearing a garland of nalada flowers, he drives a cow with a calf.

original: sa yady eteṣāṃ kiṃcit paśyet pāṇḍuradarśanāṃ kālīṃ strīṃ muktakeśāṃ muṇḍāṃ tailābhyaṅgaṃ
analyzed: sa yadi eteṣām kiṃcid paśyet pāṇḍura darśanām kālīm strīm mukta keśām muṇḍām taila abhyaṅgam
translated: If he sees any of these, a white-sighted black woman with loose hair, shaven, anointed with oil,

original: kausumbhaparidhānaṃ gītāny uṣṭrārohanaṃ dakṣiṇāśāgamanādīni vīkṣyopoṣya pāyasaṃ sthālīpākaṃ
analyzed: kausumbha paridhānam gītāni uṣṭra ārohanam dakṣiṇa āśā gamana ādīni vīkṣya upoṣya pāyasam sthālīpākam
translated: wearing a red garment, singing, riding a camel, going to the south, having seen these, he should fast, cook milk-rice in a pot,

original: śrapayitvā sarūpavatsāyā goḥ payasi na tv eva tu kṛṣṇāyā agnim upasamādhāya parisamuhya
analyzed: śrapayitvā sarūpa vatsāyāḥ goḥ payasi na tu eva tu kṛṣṇāyāḥ agnim upasamādhāya parisamuhya
translated: having churned out fire from the cow's milk with a calf of the same color, but not from a black one, having collected it,

original: paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇaṃ jānv ācya sruveṇājyahutīr juhoti //
analyzed: paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇam jānu ācya sruveṇa ājya hutīḥ juhoti
translated: having strewn it around, having sprinkled it around, having bent his right knee, he offers ghee oblations with the sruva.

original: vāci me 'gniḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: vāci me gniḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā
translated: In my speech, Agni is established, svāhā.

original: prāṇe me vāyuḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /🔽apāne me vidyutaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā /
analyzed: prāṇe me vāyuḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā  apāne me vidyutaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā
translated: In my out-breath, the wind is established, svāhā.🔽In my down-breath, the lightning is established, svāhā.

original: udāne me parjanyaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /🔽cakṣuṣi ma ādityaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: udāne me parjanyaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā  cakṣuṣi me ādityaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā
translated: In my up-breath, the rain is established, svāhā.🔽In my eye, the sun is established, svāhā.

original: manasi me candramāḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: manasi me candramāḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā
translated: In my mind, the moon is established, svāhā.

original: śrotre me diśaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā /🔽śarīre me pṛthivī pratiṣṭhitā svāhā /
analyzed: śrotre me diśaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā  śarīre me pṛthivī pratiṣṭhitā svāhā
translated: In my ear, the directions are established, svāhā.🔽In my body, the earth is established, svāhā.

original: retasi ma āpaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā /
analyzed: retasi me āpaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ svāhā
translated: In my semen, the waters are established, svāhā.

original: bale ma indraḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /🔽manyau ma īśānaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: bale me indraḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā  manyau me īśānaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā
translated: In my strength, Indra is established, svāhā.🔽In my mind, Īśāna is established, svāhā.

original: mūrdhani ma ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: mūrdhani me ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ svāhā
translated: In my head, the sky is established, svāhā.

original: ātmani me brahma pratiṣṭhitaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: ātmani me brahma pratiṣṭhitam svāhā
translated: In my self, Brahman is established, svāhā.

original: athaitad ājyāvaśeṣaṃ sthālīpāke samavaninīya sthālīpākasyopaghātaṃ juhoti //
analyzed: atha etat ājya avaśeṣam sthālīpāke samavaninīya sthālīpākasya upaghātam juhoti
translated: Then, having mixed this remaining ghee with the cooked food, he offers it as an oblation to the cooked food.

original: vāci me 'gniḥ pratiṣṭhito vāg hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: vāci me gniḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ vāc hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my speech, Agni is established, speech in the heart, the heart in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die without desire. May I become one who has food and is an eater of food, svāhā.

original: prāṇe me vāyuḥ pratiṣṭhito prāṇo hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /🔽apāne me vidyutaḥ pratiṣṭhitā apāno hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: prāṇe me vāyuḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ prāṇaḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā  apāne me vidyutaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ apānaḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my out-breath the wind is established, the out-breath is in the heart, the heart is in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, may I become a food-eater, svāhā.🔽In my down-breath the lightning is established, the down-breath is in the heart, the heart is in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, may I become a food-eater, svāhā.

original: udāne me parjanyaḥ pratiṣṭhita udānaṃ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /🔽cakṣuṣi ma ādityaḥ pratiṣṭhitaś cakṣur hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: udāne me parjanyaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ udānam hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā  cakṣuṣi me ādityaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ cakṣuḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my up-breath the rain-cloud is established, the up-breath is in the heart, the heart is in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, may I become a food-eater, svāhā.🔽In my eye the sun is established, the eye is in the heart, the heart is in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, may I become a food-eater, svāhā.

original: manasi me candramāḥ pratiṣṭhito mano hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: manasi me candramāḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ manaḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my mind the moon is established, the mind is in the heart, the heart is in the self, that is the truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, may I become a food-eater, svāhā.

original: śrotre me diśaḥ pratiṣṭhitā diśo hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: śrotre me diśaḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ diśaḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my ears the quarters are established, the quarters in the heart, the heart in the self, that truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, a consumer of food, svāhā.

original: śarīre me pṛthhivī pratiṣṭhitā pṛthivī hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /🔽bale ma indraḥ pratiṣṭhitā balaṃ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: śarīre me pṛthivī pratiṣṭhitā pṛthivī hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā  bale me indraḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ balam hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my body the earth is established, the earth in the heart, the heart in the self, that truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, a consumer of food, svāhā.🔽In my strength Indra is established, strength in the heart, the heart in the self, that truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, a consumer of food, svāhā.

original: manyau ma īśānaḥ pratiṣṭhito manyur hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: manyau me īśānaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ manyuḥ hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In my anger Īśāna is established, anger in the heart, the heart in the self, that truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, a consumer of food, svāhā.

original: mūrdhani ma ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhito
analyzed: mūrdhani me ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: In my head the sky is established,

original: mūrdhā hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: mūrdhā hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: the head in the heart, the heart in the self, that truth of the gods. May I not die unfulfilled, may I be full of food, a consumer of food, svāhā.

original: ātmani me brahma pratiṣṭhitam ātmā hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyaṃ devānāṃ māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: ātmani me brahma pratiṣṭhitam ātmā hṛdaye hṛdayam ātmani tat satyam devānām mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: In me, O Brahman, the Self is established, the Self in the heart, the heart in the Self, that truth of the gods. May I not die with desire, may I be full of food, may I become an eater of food, svāhā.

original: athaitat sthālīpākaśeṣam ātmani samavaninīya juhoti //
analyzed: atha etat sthālīpāka śeṣam ātmani samavaninīya juhoti
translated: Then, having collected the remainder of the Sthālīpāka offering in himself, he offers it.

original: aśmā jāgatam ayas traiṣṭubhaṃ loham auṣṇihaṃ sīsaṃ kākubhaṃ rajataṃ svārājyaṃ suvarṇaṃ
analyzed: aśmā jāgatam ayaḥ traiṣṭubham loham auṣṇiham sīsam kākubham rajatam svārājyam suvarṇam
translated: Stone is connected with the Jagatī meter, iron with the Triṣṭubh, steel with the Uṣṇih, lead with the Kakup, silver with the Svarājyā, gold with the

original: gāyatram annaṃ vairājaṃ tṛptir ānuṣṭubhaṃ nākaṃ sāmrājyaṃ bṛhaspatir bārhataṃ brahma
analyzed: gāyatram annam vairājam tṛptiḥ ānuṣṭubham nākam sāmrājyam bṛhaspatiḥ bārhatam brahma
translated: Food is connected with the Gāyatrī, satisfaction with the Anustubh, the heavenly world with the Sāman, sovereignty with the Brhat, Brahman with the Bṛhaspati.

original: pāṅktaṃ prajāpatir ātichandasaṃ sāvitrī sarvavedachandasena chandaseti //
analyzed: pāṅktam prajāpatiḥ ātichandasam sāvitrī sarvavedachandasena chandasā iti
translated: The Paṅkti is connected with Prajāpati, the Āticchandas with Sāvitrī, with the meter of all the Vedas.

original: aśmeva sthiro vasāni jāgatena chandasā /
analyzed: aśmā iva sthiraḥ vasāni jāgatena chandasā
translated: May I dwell firm like a stone with the Jagatī meter.

original: puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ sūtram annaṃ granthis taṃ granthim udgrathnāmy annakāmaḥ /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ sūtram annam granthiḥ tam granthim udgrathnāmi anna kāmaḥ
translated: The man is the jewel, the breath is the thread, food is the knot. I untie that knot, desiring food.

original: mṛtyave brāhmaṇaṃ api sarvam āyur aśīyāyuṣmān māham akāmo mariṣyāmy annavān annādo bhūyāsaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: mṛtyave brāhmaṇam api sarvam āyuḥ aśīya āyuṣmān mā aham akāmaḥ mariṣyāmi annavān anna ādaḥ bhūyāsam svāhā
translated: To death I offer the Brāhmaṇa, may I attain the whole life. May I not die with desire, may I be full of food, may I become an eater of food, svāhā.

original: aya iva sthiro vasāni traiṣṭubhena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /🔽loham iva sthiro vasāny auṣṇihena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: ayaḥ iva sthiraḥ vasāni traiṣṭubhena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā  loham iva sthiraḥ vasāni auṣṇihena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As firm as iron I dwell, with the Tristubh metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!🔽As firm as iron I dwell, with the Ausnihsa metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: sīsam iva sthiro vasāni kākubhena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /🔽rajatam iva sthiro vasāni svarājyena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /🔽suvarṇam iva sthiro vasāni gāyatreṇa chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: sīsam iva sthiraḥ vasāni kākubhena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā  rajatam iva sthiraḥ vasāni svara ājyena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā  suvarṇam iva sthiraḥ vasāni gāyatreṇa chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As firm as lead I dwell, with the Kakubh metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!🔽As firm as silver I dwell, with the Svaraja metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!🔽As firm as gold I dwell, with the Gayatri metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: annam iva sthiro vasāni vairājena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: annam iva sthiraḥ vasāni vairājena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As firm as food I dwell, with the Vairâja metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: tṛptir iva sthiro vasāny ānuṣṭubhena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: tṛptiḥ iva sthiraḥ vasāni ānuṣṭubhena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As firm as satisfaction I dwell, with the Anushtubh metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: nākam iva sthiro vasāni
analyzed: nākam iva sthiraḥ vasāni
translated: As firm as the vault of heaven I dwell,

original: sāmrājyena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: sāmrājyena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: with the Sâma-râja metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: bṛhaspatir iva sthiro vasāni bārhatena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ iva sthiraḥ vasāni bārhatena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As firm as Brihaspati I dwell, with the Brihat metre, the man, the gem, the breath. Svâhâ!

original: brahmeva sthiro vasāni pāṅktena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: brahmā iva sthiraḥ vasāni pāṅktena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As if you were Brahma, dwell firm with the Pankti meter, the man, the gem, the breath. Svāhā.

original: prajāpatir iva sthiro vasāny ātichandasena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ iva sthiraḥ vasāni ātichandasena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As if you were Prajapati, dwell firm with the Atichandas meter, the man, the gem, the breath. Svāhā.

original: sāvitrīr iva sthiro vasāni sarvavedachandasena chandasā puruṣo maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ / / / svāhā /
analyzed: sāvitrīḥ iva sthiraḥ vasāni sarvavedachandasena chandasā puruṣaḥ maṇiḥ prāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: As if you were the Savitri verses, dwell firm with the meter of all the Vedas, the man, the gem, the breath. Svāhā.

original: priyāyai vā jāyāyai priyāya vāntevāsine 'nyasmai vāpi yasmai kāmayeta tasmā ucchiṣṭaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: priyāyai vā jāyāyai priyāya vā antevāsine nyasmai vā api yasmai kāmayeta tasmai ucchiṣṭam dadyāt
translated: To a beloved wife, a beloved student, or to anyone else for whom one desires, one should give the leftovers.

original: sa hāpi śataṃ varṣāṇi jīvati punaḥ punaḥ prayuñjāno jīvaty eva jīvaty eva //
analyzed: sa ha api śatam varṣāṇi jīvati punar punar prayuñjānaḥ jīvati eva jīvati eva
translated: He too lives for a hundred years, repeatedly using it, he lives, he lives indeed.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake ekādaśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake ekādaśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: om / hastivarcasaṃ prathatāṃ bṛhad vayo yad adityai tanvaḥ saṃbabhūva /
analyzed: om hasti varcasam prathatām bṛhat vayaḥ yat adityai tanvaḥ saṃbabhūva
translated: Om. Let the elephant-splendor spread, the great life that has become the body of Aditi.

original: tan mahyaṃ samaduḥ sarva eta ādityāso adityā saṃvidānāḥ // //
analyzed: tat mahyam samaduḥ sarve ete ādityāsaḥ adityā saṃvidānāḥ
translated: That has been given to me by all these Adityas, in agreement with Aditi.

original: yat te varco jātavedo bṛhad bhavaty āhitam /
analyzed: yat te varcaḥ jātavedaḥ bṛhat bhavati āhitam
translated: Whatever splendor you have, O all-knower, that is great and inherent,

original: tena mā varcasā tvam agne varcasvinaṃ kuru // //
analyzed: tena mā varcasā tvam agne varcasvinam kuru  /
translated: By that splendor, O Agni, make me splendid.

original: yac ca varco vā puruṣe yac ca hastiṣv āhitam /
analyzed: yat ca varcaḥ vā puruṣe yat ca hastiṣu āhitam
translated: And the splendor that is in men, and the splendor that is in elephants,

original: suvarṇe goṣu yad varco mayi tad dhastivarcasam // //
analyzed: suvarṇe goṣu yat varcaḥ mayi tat hasti varcasam
translated: and the splendor that is in gold and cows, may that splendor be in me, O elephant.

original: yad akṣeṣu hiraṇyeṣu goṣv aśveṣu yad yaśaḥ /
analyzed: yat akṣeṣu hiraṇyeṣu goṣu aśveṣu yat yaśaḥ
translated: The fame that is in dice, in gold, in cows and horses,

original: surāyāṃ pūyamānāyāṃ mayi tad dhastivarcasam // //
analyzed: surāyām pūyamānāyām mayi tat hasti varcasam
translated: and the splendor that is in fermenting liquor, may that splendor be in me, O elephant.

original: mayi bhargo mayi maho mayi yajñasya yad yaśaḥ /
analyzed: mayi bhargaḥ mayi mahaḥ mayi yajñasya yat yaśaḥ
translated: In me is the radiance, in me is the greatness, in me is the glory of the sacrifice.

original: tan mayi prajāpatir divi divam iva dṛṃhatu ////
analyzed: tat mayi prajāpatiḥ divi divam iva dṛṃhatu
translated: May Prajapati establish that in me, as if heaven in heaven.

original: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā sam aṅktāṃ madhunā payaḥ /
analyzed: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā sam aṅktām madhunā payaḥ
translated: May the Ashvins anoint me with the Sâragha, with honey and milk,

original: yathā madhumatīṃ vācam āvadāni janeṣu // //🔽ghṛtād ullupto madhumān payasvān dhanaṃjayo dharuṇo dhārayiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: yathā madhumatīm vācam āvadāni janeṣu  ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān dhanaṃjayaḥ dharuṇaḥ dhārayiṣṇuḥ
translated: so that I may utter honeyed speech among the people.🔽Extracted from ghee, rich in honey and milk, victorious, firm, and supportive,

original: rujan sapatnān adharāṃś ca kṛṇvan ā roha māṃ mahate saubhagāya // //
analyzed: rujan sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvan ā roha mām mahate saubhagāya
translated: crushing enemies and making them low, ascend me for great good fortune.

original: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā jatāni pari tā babhūva /
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā jatāni pari tā babhūva
translated: Prajapati, none other than you has encompassed all these created things.

original: yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām // //
analyzed: yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Whatever desires we offer to you, may that be ours. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: ayaṃ sano nudatāṃ me sapatnān indra iva vṛtraṃ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā /
analyzed: ayam sanaḥ nudatām me sapatnān indraḥ iva vṛtram pṛtanāsu sāḷhā
translated: May this one drive away my enemies, victorious in battles like Indra over Vritra,

original: agnir iva kakṣaṃ vibhṛtaḥ purutrā vāteṣu nas tigmajambho 'nu mārṣṭi // //
analyzed: agniḥ iva kakṣam vibhṛtaḥ purutrā vāteṣu naḥ tigma jambhaḥ nu mārṣṭi
translated: Like fire, he is scattered in many places. Like a sharp-toothed one among the winds, he wipes away our sins.

original: ayaṃ sano yo 'nuvādī kīla iva vṛtraṃ vi puro ruroja /
analyzed: ayam sanaḥ yaḥ nuvādī kīlaḥ iva vṛtram vi puras ruroja
translated: This is the one who, like a hammer, smashes the forts of the enemy, like Vritra.

original: anenendro vi mṛdho vihatyā śatrūyatām ābharā bhojanāni ////🔽jayendra śatrūñ jahi śūra dasyūn vṛtraṃ hatveva kuliśenā vi vṛśca /
analyzed: anena indraḥ vi mṛdhaḥ vihatyā śatrūyatām ābhara bhojanāni  jaya indra śatrūm jahi śūra dasyūn vṛtram hatvā iva kuliśena vi vṛśca
translated: Having destroyed the enemies with this, Indra, bring the food of those who are hostile.🔽O Indra, conquer the enemies, O hero, kill the dasyus, as if having killed Vritra with the thunderbolt, cut them to pieces.

original: augha iva śāpān pra ṇudāt sapatnāñ jahyāt sapatnān svadhitir vaneva // //
analyzed: aughaḥ iva śāpān pra nudāt sapatnām jahyāt sapatnān svadhitiḥ vanā iva
translated: Like a flood, drive away the enemies, as an axe cuts down the forest, drive away the enemies.

original: anu vṛśca madhyāt prati vṛścopariṣṭād vi vṛśca paścāt prati śūra vṛśca /
analyzed: anu vṛśca madhyāt prati vṛśca upariṣṭāt vi vṛśca paścāt prati śūra vṛśca
translated: Cut from the middle, cut from above, cut from below, O hero, cut from behind.

original: tvayā praṇuttān maghavann amitrān śūra riṣantaṃ maruto 'nu yantu // //
analyzed: tvayā praṇuttān maghavan amitrān śūra riṣantam marutaḥ nu yantu  /
translated: O Indra, having driven away the enemies, O hero, let the Maruts follow the one who is afflicted.

original: tvāṃ rudrair hetibhiḥ pinvamānā indraṃ manvānā maruto juṣanta /
analyzed: tvām rudraiḥ hetibhiḥ pinvamānāḥ indram manvānāḥ marutaḥ juṣanta
translated: The Maruts, being filled with the weapons of Rudra, being intent on Indra, accept (him).

original: suparṇāḥ kaṅkāḥ pra mṛśanto enān mahīyatāṃ daṃṣṭrī vardhaneṣu // //
analyzed: suparṇāḥ kaṅkāḥ pra mṛśantaḥ enān mahīyatām daṃṣṭrī vardhaneṣu  /
translated: The eagles, the herons, having sprinkled them, the great one with fangs, in the battles, let him grow.

original: brahmaṇuttasya maghavan pṛtanyato viṣvag indra bhaṅgāḥ patantu /
analyzed: brahmaṇuttasya maghavan pṛtanyataḥ viṣvak indra bhaṅgāḥ patantu
translated: O Indra, O Maghavan, let the weapons of the enemy fly away in all directions, O Indra, let them fall.

original: mā jñātāram īśata mā pratiṣṭhāṃ mitho vighnānā upa yānti mṛtyum // //
analyzed: mā jñātāram īśata mā pratiṣṭhām mithas vighnānāḥ upa yānti mṛtyum
translated: Let not the knower be the lord, let not the established one be the lord; they go to death through mutual obstacles.

original: agne yaśasvin yaśase sam arpayendravatīm apacitim ihā vaha /
analyzed: agne yaśasvin yaśase sam arpaya indravatīm apacitim iha ā vaha
translated: O Agni, glorious one, I entrust this to you for glory; bring here the worshipful offering rich in Indra.

original: ayaṃ mūrdhā parameṣṭhī suvarcāḥ sajātānām uttamaśloko astu ////
analyzed: ayam mūrdhā parameṣṭhī su varcāḥ sajātānām uttama ślokaḥ astu
translated: May this head, the supreme lord, of excellent radiance, be the most praised among kinsmen.

original: bhadraṃ paśyanta upa sedur āgan tato dīkṣām ṛṣayaḥ svarvidaḥ /
analyzed: bhadram paśyantaḥ upa seduḥ āgan tatas dīkṣām ṛṣayaḥ svar vidaḥ
translated: The sages who saw the auspicious have come and sat down; from there the sages who know heaven have chosen the consecration.

original: tataḥ kṣatraṃ balam ojaś ca jātaṃ tad asmai devā abhi saṃ namantām // //
analyzed: tatas kṣatram balam ojaḥ ca jātam tat asmai devāḥ abhi sam namantām
translated: From there the nobility, strength, and vigor have arisen; may the gods bow to him.

original: dhātā vidhātā paramota saṃdṛk prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī suvarccāḥ /
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā paramā uta saṃdṛś prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī su varccāḥ
translated: The creator, the ordainer, the supreme seer, Prajapati, the supreme lord, of excellent radiance,

original: stomāṃś chandāṃsi nivido ma āhur etasmai rāṣṭram abhi saṃ namantām // //
analyzed: stomān chandāṃsi nividaḥ me āhuḥ etasmai rāṣṭram abhi sam namantām
translated: they call me the hymns, the meters, and the Nivids; may the kingdom bow to him.

original: abhy ā vartadhvam upa sevatāgnim ayaṃ śāstādhipatir no astu /
analyzed: abhi ā vartadhvam upa sevata agnim ayam śāstā adhipatiḥ naḥ astu
translated: Come back and serve Agni; may he be our lord and ruler.

original: asya vijñānam anu saṃ rabhadhvam imaṃ paścād anu jīvātha sarve // //
analyzed: asya vijñānam anu sam rabhadhvam imam paścāt anu jīvātha sarve
translated: Follow his knowledge; all of you live after him.

original: alardo nāma jāto 'si purā sūryāt puroṣasaḥ /
analyzed: alardaḥ nāma jātaḥ si purā sūryāt purā uṣasaḥ
translated: You are born with the name Alarda, before the sun, before the dawn.

original: taṃ tvā sapatnakṣayaṇaṃ vedātha viṣṭambhajambhanam // //
analyzed: tam tvā sapatna kṣayaṇam veda atha viṣṭambha jambhanam
translated: I know you as the destroyer of enemies, the one who paralyzes and crushes.

original: nārdhe pramīyeta tared dviṣantaṃ kalpeta vākyaṃ pṛtanāḥ saheta /
analyzed: na ardhe pramīyeta taret dviṣantam kalpeta vākyam pṛtanāḥ saheta
translated: He would not die in the middle, would overcome his enemies, his words would be accepted, he would endure battles.

original: pramāyukaṃ tasya dviṣantam āhur irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti ////🔽na sa śaptam aśnāti kilbiṣaṃ kṛtaṃ nainaṃ divyo varuṇo hanti bhītam /
analyzed: pramāyukam tasya dviṣantam āhuḥ irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibhartti  na sa śaptam aśnāti kilbiṣam kṛtam na enam divyaḥ varuṇaḥ hanti bhītam
translated: They say his enemy would be killed, if he wears the Airam-mani of Bilva wood.🔽He does not eat the sin of one who is cursed, the fearful Varuna of heaven does not kill him.

original: nainaṃ kruddhaṃ manyavo 'bhi yantīrāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: na enam kruddham manyavaḥ bhi yanti irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: The angry thoughts do not approach him, if he wears the Airam-mani of Bilva wood.

original: nāsya tvacaṃ hiṃsati jātvedā na māṃsam aśnāti na hanti tāni /
analyzed: na asya tvacam hiṃsati jātu edāḥ na māṃsam aśnāti na hanti tāni
translated: His skin is never harmed by anything, he does not eat flesh, he does not kill those.

original: śatāyur asmiñ jaradaṣṭiḥ praitīrāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: śata āyuḥ asmin jaradaṣṭiḥ praiti irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: He lives a hundred years in this world with clear sight, if he wears the Airam-mani of Bilva wood.

original: nāsya prajā duṣyati jāyamānā na śailago bhavati na pāpakṛtyā /
analyzed: na asya prajā duṣyati jāyamānā na śaila gaḥ bhavati na pāpa kṛtyā
translated: His offspring is not born sinful, he does not become a mountain-goer or a sinner.

original: nānyan mithas tasya kuleṣu jāyata irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: na anyat mithas tasya kuleṣu jāyate irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: No other sin is born in his family, if he wears the Airam-mani of Bilva wood.

original: nāsyāpavādā na pravādakā gṛhe na saṃpatatryo na viveśa tasmai /
analyzed: na asya apavādāḥ na pravādakāḥ gṛhe na saṃpatatryaḥ na viveśa tasmai
translated: No slanderers or revilers enter his house, no misfortune enters him.

original: nāsminn alakṣmīḥ kurute niveśanam irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: na asmin alakṣmīḥ kurute niveśanam irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: No misfortune makes a home for him, if he wears the Airam-mani of Bilva wood.

original: nainaṃ rakṣo na piśāco hinasti
analyzed: na enam rakṣaḥ na piśācaḥ hinasti
translated: Neither Rakshasa nor Pishacha harms him,

original: na jambhako nāpy asuro na yakṣaḥ /
analyzed: na jambhakaḥ na api asuraḥ na yakṣaḥ
translated: Neither a demon, nor an asura, nor a yaksha,

original: na sūtikā tasya kuleṣu jāyate irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti ////
analyzed: na sūtikā tasya kuleṣu jāyate irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibhartti
translated: Nor is a woman in childbirth born in his family, he who wears the Iramani of bilva wood.

original: nainaṃ vyāghro na vṛko na dvīpī na śvāpadaṃ hiṃsati kiṃcanainam /
analyzed: na enam vyāghraḥ na vṛkaḥ na dvīpī na śvāpadam hiṃsati kiṃcana enam
translated: Neither a tiger, nor a wolf, nor a leopard, nor any beast of prey harms him at all.

original: na hastinaṃ kruddham upaiti bhītim irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: na hastinam kruddham upaiti bhītim irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibhartti
translated: He does not approach the enraged elephant with fear, he who wears the Iramani of bilva wood.

original: nainaṃ sarpo na pṛdākur hinasti na vṛściko na tiraścīnarājiḥ /
analyzed: na enam sarpaḥ na pṛdākuḥ hinasti na vṛścikaḥ na tiraścīna rājiḥ
translated: Neither a snake, nor a lizard, nor a scorpion, nor a striped insect harms him.

original: nainaṃ kṛṣṇo 'hir abhi saṃhata irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: na enam kṛṣṇaḥ hiḥ abhi saṃhate irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: The black snake does not strike him, he who wears the Iramani of bilva wood.

original: nainaṃ pramattaṃ varuṇo hinasti na makaro na grahaḥ śiṃśumāraḥ /
analyzed: na enam pramattam varuṇaḥ hinasti na makaraḥ na grahaḥ śiṃśumāraḥ
translated: Varuna does not harm him when he is heedless, nor does the crocodile, nor the shark, nor the porpoise.

original: pārāvarāc chivam asmai kṛṇotīrāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: pāra avarāt śivam asmai kṛṇoti irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: From the other shore he makes peace for him, he who wears the Iramani of bilva wood.

original: pramāyukam asya dviṣantam āhuḥ /
analyzed: pramāyukam asya dviṣantam āhuḥ
translated: They call him one who is about to die, an enemy,

original: puṣpam iva chinnaṃ saha bandhanena /
analyzed: puṣpam iva chinnam saha bandhanena
translated: Like a flower cut off with its stalk.

original: ogha iva śāpān pra ṇudāt sapatnān /
analyzed: oghaḥ iva śāpān pra nudāt sapatnān
translated: Like a flood, drive away his enemies,

original: irāmaṇiṃ bailvaṃ yo bibhartti // //
analyzed: irā maṇim bailvam yaḥ bibharti
translated: He who wears the Iramani of bilva wood.

original: ayaṃ maṇiḥ pratisaro
analyzed: ayam maṇiḥ pratisaraḥ
translated: This jewel is a mirror,

original: jāmbo jīvāya badhyate /
analyzed: jāmbaḥ jīvāya badhyate
translated: The Jamba is bound for life.

original: anenendro vṛtram ahann ṛṣiṇā ca manīṣiṇā ////
analyzed: anena indraḥ vṛtram ahan ṛṣiṇā ca manīṣiṇā
translated: By this Indra slew Vritra, the sage and the wise one.

original: sahendra dviṣataḥ sahasvārātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: saha indra dviṣataḥ sahasva arātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: O Indra, conquer the enemies, conquer the foes, conquer those who wage war.

original: nāga iva pūrvapādābhyām abhi tiṣṭha pṛtanyataḥ // //
analyzed: nāgaḥ iva pūrva pādābhyām abhi tiṣṭha pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Like a serpent with your two front feet, trample down those who are fleeing.

original: āgād ayaṃ bailvo maṇiḥ sapatnakṣapaṇo vṛṣā /
analyzed: āgāt ayam bailvaḥ maṇiḥ sapatna kṣapaṇaḥ vṛṣā
translated: This Baelva gem has come, the bull that destroys enemies.

original: taṃ paśyanti kavayaḥ sarvavīrā yathā sapatnān samare saheyuḥ // //
analyzed: tam paśyanti kavayaḥ sarva vīrāḥ yathā sapatnān samare saheyuḥ  /
translated: The wise ones see it, all the heroes, so that they may endure the enemies in battle.

original: anṛtaṃ me maṇau sūtram aśvināv api nahyatām /
analyzed: anṛtam me maṇau sūtram aśvinau api nahyatām
translated: Let the Aśvins tie the untruth in my gem.

original: bailvaḥ sahasravīryo 'si mā te bhartā riṣam aham // //
analyzed: bailvaḥ sahasra vīryaḥ si mā te bhartā riṣam aham
translated: You are the Baelva with a thousand powers. Let not your wearer be harmed by me.

original: ghṛtād ullupto madhumān payasvān dhanaṃjayo dharuṇo dhārayiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān dhanaṃjayaḥ dharuṇaḥ dhārayiṣṇuḥ
translated: Scraped from ghee, full of honey and milk, victorious, firm, and supportive,

original: rujan sapatnān adharāṃś ca kṛṇvan ā roha māṃ mahate saubhagāya // //
analyzed: rujan sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvan ā roha mām mahate saubhagāya
translated: Crushing enemies and making them low, ascend me for great good fortune.

original: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā jatāni pari tā babhūva /
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā jatāni pari tā babhūva
translated: O Prajapati, none other than you has encompassed all these created things.

original: yatkāmas te juhumas tan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām // //
analyzed: yad kāmaḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Whatever we offer to you with desire, may that be ours. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: śāsa itthā mahā asīti pañca //
analyzed: śāse itthā mahā asi iti pañca
translated: The great one is indeed the ruler here. Five.

original: athāto maṇikalpaḥ /
analyzed: atha atas maṇi kalpaḥ
translated: Now, therefore, the section on gems.

original: bhūtikāmaḥ puṣpeṇa trirātropoṣito jīvato hastino dantān mātrām uddhṛtyāgnim upasamādhāya
analyzed: bhūti kāmaḥ puṣpeṇa tri rātra upoṣitaḥ jīvataḥ hastinaḥ dantān mātrām uddhṛtya agnim upasamādhāya
translated: Desiring prosperity, having fasted for three nights with a flower, having extracted a measure of the tusks of a living elephant, having kindled a fire,

original: parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇaṃ jānv ācyottarato 'gneḥ kaṃse maṇiṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: parisamuhya paristīrya paryukṣya dakṣiṇam jānu ācya uttaratas gneḥ kaṃse maṇim kṛtvā
translated: having collected wood, having strewn (Darbha grass), having sprinkled (water), having sat down with the right knee on the ground, having placed the gem to the north of the fire in a bronze vessel,

original: hutvā homān maṇau saṃpātam ānayet /
analyzed: hutvā homān maṇau saṃpātam ānayet
translated: having offered the oblations, he should bring the remnants into the gem.

original: hastivarcasam ity etābhiḥ pratyṛcam aṣṭābhiḥ saptarātraṃ madhusarpiṣor vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyād ghṛtād ullupta ity etayarcā /
analyzed: hasti varcasam iti etābhiḥ pratyṛcam aṣṭābhiḥ sapta rātram madhu sarpiṣoḥ vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ iti etayā ṛcā
translated: Having soaked honey and ghee for seven nights with these eight verses beginning with Having the luster of an elephant, he should tie one for three nights or one night with the verse Scraped from ghee.

original: ata evottaraṃ ṣaḍbhir hṛdayaśūlāgramaṇiṃ pratodāgramaṇiṃ vā muśalāgramaṇiṃ vā khadirasāramaṇiṃ vā māṃsaudane vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyāt
analyzed: atas eva uttaram ṣaḍbhiḥ hṛdaya śūla agra maṇim pratoda agra maṇim vā muśala agra maṇim vā khadirasāra maṇim vā māṃsa odane vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt
translated: With the next six (verses), having soaked the gem at the tip of a heart-piercing spear, or the gem at the tip of a whip, or the gem at the tip of a pestle, or the gem of Khadira wood, with meat and rice, he should tie one for three nights or one night.

original: ata evottaraṃ catasṛbhir vṛṣabhaśṛṅgāgramaṇiṃ ghṛtaudane vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyāt /
analyzed: atas eva uttaram catasṛbhiḥ vṛṣabha śṛṅga agra maṇim ghṛta odane vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt
translated: With the next four (verses), having soaked the gem at the tip of a bull's horn with ghee and rice, he should tie one for three nights or one night.

original: ata evottaraṃ ekayairaṇḍamaṇiṃ tilaudane vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyāt /
analyzed: atas eva uttaram ekayā eraṇḍa maṇim tila odane vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt
translated: With the next one (verse), having soaked the Eranda gem with sesamum rice, he should tie one for three nights or one night.

original: ata evottaraṃ ṣoḷaśabhir bailvaṃ saptarātraṃ madhusarpiṣor vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyād ghṛtād ullupta ity etayarcā /
analyzed: atas eva uttaram ṣoḷaśabhiḥ bailvam sapta rātram madhu sarpiṣoḥ vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ iti etayā ṛcā
translated: For this very reason, after having kept a Bilva fruit for seven nights in honey and ghee, one should tie one on the upper part, or one night, with the verse beginning taken out from ghee.

original: ata evottaraṃ pañcabhir mahāvarāsyodohaṃ mudgaudane vāsayitvā trirātram ekāṃ vā badhnīyāc
analyzed: atas eva uttaram pañcabhiḥ mahāvarā asya udoham mudga odane vāsayitvā tri rātram ekām vā badhnīyāt
translated: For this very reason, after having kept the great cow's udder in a dish of green gram, one should tie one on the upper part, or one night, with the five.

original: chaktau sati prathamaṃ hastichāyāyāṃ vaiyāghre vāpi carmaṇy āsīno vāpi juhuyād āsīno vāpi juhuyāt //
analyzed: chaktau sati prathamam hasti chāyāyām vaiyāghre vāpi carmaṇi āsīnaḥ vāpi juhuyāt āsīnaḥ vāpi juhuyāt
translated: If able, one should first offer oblations while sitting in the shade of an elephant or on a tiger skin, or while sitting.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake dvādaśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake dvādaśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: athāto vairāgyasaṃskṛte śarīre brahmayajñaniṣṭho bhavet /
analyzed: atha atas vairāgya saṃskṛte śarīre brahmayajña niṣṭhaḥ bhavet
translated: Now, therefore, in a body purified by detachment, one should be devoted to the sacrifice to Brahman.

original: apa punarmṛtyuṃ jayati /
analyzed: apa punarmṛtyum jayati
translated: He conquers death again and again.

original: tad u ha vātmā draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyo mantavyo nididhyāsitavya iti /
analyzed: tat u ha vā ātmā draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyaḥ mantavyaḥ nididhyāsitavyaḥ iti
translated: That Self is to be seen, to be heard, to be thought, to be reflected upon.

original: tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena vividiṣanti brahmacaryeṇa tapasā śraddhayā yajñenānāśakena ceti māṇḍūkeyaḥ /
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena vividiṣanti brahmacaryeṇa tapasā śraddhayā yajñena anāśakena ca iti māṇḍūkeyaḥ
translated: They seek to know that through the recitation of the Vedas, celibacy, austerity, faith, sacrifice, and fasting, says Māṇḍūkeya.

original: tasmād evaṃvic chānto dānta uparatas titikṣuḥ śraddhāvitto bhūtvātmany evātmānaṃ paśyed iti māṇḍavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt evaṃvid śāntaḥ dāntaḥ uparataḥ titikṣuḥ śraddhā vittaḥ bhūtvā ātmani eva ātmānam paśyet iti māṇḍavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, one who is such, tranquil, self-controlled, restrained, patient, and endowed with faith, should see the Self in the Self alone, says Mandavya.

original: yo 'yaṃ vijñānamayaḥ puruṣaḥ prāṇeṣu sa eṣa neti nety ātmā na gṛhya idaṃ brahmedaṃ kṣatram ime devā ime vedā ime lokā imāni sarvāṇi bhūtānīdaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ yam vijñāna mayaḥ puruṣaḥ prāṇeṣu saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā na gṛhyaḥ idam brahma idam kṣatram ime devāḥ ime vedāḥ ime lokāḥ imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni idam
translated: This person consisting of consciousness, who is in the vital breaths, he is indeed not this, not that. The Self is not grasped. This is Brahman, this is the Kshatriya, these are the gods, these are the Vedas, these are the worlds, these are all beings.

original: sarvaṃ yad ayam ātmā /
analyzed: sarvam yat ayam ātmā
translated: This is all that is, namely this Self.

original: sa eṣa tat tvam asīty ātmāvagamyo 'haṃ brahmāsmīti /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa tat tvam asi iti ātmā avagamyaḥ ham brahma asmi iti
translated: That is you. You are that. The Self is to be realized. I am Brahman.

original: tad etad brahmāpūrvam aparam anaparam anantaram abāhyam ayam ātmā brahma sarvānubhūr ity anuśāsanam iti yājñavalkyaḥ /
analyzed: tat etat brahma apūrvam aparam anaparam anantaram abāhyam ayam ātmā brahma sarva anubhūḥ iti anuśāsanam iti yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: This Brahman is without beginning and end, without anything beyond or within. This Self is Brahman, the all-pervading experiencer. This is the instruction, says Yajnavalkya.

original: tad etan nāputrāya nānantevāsine vā brūyād iti /
analyzed: tat etat na a putrāya na an antevāsine vā brūyāt iti
translated: This should not be told to one who has no son or to one who does not have a student living with him.

original: ya imām adbhiḥ parigṛhītāṃ vasumatīṃ dhanasya pūrṇāṃ dadyād idam eva tato bhūya idam eva tato bhūya ity anuśāsanam /
analyzed: yaḥ imām adbhiḥ parigṛhītām vasumatīm dhanasya pūrṇām dadyāt idam eva tatas bhūyaḥ idam eva tatas bhūyaḥ iti anuśāsanam
translated: One who would give this earth surrounded by water, full of wealth, this is greater than that, this is greater than that, this is the instruction.

original: tām etām upaniṣadaṃ vedaśiro na yathā kathaṃ cana vadet /
analyzed: tām etām upaniṣadam vedaśiraḥ na yathā katham cana vadet
translated: One should not speak of this Upanishad, the head of the Vedas, in any way.

original: tad etad ṛcābhyuditam //
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuditam
translated: This is declared in the Rig Veda:

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake trayodaśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake trayodaśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: ṛcāṃ mūrdhānaṃ yajuṣām uttamāṅgam /
analyzed: ṛcām mūrdhānam yajuṣām uttamāṅgam
translated: The head of the Ṛgveda, the supreme part of the Yajurveda,

original: sāmnāṃ śiro 'tharvāṇāṃ muṇḍamuṇḍam /
analyzed: sāmnām śiraḥ tharvāṇām muṇḍa muṇḍam
translated: the head of the Sāmaveda, and the shaven-headed of the Atharvaveda.

original: nādhīte 'dhīte vedam āhus tam ajñam /
analyzed: na adhīte dhīte vedam āhuḥ tam ajñam
translated: They call him ignorant who has not studied the Veda, or who has studied it but does not know the meaning.

original: śiraś chitvāsau kurute kabandham //
analyzed: śiraḥ chitvā asau kurute kabandham
translated: He who cuts off his head makes a headless trunk of himself.

original: sthāṇur ayaṃ bhārahāraḥ kilābhūt /
analyzed: sthāṇuḥ ayam bhāra hāraḥ kila abhūt
translated: This one was indeed a pillar, a bearer of burdens.

original: adhītya vedaṃ na vijānāti yo 'rtham /
analyzed: adhītya vedam na vijānāti yaḥ ṛtham
translated: He who has studied the Veda but does not know the meaning,

original: yo 'rthajña it sakalaṃ bhadram aśnute /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛtha jñaḥ id sakalam bhadram aśnute
translated: he who knows the meaning enjoys all that is good.

original: nākam eti jñānavidhūtapāpmā //
analyzed: nākam eti jñāna vidhūta pāpmā
translated: He goes to heaven, his sins destroyed by knowledge.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake caturdaśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake caturdaśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter in the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: atha vaṃśaḥ /
analyzed: atha vaṃśaḥ
translated: Now the genealogy.

original: oṃ namo brahmaṇe nama ācāryebhyaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ brahmaṇe namaḥ ācāryebhyaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to Brahman, salutations to the teachers.

original: guṇākhyāc chāṅkhāyanād asmābhir adhītam /🔽guṇākhyaś śāṅkhāyanaḥ kahoḷāt kauṣītakeḥ /
analyzed: guṇa ākhyāt śāṅkhāyanāt asmābhiḥ adhītam  guṇākhyaḥ śāṅkhāyanaḥ kahoḷāt kauṣītakeḥ
translated: This has been studied by us from Guṇākhya Śāṅkhāyana.🔽Guṇākhya Śāṅkhāyana from Kahola Kauṣītakeya.

original: kahoḷaḥ kauṣītakir uddālakād āruṇeḥ /
analyzed: kahoḷaḥ kauṣītakiḥ uddālakāt āruṇeḥ
translated: Kahola Kauṣītakeya from Uddālaka Āruṇi.

original: uddālaka āruṇiḥ priyavratāt saumāpeḥ /🔽priyavrataḥ saumāpiḥ somapāt /
analyzed: uddālakaḥ āruṇiḥ priyavratāt saumāpeḥ  priyavrataḥ saumāpiḥ somapād
translated: Uddālaka Āruṇi from Priyavrata Saumāpi.🔽Priyavrata Saumāpi from Soma.

original: somapaḥ saumāt prātiveśyāt /
analyzed: somapaḥ saumāt prātiveśyāt
translated: Soma from Saumya Prativetsyā.

original: saumaḥ prātiveśyaḥ prativeśyāt /
analyzed: saumaḥ prātiveśyaḥ prativeśyāt
translated: Saumya Prativetsyā from Prativetsyā.

original: prativeśyo bṛhaddivāt /
analyzed: prativeśyaḥ bṛhaddivāt
translated: Prativetsyā from Bṛhaddīva.

original: bṛhaddivaḥ sumnayoḥ /🔽sumnayur uddālakāt /
analyzed: bṛhaddivaḥ sumnayoḥ  sumnayuḥ uddālakāt
translated: From Bṛhaddīva, the two Sumnayus.🔽Sumnaya from Uddālaka.

original: uddālako viśvamanasaḥ /🔽viśvamanā vyaśvāt /
analyzed: uddālakaḥ viśvamanasaḥ  viśvamanāḥ vyaśvāt
translated: Uddālaka from Viśvamanas.🔽Viśvamanas from Vyāśva.

original: vyaśvaḥ sākamaśvāt /
analyzed: vyaśvaḥ sākamaśvāt
translated: Vyāśva from Sākamāśva.

original: sākamaśvo devarātāt /
analyzed: sākamaśvaḥ devarātāt
translated: Sākamāśva from Devarāta.

original: devarāto viśvāmitrāt /
analyzed: devarātaḥ viśvāmitrāt
translated: Devarāta from Viśvāmitra.

original: viśvāmitra indrāt /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ indrāt
translated: Viśvāmitra from Indra.

original: indraḥ prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ prajāpateḥ
translated: Indra from Prajāpati.

original: prajāpatir brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Prajāpati from Brahmā.

original: brahmā svayaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: brahmā svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: Brahmā is self-existent.

original: namo brahmaṇe namo brahmaṇe //🔽iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake pañcadaśamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ brahmaṇe namaḥ brahmaṇe  iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyake pañcadaśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Salutations to Brahman, salutations to Brahman.🔽Thus ends the fifteenth chapter of the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.

original: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyakaṃ samāptam //
analyzed: iti śāṅkhāyanāraṇyakam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Śāṅkhāyana Aranyaka.
